187501.name: Master Solo Engines
187501.description:
Designer's Description:

Master Solo Engines gives you a better understanding of solo engines. Giving you the freedom to make better use of them in your solo RPG sessions.

You'll learn:

How the GM / PC Turn framework can make asking questions easier.
The difference between shallow and deep questions and how each can enhance your game.
When to ask multiple questions and how to stop asking too many questions.
How looking at context and purpose alters the results of the answers.
Why taking time to craft your questions and answers makes your games more interesting.




This is part of the Frustration to Freedom series. FtF covers the topics that frustrate solo roleplayers giving them freedom within their games.

boardgamepublisher: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)
187502.description:
Publisher's summary:

忍ジャン!! (Ninjan!!) is a children's card game from さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie). "This game is a fighting game between ninja. Young children can play this game. It is possible to rise quickly." The game is for two players.

The time is the Sengoku (Warring States) period. While Busho military commanders engage in fierce battles on history's center stage, ninjas risk their lives for their commanders. When two ninjas meet, one of them must die, because whoever discovers their identify shall not stay alive.

This is a one-on-one ninja battle game. The player on the offense plays Attack cards from his hand. The player on the defense guards against the attack with his cards. The player who manages to exhaust his opponent's Strength deck wins the game.
187502.name: Ninjan!!

187504.description:
"It is known that from time to time Orcs perform races with steam cars, aka "Goratank Racing". Racers, riding pimped machines, run till death on a crazy race. The winner gets a championship title, a special "Trophy-Gun", fame and money. This competition is also known as "Orcorrida" (SpeedOrc)." - Lyzarbhi Chronicles

Orcorrida is a card game where you´re an Orc on a deadly race that takes place at the Fields of Gore World. Prove your courage and driving skills on a competition where anything goes. During the race, Orcs release all their wildness and skills with killing machines in an exciting competition on tracks through Orc Island.

It's a 3-6 player game where laughthing and fun is guaranteed.

Game Components: 54 cards and 1 "pole position" token

Game comes in 3 languages: Portuguese, English and Orcish

You're an orc racer and you have to play "road cards" to create your "path for victory". You start with 5 cards and use one of them at a time to make an action. You may have an "Orcrook" card to difficult the race: missiles, mines, bump actions or turbo to increase car speed are some of the tricks you can use against the other players.
"Road cards" have point values and you must play them to run for victory. The player with the biggest number of points is the Champion of this crazy race.
187504.name: Orcorrida

187505.name: The Apple of Her Eye
187505.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for novice characters

Survival in the world under the shadow of the Demon Lord is difficult, not just for risk-taking adventurers and would-be heroes, but for ordinary folk faced daily with threats of starvation, illness, and madness. When small sacrifices can ensure the survival, even prosperity, of an entire community, aren’t they worth making? Some might think so, or at least tell themselves as much in the small hours of the night, when the distant cries of those sacrifices echo in their memories.

The Apple of Her Eye is an adventure for novice characters in which they come across a prosperous village with a thriving apple orchard and a terrible secret. The group completes the adventure when they confront the wicked faerie responsible for the village’s plight.

187506.name: The Rock Awakens
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
187506.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Level 4 Adventure on The Purple Planet for DCC RPG

Among the Purple Planet's irradiated dunes, a freakish ebon cliff crests over a mysterious city. Even giant death orms avoid this place, which hides colossal creatures, deadly quakes, a powerful relic, and certain peril…when The Rock Awakes!

This digest-sized adventure module is compatible with the setting presented in DCC #84: Peril on the Purple Planet, and is the perfect size to be stored in your boxed set!

187507.name: Wielder Mythic Path
187507.description:
From publisher blurb:

The initial release of the Book of Beyond series is here: The Wielder Mythic Path!

The Wielder mythic path is for characters who focus on the bond with their special items to a degree that they unlock the deepest powers of their chosen item. Not only using it faster, more efficiently or more powerfully but also using it as a window into power itself--unlocking deeper psychic resonances, mnemonic sorceries, and creative applications of its original abilities.

187508.name: The Castle Triskelion Mega-Dungeon: Inner Ward Ground Level
187508.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The long awaited next segment of the Castle Triskelion mega-dungeon is now available: the Inner Ward Ground Level!

This module features 67 encounter areas, plus new monsters such as the Jousting Wasp and Glutinous Gunge, as well as known monsters like the Talon Goblin and Cadaver Spiders.

187509.name: House Of Mirrors
187509.description:
From publisher blurb:

MURDER! MURDER MOST FOUL! People in glasses houses should not throw stones, but which of the suspects is the guilty one?

An adventure written for APLs 3, 5 and 7 (character levels 3-8).

187510.name: And Everything Nice
187510.description:
From publisher blurb:

Banditry is something a too common occurrence in the ArchDespotate. The long gauntleted arm of the law is swift, brutal, and merciless. When rumors of sabotage and commercial interference between the great houses may lead to more violence, impartial justice must be dispensed.

An adventure written for APLs 3, 5 and 7 (character levels 3-8).

187511.name: The Castle Triskelion Mega-Dungeon: New Materials Volume 02
187511.description:
From the introduction:

This document is the second supplement for the Castle
Triskelion mega-dungeon. In the following sections you'll
find new monsters, new magic items, new mundane
items, and new campaign specific information.

Note that each module (segment) in the Castle Triskelion
saga notes which supplements and modules are required
to use it.

187512.name: The Bruiser (Base Class)
187512.description:
From publisher blurb:

Classes that focus on unarmed attacks seem to rely on the standard goto Monk class with its oriental flavor. The Brawler takes it a step closer to a traditional pugilistic theme, but still relies on the standard monk abilities including flurry of blows and AC bonus. The Bruiser offers another version of a head bashing brute that relies on his hands to take out his opponents, focusing both on unarmed attacks and grappling.

187513.name: Blatto
187513.description:
From publisher blurb:

It came from outer space... Blatto!

A Power Level 12 Renegade, the thing called Blatto inspires terror wherever it creeps! Manitou is an iconic being in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Blatto is designated "Red" for its alien origins. The truth of this alien castaway is that it is an alien even among its own species. As a true outsider, it may be possible for your heroes to win its trust and make it an ally, but this will not be easy. This is an alien on the run from humans and its own kind alike, and it has had no end of bad luck in trying to make friends on Earth. On the other hand, if your heroes make an enemy of Blatto, they may find themselves facing a threat with the potential to wipe out the human race!

187514.name: Weisse Schaedel
187514.description:
From publisher blurb:

Klaue is a FOOL!

A powerful member of the SS, Ludvig Weisse, demanded that he be the first to become a German ubermensch. Not caring that Doctor Jeste's formula was not yet tested, he consumed the potion that transformed him into the twisted and horrific Weisse Schaedel (PL 9).

Where once he was merely cruel, now he was a true monster. Assigned to, but not respecting, Hauptman Klaue, Weisse struck out on his own after WW2.

187515.name: Zooscape
187515.description:
The animals have escaped from the zoo, and it's up to the zookeepers to get everyone back in their cages — but lots of things can happen while you're chasing critters...

In Zooscape, originally released as Curio Collectors (はんか通骨董市), you must prove yourself the best zookeeper by rounding up animals worth the most points, but remember that all the animals need enough space in their cage to stay happy! Shove too many in one cage, and they'll be worth almost nothing to you.

In each round, someone deals a line of twelve cards face up on the table; each card depicts an animal (a curio in the original version) along with a point value and a limit. The starting player splits the line in two by choosing a dividing point. Each player holds two cards showing the left or right group, and each player chooses, then simultaneously reveals which group of cards they want. If only one player chooses a side, they take all the cards in that group and add them to their personal tableau. If a side is chosen by more than one player, however, then one of the players who chose it splits that group into two smaller groups, then everyone who originally chose this group secretly votes again for which group they want. This process repeats with each group until either each player has taken some number of cards or groups have been reduced to single cards and two or more players are still voting to take them; in this case, those single cards are placed in a special pile. At the start of a round, the starting player adds a special card to the line-up and whoever wins this card collects all of the animals in this special pile.

Players complete three rounds this way, then score points. If a group of cards has exceeded the limit on it — say, by collecting four cards when the limit is three — then the owner of these cards scores only 1 point per card instead of the point value for each card. Some cards in the game allow you to remove cards from your collection, possibly allowing you to stay under the limit and score more points. You might also start trying not to win cards so as not to spoil the value of what you've already collected. (In Curio Collectors, you would effectively crash the market value for an item by trying to sell too many of them at one time.)

Whoever has the most points wins!

187516.name: Sorcerer King
187516.description:
A NEW KIND OF FANTASY STRATEGY GAME

Sorcerer King is a new direction for strategy game design, pitting the player against a single overwhelmingly powerful enemy instead of a set of evenly matched factions racing for abstract victory conditions.

Think of the Sorcerer King as the evil mage who already won the last traditional game. He has already conquered the world. His enemies (including you) are scattered, their armies broken and cities torn down. His dark minions have free reign to terrorize the survivors everywhere except a few tiny outposts of civilization (like the one you start in) too insignificant to crush.

EXPANDING YOUR KINGDOM

What do you know, there was another one of those darn cataclysms. It's up to you to rebuild a kingdom that can stand up to the bad guys.

You'll need to clear out monsters and bandits with heroes and armies, then send pioneers to build cities on arable land and outposts to claim outlying resources.

Expanding your kingdom via pioneers is vital, and should be one of your highest priorities.

EXPLORING THE LAND

The landscape is dotted with a random selection of the hundreds of quests in Sorcerer King. Completing them grants you crafting components, lore for researching new spells, new units, magical artifacts, and can even increase or decrease the Doomsday Counter.

If you see something interesting on the map, chances are you should explore it and see what it is. At the very least, you'll probably get a chuckle out of the writing - Chris Bucholz of Cracked.com writes all of our quests, and he's a funny guy.

EXTERMINATING THE MONSTERS

Battles in Sorcerer King are quick and to the point. Nearly every unit in the game has a special ability, from Tandis' sweep attack that hits all adjacent enemies to the Stalker's deadly maul, which hits over and over again until dodged.

Your sovereign can cast spells to help your forces out. A quick heal or weak summoned skeleton might give your armies the edge in the early game, but later on calling down devastating blizzards or walls of living flame can practically win battles by themselves.

SAVING THE WORLD

The Sorcerer King is trying to destroy the shards. Stop him, or it's the literal end of the world.

Each shard destroyed by the Sorcerer King's forces pushes the Doomsday Counter forward. If it fills up, it's game over.

Complete quests in benevolent ways to lower the Doomsday Counter and delay the Sorcerer King's victory, and defend the shards as best you can to keep the assault at bay.

FACING THE SORCERER KING

There is only one way to win in Sorcerer King: You must defeat him in battle. Naturally, it's easier said than done.

First, you must find his two lieutenants. Don't worry, you can't miss the enormous fire and ice demons roaming the landscape. Bringing lots of friends and a full mana bank to any confrontation with the lieutenants is highly recommended.

Once you've bested both lieutenants, you must fight your way to the heart of the Sorcerer King's domain. Even more friends and as much mana as you can possibly scrounge together are a good idea at this point.

CRAFTING

Crafting is critical in Sorcerer King. Killing monsters and completing quests gives you crafting materials, which you can turn into everything from basic chainmail to epic flaming swords.

Both heroes and regular units can use crafted items. A fully equipped unit can be several times more effective than a bare one.

Source: The Game Website.

187517.name: Alemungula
187517.description:
From Mancala World:

Alemungula is a mancala game played by the Wetawit (formerly spelled Wetaweat) in Ethiopia, around the towns of Asosa and Beni Sangul, towards the Sudan border. Wetawit is an ethnic group in Ethiopia and Sudan. They speak Berta, a Nilo-Saharan language. The population of this group is about 248,000.

The game is played mainly by youngsters, though sometimes also by adults in their leisure time. It is closely related to Um el Bagara ("the cow game") which is played by the Baggara in northern Sudan. However, Alemungula offers bigger challenges because singletons may also be moved.

Alemungula was first described by the ethiopist Richard Pankhurst in 1971. The game was implemented by Arty Sandler for online play at igGameCenter on December 19, 2010.

Rules

Alemungula is played on a wooden board which consists of 2x5=10 holes known as tisiya alemungula ("alemungula wood"), while the holes are called ful alemungula. Play is begun with five stones in each hole.

At his turn, a player picks up all the contents of one of his holes and then distributes, one by one, the stones into the following holes, the direction depending on the hole chosen. Moves from either of a player's two left-hand holes are made in clockwise direction, moves from either of the player's two right-hand holes are made in an anti-clockwise direction, and moves from the center hole may be made in either direction. The move is finished after a single lap.

A singleton which is played into an empty hole of the opponent's side, that is either the last or the first hole of the opponent's row), may not be played back in the next move.

If the last stone is dropped in one of the opponent's holes and makes a two or a four, these stones are captured. Should one or more of the opponent's holes immediately preceding this on the line of play, also have been increased to two or four stones these will likewise be captured.

The captured stones are removed from the board and stored.

The game ends when a player has no legal move. Each player then captures the stones remaining on his side.

The winner is the player who captured the greater number of stones during the game. If both players captured the same number the game is a draw.

187518.name: Yoga Cards
187518.description: Can you stand on your shoulders or hold a steady stance like a warrior? Increase flexibility and focus as you practice 48 yoga poses in this fun and simple card game. Your goal in Yoga Cards: Be the first player to correctly hold seven yoga poses that meet your mission and you win!

187519.name: Memory Yoga
187519.description:
Your Goal: Collect the most pairs of matching Yoga Pose Tiles.

Beginner (Ages 3 and up)
Learn yoga poses as you search for matching pairs. Find the most matching pairs and - YOU WIN!

Advanced (Ages 6 and up)
After you find a matching pair, perform the illustrated yoga pose. Correctly perform the most yoga poses and - YOU WIN!

187520.description:
The second title in the Blood Before Richmond series recreates the Battle of Glendale, and its artillery-only side-show, White Oak Swamp.

The Union host is heading for Malvern Hill, a superior defensive position that will allow them to escape destruction and encirclement. If Lee wants to achieve those aims, he needs to cut off that retreat at a place called Glendale, which requires the careful coordination of his generals. But, par for the course, only A.P. Hill and Longstreet seem capable of doing what they’re told: Ben Huger and his men are too busy moonlighting as lumberjacks, while Stonewall Jackson fights a pointless artillery duel at White Oak Swamp - when he’s not napping, anyway. Difficult terrain and fresh, high-quality Union brigades mean that the weary Confederates have their work cut out for them. The optional Galena Rule gives the Union command-control problems of their own to contend with.

Like other titles in the series, a modified 2d6 die roll determines which Confederate divisions activate on a given turn. Divisions that didn't pull there weight are less likely to show up than those that did most of the fighting. It's a simple, clever, and elegant way to recreate the difficulties that Lee had during the Seven Days.

Blood Before Richmond builds on the same "stacks of steps" combat system introduced in Tom Russell's Blood on the Alma (2012). Flipping a counter over when you take a hit just doesn't capture the feel of bloody infantry collisions or the horrifying impact of artillery fire. This system uses step counters stacked beneath an identifying counter to account for brutal attrition and devastating wipe-outs.
187520.name: Blood Before Richmond: Glendale & White Oak Swamp
boardgamefamily: Blood Before Richmond: Battles of the Seven Days

187521.name: Isle of Coconuts
187521.description:
From the publisher:

The Isle of Coconuts is a beautiful place with lush palm trees and teams of Monkeys jumping from tree to tree competing for delicious coconuts. Roll the dice and count your chances to become the biggest team on the palm tree or be smart enough to stay away - either way, you win coconuts. Let your team be the first to gather 10 coconut tokens to win the game.

What They'll Learn

Quick Addition - Each turn, players add up the dice one of three ways to decide where to place Monkeys on palm tree fronds.

Risk vs. Reward - Players pick the palm trees where they can build the biggest team of Monkeys. Stay away from trees where there could be an all-way tie or where you might end up being the smallest team when all the palm tree fronds are full.

187523.name: モリヤウォーズ (Moriya Wars: Episode II)
187523.description: モリヤウォーズ (Moriya Wars: Episode II) is a hidden identity game in which each player has different victory conditions. To keep it from being too easy to determine who is which character based on what you do in the game, players need to select actions based on the dice rolled in the game, so feel free to blame the dice when you "have" to do something that seems like it's leading someone toward victory.

187524.name: Book One: Journeyers
187524.description:
Rêve: the Dream Ouroboros Book One: Journeyers

User summary:

The commercial core book is comprised of three "books". This product is the first "book" offered as a free download (based on the game's 2nd Edition). The contents are the same as the commercial core product's first approximate third. This product includes complete character generation rules and complete action resolution rules. Note that books two and three were never made available for free though there were published as PDFs for purchase.

187525.name: JunkWars 3020
187525.description:
In JunkWars 3020, the players fight for the control of the battlefield. Holding Objectives and enemy Bases the player raises victory points, when he reaches 12 the game is won.

Each player controls one of the four faction of the game, which is composed by 4 characters, 3 power cards and a deck of 36 battle cards.

In each turn the player must assign to his characters unit tokens, which are divided in infantry, artillery and gears. The different combination of unit tokens enable the character to perform different attacks, activating battlecards. In this way the player can defeat enemy characters and gain control of the field.

187526.name: Ringmaster
187526.description:
User summary:

Ringmaster is a niche genre game that simulates showy professional wrestling. The rules primarily are intended to allow the creation of a variety of wrestlers, from Megastar to Monster Heel, and the simulation of a variety of acrobatic wrestling maneuvers. Characters have Background, Attributes, Height, Weight, and Traits (derived attributes). Characters may also have Merits (advantages) and/or Flaws (disadvantages). Characters track Prestige through several ranks.

Wrestling (combat) in the game involves a series of exchanges of Maneuvers. The game presents a lengthy list of Maneuvers and descriptions. Wrestling primarily involves Attribute Checks using D100 against Attribute, attempting to "roll under" the target. An unmodified roll of 01-05 is an Ace while 96-00 is a Botch. The wrestling rules, forming the obvious focus of the entire game, can become quite complex as character utilize a chain of maneuvers with various outcomes.

The campaign portion of the game deals primarily with rankings, earnings, skills development, managers, and other aspects of a typical wrestler's daily life.

187527.description:
The Buildings uses the gameplay found in Sky Scrapers, but creates new goals for new playing areas.

In each game, you start with pieces of the two players on the game board. Each turn, a player moves one of their own stacks a number of spaces equal to the height of the stack, stacking it onto of another stack. A stack is owned by the player whose piece is on top.

In the original Sky Scrapers game, included in this set, whoever has the most stacks that contain at least four pieces wins the game. A different game board crowns the player who has created the tallest stack. A third game board gives the win to whoever controls more of the six inner spaces on the game board.
187527.name: The Buildings

187528.name: Moon-Sun-Angel
boardgamepodcastepisode: Hearty Health Hospital
OrcaCon and the Games of 2016
boardgameversion: Japanese second edition (18mm) - Cat World (Nekoten ねこの天使)
Japanese second edition (18mm) - Japanesque (和風絵揃)
187528.description:
Moon-Sun-Angel includes sixteen cubes, eight each in two colors, with each cube featuring the moon, sun and angel on three sides and having blank faces on the other three. Players takes turns placing one cube in the playing area, either on the game board or on another cube.

If a player can create a row of four cubes that feature the same symbol or color, that player wins. Alternately, a player can create two rows of three cubes to win.

After a successful launch at the Tokyo Game Market in November 2015, a new edition was produced in January 2016 under the name e-SOLO-e (絵揃), which is a Japanese word that means "match symbols". Three editions were produced, Spiritual (a copy of the original Moon-Sun_Angel edition), Japanesque (和風絵揃), and Cat World (Nekoten ねこの天使). The last had artwork by Shukoko Yamamoto based on her artwork of Cat Angels.

187529.name: Bushido: The Card Game
187529.description:
A Samurai push-your-luck, set collection game for 2-6 players. Take to the Dojo and Roll dice, allocating them to the available Virtues. Learn enough Virtues of the Bushido Code to impress one of the Daimyo in order to win!

For twelve years the Province of Tosa has been blessed with peace and prosperity. Peace and prosperity that has been won through valiant battle and sacrifice that has left Tosa with little army yet still what remains defends the earned prosperity. Until sea faring invades lay siege to Kochi, a capital port for Tosa and threatens this lasting peace. With the invaders not willing to negotiate; the Shogun orders his many Daimyo to travel Tosa in search for recruits to train in order to bolster the dwindling ranks of Samurai for the inevitable military confrontation. 

Bushido, The Card Game is an interesting blend of push your luck and strategy. Each roll of the die will leave you with a decision, collect virtues which are needed to win, or activate Daimyo abilities to alter the game in your advantage. Either decision, however small, will ultimately lead to your victory or demise.

Bushido, The Card Game doesn't lack in "take that" gameplay. Many of the Virtue cards dynamically alter the game when collected. Focus tokens can force a player to reroll any die result at any time - and each of the Daimyo have a special ability to help or hinder training!

Compete as samurai potentials to be the first player recruited!

187530.name: RIP: Roleplaying the Infinite Possibilities
187530.description:
User summary:

RIP is a generic, universal system that can be adapted to almost any genre of traditional role-playing. The game is a rules-light structure that assumes a significant amount of Game Master input and development in a specific genre before it will support a campaign.

Characters are generated from a Character Point pool which are used to buy Attributes, Skills, and Background Options. A "normal human being" can be built for five points; characters start with about 20 points. Characters have Attributes (Strength, Endurance, Agility, Awareness, Willpower, ans Social. Attributes have Levels ranging from -2 to +2 with 0 being average. Special Attributes may be added to support specific genres. Skills represent learned or natural abilities; Skills have a Level ranging from 0 to 4. Background Options give characters a diverse range of possible benefits.

187531.name: Syndicate V: The Corporate Future
187531.description:
From the Introduction:

Syndicate is a fast-paced, simple role playing game of the near future. Life in near future is cheap and short, and players must always be careful and on the edge. Syndicate was originally meant for realistic cinematic campaigns, but is good for any campaign with need for fast realistic system. Cinematic does not mean that players cannot die. They die, and very easily. Cinematic in Syndicate means that players can make feats typical to action movies and is not hit as easily as common folk, making the game session more like action movies than realistic real-life stories.

User summary:

Syndicate V: The Corporate Future is a Cyberpunk setting developed around the RIP game system. Prior editions of the setting were similar.

187532.name: RIP Fantasy
187532.description:
User summary:

RIP Fantasy presents a developed, realistic fantasy setting adapted to the RIP rules system. The setting presents two parallel worlds--the Normal World and the Spirit World. Characters move between them by projecting Avatars. The setting includes a Bestiary and a section on Magic. Earlier versions of the setting are preserved online and show the gradual development of the product.

187533.name: Hunters
187533.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the year 2003. We live in a parallel world to that of your own, and it is a much darker place. Shadows are darker, buildings rise to the skies, monsters stalk people, and the place is paranoid and grim.

In the dark alley something moves. The predators of the night, vampires, werewolves and other supernatural creatures stalk the human population and each other and expand their grip over the human population.

But now it is time to strike back. An unofficial and secret organization has started a war against all unnatural creatures with one simple goal: total extermination.

User summary:

Hunters presents a developed dark science fantasy setting adapted to the RIP rules system.

187534.name: To Hellion X and Back
187534.description:
From publisher blurb:

The scenarios are ideal for one shots, and include pre-generated characters, or can be used to start off a campaign.

To Hellion X and Back

In this pulpy science fiction scenario for Fate Core, the crew of the starship Hussar must rescue a scientist from a doomed planet, in a tale of desperation and a race against time. The remaining infrastructure is literally falling to pieces, and people are stranded there. The system's star is about to explode!

The scenario is ideal for a one shot, and includes pre-generated characters, or can be used to start off a campaign.

187535.name: The God Under the Mountain
187535.description:
From publisher blurb:

The God Under the Mountain is a fantasy tale with a dark ages fantasy feel and a smear of grime. It features a dragon and its twisted servants, and a village that more or less prospers under the dragon's shadow, albeit at a price. For some the price has become too much to bear. But who has the boldness and the skill to act?

The scenario is ideal for a one shot, and include pre-generated characters, or can be used to start off a campaign.

187536.name: To Hellion X and Back / The God Under the Mountain
187536.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is the omnibus edition of two Fate Core scenarios from Smart Party Publishing, To Hellion X and Back and The God Under the Mountain. They share a theme of fiery disaster. The scenarios are ideal for one shots, and include pre-generated characters, or can be used to start off a campaign.

To Hellion X and Back

In this pulpy science fiction scenario, the crew of the starship Hussar must rescue a scientist from a doomed planet, in a tale of desperation and a race against time. The remaining infrastructure is literally falling to pieces, and people are stranded there. The system's star is about to explode!

The God Under the Mountain

The God Under the Mountain is a fantasy tale with a dark ages fantasy feel and a smear of grime. It features a dragon and its twisted servants, and a village that more or less prospers under the dragon's shadow, albeit at a price. For some the price has become too much to bear. But who has the boldness and the skill to act?

187537.name: B-Sieged: Heroes Set 2
187537.description:
B-Sieged: Heroes Set 2 introduces three brand-new Heroes to defend the Citadel of Modhelm: Waldo, the Monk; Kara, the Seer; and Rolf, the Executioner!
These three heroes are part of the "Defender Level Kickstarter Rewards".

187538.name: Hvězdokupy: Hra plná hvězd
187538.description:
Hvězdokupy: Hra plná hvězd (Czech for "Star Clusters: A Game Full of Stars") is an abstract logical game for 2 to 6 players. The players of this game become astronomers trying to find a given constellation. The goal is to be the first player to find the given constellation.

The game is played on a shared 10x10 grid board, which represents the night sky. Each player is assigned a unique constellation to look for on the board. During the game, players take turns to place stars on the grid based on dice rolls. The number rolled on the dice shows with how many stars the currently placed star must neighbour. The dice is 8-sided and each number is part of a pair, so the player may choose between 2 different results. The first player to find/construct their given constellation among the stars wins the game. Shared victories are possible.

A remarkable feature of the game is that the major game pieces glow in the dark, making the game suitable for playing at night, which contributes to its theme.

187539.name: Звездные войны. Война клонов
187539.description:
A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away Clone Wars raged. Stand on the path of light or dark side of the Force and turn the tide of the war. Each player can choose one of four characters: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Anakin Skywalker, Count Dooku and Asajj Ventress. Each character has their own abilities and the ability to wield power. Moving on the playing field - circuit galaxy - players will perform the tasks of their allies, and fight each other for influence over the planets and military bases. With the game cards and dice the player can influence the other characters enter the battlefield and more troops to crush the enemy's defenses.

Contents:


- High detailed play field
- 4 player's cards
- 128 game cards
- Count Dooku figure
- Obi-Wan Kenobi figure
- Anakin Skywalker figure
- Asajj Ventress figure
- 60 game tokens
- Dices (1-6)
- Board game manuals

187540.name: RORPS: Really Odd Role Playing System
rpg: RORPS: Really Odd Role Playing System
187540.description:
User summary:

RORPS is a comedy game system that is intended as a playable satire. The mechanics are usable, if bizarre. The 2nd Edition of the game is apparently the first actual edition; the 2nd Edition title appears to have been used to make the system seem more credible. The game uses idiosyncratic language to refer to standard role-playing terms: CowMaster (Game Master), Ouch Points (Hit Points), Poopy Stuffs (Disadvantages), and Stuff Points (Experience Points) are samples.

Characters select a Race and then generate Traits (Abilities) - the game has four: Buffness, Breath, Hair Color, and Bowel Control. Characters next select Skills and Poopy Stuffs (disadvantages). The game presents a resolution mechanic (because "all games have rules") of rolling a dice pool against a Difficult Check Number. The number of dice in the pool is determined by the Attribute being tested. Combat works in a similar manner; successful hits deliver Ouch Points. The game concludes with "Pointless Rules" (movement rates, throwing ranges, etc.) to keep "some roleplayers" happy. One of the pointless rules presents a (slightly) more complex combat system.

187541.name: The Binding of Isaac: Afterbirth
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee
2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Best DLC/Expansion of the Year Nominee
187541.description:
User Summary

An expansion to The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth. Afterbirth adds new items, bosses, endings, new room shapes, and an all-new player character: Lilith. There is also a new game mode called Greed Mode, which focuses on surviving waves of enemies one after another. Greed Mode also contains its own unique final boss.

187543.name: Light, Dark, Underdark!
187543.description:
From the introduction:

This month’s installment of Unearthed Arcana features a number of new character options ideal for an Underdark campaign.
Two new fighting styles for fighters, paladins, and rangers focus on close-quarters combat, whether defending allies or unleashing deadly ranged attacks at nearby foes. Both styles are handy for dungeon delving and for battles in the confined environments of the Underdark.
The Deep Stalker is a new ranger archetype, scouting out Underdark threats using a combination of cunning and magic. Deep Stalkers use magic and other tricks to infiltrate Underdark settlements and spy on their inhabitants. After gathering intelligence on growing threats to the surface world, they engage in hit-and-run battles to eliminate those threats.
The shadow sorcerer is a creepy spellcaster who commands the power of darkness. Though not always native to the Underdark, these sorcerers are often drawn to the dismal gloom of the world below.
Finally, the Undying Light is a new warlock patron. By forging a compact with the energy of the Positive Plane, a warlock vows to bring light into the darkest reaches of the world.

187544.name: Dead Forest
187544.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 276th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a hollow way in a dead forest.

The map is 14 x 20 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 4 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2880 pixels in size at 144dpi.

187545.name: Romeo and/or Juliet
187545.description:
"Plays weren't meant to be read. They were meant... to be played."

Author's Preview Description:

The Deets


It is called Romeo and/or Juliet
It is a choose-your-own-path version of a play you may have heard of called "Romeo And Juliet" by one "William Shakespeare"
It is coming out in only a few months, on June 7th, 2016!
Like To Be or Not To Be, each ending will be illustrated by tons of terrific artists - even more than last time!!
Unlike To Be or Not To Be, Romeo and/or Juliet (incredibly!) has MORE choices, MORE links, MORE story, MORE playable characters, and MORE ways to die!
also, waaaaay more ways to SMOOCH
It's being published by a major publisher (Riverhead books, a division of Penguin), which means this book should be available EVERYWHERE :0
ahhhh I'm SO EXCITED

187546.name: Caves of the Kobold Queen (Pathfinder)
187546.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the wild and rocky hills north of the town of Ormkirk, dangerous kobold raiding parties have been striking at travelers and townsfolk alike for several weeks, stealing them away under cover of night from out of their homes. Desperate for help in rescuing the missing people, Ormkirk’s townmaster sent out a call for adventurers to hunt down the raiders and recover the kidnapped men.

WK1 Caves of the Kobold Queen is the first adventure in Cut to the Chase Games’ Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module trilogy, WRATH OF THE KOBOLDS. It is designed for a group of four to six characters levels 1 to 3 (optimized for 2nd-level). The GM should read the module thoroughly before playing to become familiar with the overall plot of the adventure. This module includes the NPC and monster statistics compiled in the appendix along with a random kobold name generator for you to use.

A Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module brought to you by your friends at Cut to the Chase Games!

187549.name: Help Me Fly
187549.description:
User Summary

In this puzzle game, you need to bring power to a toy airplane by connecting it to a battery, using conductive Tetris-like pieces. Bonus stars are awarded by connecting them to the battery as well.

The game contains 90 levels, with the first 60 available for free (the last 30 require an in-app purchase)

187550.description: Irresponsibility is a family friendly card game for 2-4 players. Players take turns either helping Mr Toast be irresponsible by playing fun Green Recreation cards or by saddling your opponents with Red Responsibility cards to keep Mr Toast from having fun. Mr Toast's friends also get in on the action as Buddy cards who add to the score of the Green Recreation cards! You also get to play Gray Action cards which can let you draw more cards, play extra cards or even take over another players position. Lastly are the Yellow No Way cards which stop the effects of the Gray Action cards. The winner is the first person to get to 15 points worth of Recreation & Buddy cards!
187550.name: Irresponsibility: The Mr Toast Card Game

187551.name: Rough Magic
187551.description:
User summary:

Rough Magic uses a light-weight system to present a fast-paced, narrative style role-playing games. Dice are occasionally used to determine magical effects and success but the focus of the game is on a shared narrative creation. Character creation in the game is semi-structured but does not use "stats" or numbers, instead preferring narrative elements that can later be incorporated into play. Numerous sample characters are provided. The rules are coupled to the setting, which is an alternate history World War II era Europe infused with magic and the occult.

187552.name: So Goes The Hare
187552.description:
"So Goes The Hare" - Sometimes referred to as "There Goes The Hare"

Two to four rabbits (each represented by a different color marble) are hunting in a field trying to capture Carrots, Lettuce and Dandelions. Carrots are worth 3 points (Orange Marbles), Lettuce 2 points (Green Marbles) and Dandelions are worth 1 point (Yellow Marbles). The rabbits come in their own unique colors. Rabbits jump like a Knight in Chess and must land on an occupied field, and win the item there. When no more mores can be made, the game ends and the points are totaled. High score wins. Although you can also win by being the last rabbit standing.

187553.name: Rules of Thumb
187553.description:
User summary:

The basic role-playing approach in Rules of Thumb is to resolve all situations through collaborative narration. If this becomes impossible or undesirable, the Narrator (Game Master) will call for a Task Resolution. The Narrator determines a Base Difficulty, applicable modifiers are applied, and the player rolls (usually) 2d10 and compares the result. The rules provide substitute statistics if other dice types are desired ("if players prefer other types of dice").

Characters have Traits and Attributes, but generally character creation is free-form with narrative tags providing characterization and capability. Combat is slightly more detailed in terms of difficulties.

The system as presented is utilized with a post-apocalyptic setting. However, the rules would be usable with any traditional genre.

187554.name: GEA2703
187554.description:
From the foreword:

Welcome to GEA2703, a post-apocalyptic role-play setting. There is no space-travel whatsoever, no aliens, no spaceships, no planet terraforming or colonisation, no hyperspace jumps.

User summary:

GEA2703 was developed as a setting to playtest the Rules of Thumb game. The setting is somewhat uneven though it is not tightly coupled with the game system (it could be used with almost any system, with minor alterations).

187555.name: Shinobigami: Start Book 1
187555.description:
User summary:

The first book in the Shinobigami line. The book contains an exciting replay, "Cutting Off the Darkness," and the rules required to run the game.

187556.name: Shinobigami: Start Book 2
187556.description:
User summary:

The second book in the Shinobigami line. The book contains an exciting replay, "Battle of Blade and Demon," and the following optional rules and material:

- "Normal" characters
- Henchmen
- Sub-clans
- Playing Guide
- sample scenario

187557.name: Shinobigami San
187557.description:
User summary:

The third book in the Shinobigami line. The book contains an exciting replay, "Crucible Story," and the following optional rules and material:

- Boss NPCs
- Enigmas
- More Ninpo
- More Charts

187558.name: Shinobigami Shi
187558.description:

- Backgrounds

187559.name: Shinobigami Ran
187559.description:
User summary:

- Sengoku Jidai setting rules
- Ohgi Modifications

187560.name: Shinobigami Kai
187560.description:
User summary:

The sixth book in the Shinobigami line. The book contains an exciting replay, "Trial of Dead Master," and the following optional rules and material:

- Rebooted setting
- Revised basic rules
- New backgrounds

187561.name: Shinobigami Ryuu
187561.description:
User summary:

- Clan details
- New ninpo and subclans
