187562.name: Shinobigami Aku
187562.description:
User summary:

The eighth book in the Shinobigami line. The book contains an exciting replay, "Devil Ninja Seven," and the following optional rules and material:

- New Sengoku Jidai rules
- More Yoma

187563.name: Borakki Racebook
187563.description:
From the description:

Borakki look like humans, but are powerfully built. An average Borakki stands over 7 feet tall and has a strong back and muscled limbs. Borakki have light skin and thick hair ranging from white to light brown or red.

User summary:

The book provides a single race for use with the Runebearer game.

187564.name: Cobrat Racebook
187564.description:
From the description:

The cobrat are reptilian creatures divided into three subspecies: high cobrat, low cobrat and troglodytes. High cobrat have snakelike bodies between 9-12 foot long and about 18 inches in diameter. They stand between 6 and 7 feet tall, with the rest of their body trailing behind them as they walk. They have thin, but powerful legs and spindly arms that end in four long digits. High cobrat are covered in scales ranging in color from dark green (almost black) to a light tan.

Low cobrat are hulking humanoids that stand 5 feet tall. Their bodies are heavily muscled and powerful. They have scales and their coloration is similar to that of the high cobrat. They look like “lizard men” from other fantasy games.

Troglodytes look very similar to low cobrat. However, they are closer to 8 feet tall and even more powerful. Their scales grow quickly and they are continuously shedding old scales. Often the scales grow too fast and individual scales crowd one another causing them to be crooked.

User summary:

The book provides a single race for use with the Runebearer game.

187565.name: Goblin Racebook
187565.description:
From the description:

Goblins are lanky humanoids between 5-6 feet tall. However, they are stooped, and so look much shorter when compared to humans. Goblins have lean bodies. Their limbs are spindly, but have strong, knotted muscles and knobby joints. They carry almost all of their fat in their waistlines. Thus, many goblins have pronounced potbellies. Goblin skin ranges from gray to olive with varying tones of green or yellow.

User summary:

The book provides a single race for use with the Runebearer game.

187566.name: Grunj Racebook
187566.description:
From the description:

Grunj are furry, humanoids standing between 3.5 and 4.5 feet tall. They have proportions similar to humans. Their fur comes in varying shades of black, white, gray, and brown. Most grunj have single-colored fur, but some have spotted or striped markings. Grunj have snouts instead of noses and short, pointed ears on the top of their heads. To humans, the grunj look like humanoid dogs.

User summary:

The book provides a single race for use with the Runebearer game.

187567.name: Ratling Racebook
187567.description:
From the description:

Ratlings are humanoid rats standing about 5 feet tall. They are slight of build and covered in short course hair with the exception of the face, the palms of the hands, the souls of the feet and their tail. Despite their name this fur varies in colour from brown so dark that it is almost black to a sandy red. Interestingly there are no albino Brown Ratlings as such abominations are killed at birth by their parents, although this is extremely uncommon.

User summary:

The book provides a single race for use with the Runebearer game.

187568.name: Fort Talon
187568.description:
From the description:

Fort Talon is a town of about 3200 inhabitants that lies high in the Terrorbald Mountains, 24 miles south of Jamestown. Fort Talon was founded by the decree of Lord Relequin James in the year 772. At first, the fort was simply a walled garrison designed to protect the mountain passes from goblin and cobrat invaders. In addition, a few small mining operations cropped up to take advantage of the tin and iron in the region.

However, four years ago, prospectors found a large vein of gold. Miners and prospectors of all types have flocked to the town, hoping to stake a claim. In the past four years, the population has increased from 400 to over 3200. The streets are crowded with miners, traders, street vendors, mercenaries, and fortune hunters from all walks of life.

187569.name: Hide and Zeke
187569.description:
From the description:

Hide and Zeke is an adventure for beginning Runebearer players and GMs. In this adventure, the PCs will investigate the disappearance of a group of children and explore an abandoned house. PCs should have skill levels of 8-12 in a mix of skills. Tracking is an extremely useful skill in this adventure, and concealment, investigate, and a high perception score are helpful as well.

187570.name: The Abandoned Guardpost
187570.description:
From the description:

This place was constructed over 200 years ago for a local lord. The guards here would collect tolls from people using the road and watch the surrounding countryside for signs of a hostile force of goblins moving into the lands. As the area became more settled, the need for the post decreased and it was abandoned.

A number of months ago, a small bandit gang took up residence in the post. They traveled the land, attacking merchants and raiding small villages and farmsteads. After their raids, they fled to this place, counting on its remote location to keep them hidden. In the case of attack, the bandits used the tower to give them warning and time to prepare a defense or flee.

187571.name: The Tomb of Markalos
187571.description:
From the description:

The Tomb of Markalos is being opened.

Workers have dug a hole into the hillside almost 12 feet deep to reach the entrance to the tomb. A wooden ladder provides access to the bottom of the pit. A full action must be spent to climb up or down the ladder in combat.

The entrance to the tomb is a stone slab, flanked on either side by two crumbling cone-shaped pillars. The tops of the pillars almost reach ground level and are capped by two badly corroded bronze bowls.

187572.name: The World of Bostonia
187572.description:
From the description:

All people of Bostonia (and presumably of the entire world) are the children of a race of powerful wizards called Ancients. The Ancients were masters of elemental air, fire, water and earth as well as time and space. This power gave them an advanced magical "technology" that permitted the building of huge cities, flying machines, mystic gates and other wonders.

User summary:

The setting document includes history, extensive geography, notable places, religion, and culture. The setting includes details on the races unique to Runebearer.

In addition to the World of Bostonia setting guide, Bostonia Genealogy Tables (6 pages) and Map of the Lands of Bostonia (1 page) are available as separate downloads.

187573.name: s3 (Version 1.0)
187573.description:
User summary:

Characters have Stats (Attributes) that are assigned a Stat Score. The five Stats are Strength, Agility, Health, Intelligence Quotient, Intuition, and Allure. Stat Scores are recorded as "Dice"; an average human Stat Score is D10; "First Class" ability is D16, and so forth--from D2 to D20 by each even number step. The Stat Score is actually determined by rolling 2D5 and doubling the number rolled and converting this to a "Dice". Characters then purchase Skills, each of which has an associated Stat (unfortunately named, and not to be confused with the earlier Stats). The Skill Stat determines modifiers that will be applied when that Skill is used. Combat is handled like a Skill.

187575.name: s3 (Version 1.1)
187575.description:
User summary:

s3 Version 1.1 presents a re-written and cleaned-up set of generic, universal rules. Character creations beings with conceptualization and then follows to Stat (Attributes) and Stat Score generation. Stats include Strength, Agility, Health, Intelligence Quotient, Intuition, Allure, and Essence. Stat Scores are randomly generated but are recorded as a "Dice", ranging from D2 to D10 at every even step; D10 is considered average, Near Perfect is considered D18. Characters next select Skills. Skills have a number called Level, running from 1-20.

Action resolution matches a dice roll with modifier against a Target Number. The die used is determined by the base Stat, the roll is modified by the Skill Level.

187576.name: The World of Sylnae
187576.description:
From the introduction:

The last campaigns took place in Sylnae around 1659, but much has changed and today, one would hardly recognize the places they used to be familiar with.

The old calendar was dropped years ago, shortly after the chaos began. A new calendar was started and today the year is 533, no one is exactly sure how many years passed before the new calendar was adopted but historians theorize that around one thousand years passed.

User summary:

The World of Sylnae is the campaign setting developed for the s3 Version 1.0 rules. It has not been updated for s3 Version 1.1 update. The setting is presented as a series of HTML pages (homepage, geography, theology, people, lexicon, and organizations). Several maps are provided.

187577.name: The Innsmouth Lighthouse
187577.description:
From the module:

Innsmouth Lighthouse is famous for the hundreds of ships it has guided through storms over the years. Many a sailor owes his life to the light from the tower. Last week, that came to an end. The light was extinguished. No word came from the tower. Men were sent. They never came back. Someone has to go and find out what has gone wrong at the lighthouse as a terrible storm is brewing and lives are at stake.

User summary:

This "1 Page Adventure" scenario for Risus was released under a creative commons license.

187578.name: The Spider Caves of Grinok
187578.description:
From the module:

Recently there has been trouble afoot in Grinlok! Prior to your arrival spiders had attacked outlying farms and then a few day ago a suddenly a group of Gobers began attacking merchants along the roads and last night even got brave enough to hit a house on the edge of the town. Along with a few valuables in the house, the Gobers ran off with the mayor’s daughter Miranda and now he is frantic and at his wit’s end. The people are nervous, the people are scared, and the people are looking for someone to help them!

User summary:

This "1 Page Adventure" scenario for Risus was released under a creative commons license.

187579.name: Zombie Tower!
187579.description:
From the module:

This is a four story building in _______(fill in your town). Zombies Apocalypse has happened, your family and friends are gone. You stumbled through town and somehow managed to survive until the following dawn. You hear a strange noise and you sprint to save your life, ending up in the lobby of Zombie Tower!

User summary:

This "1 Page Adventure" scenario for Risus was released under a creative commons license.

187580.name: The Frozen Ruins of Kal-Kamen
187580.description:
From the module:

Kal-Kamen was once a Royal retreat high in the mountains, far from prying eyes. Now hundreds of years later, it is abandoned but rumors float of treasure, and so people (some say "fools") continue to arrive to venture through its dark, cold tunnels. It is a dangerous climb high up to the dungeon way up in the mountain, and no one knows what haunts the halls of the royal retreat now, but so far, no one has returned to talk of it. Will your team end up as the next victim?

User summary:

This "1 Page Adventure" scenario for Risus was released under a creative commons license.

187581.name: Caveman Craig
187581.description:
User Summary

Caveman Craig manages a tribes of hunters, gatherers, and preparers in their jobs of killing dinosaurs and gathering fruit. All Caveman Craig needs to do is demonstrate how to do the job and the cavemen learn to do it. His aim is to expand his borders by attacking the neighbouring tribe. The graphics are simple and jokey but the action is fairly detailed and tends to micromanaging.

187582.name: Antiquus Fabula
187582.description:
From the introduction:

What follows is are additional rules that shall be used in addition to the 'core' Risus, the Anything RPG rules by S. John Ross. A copy of the Risus rules are needed to play.

Why?

I wanted a little more fantasy flavor and 'feel' to my Risus game, I found a few fan created things that I liked, but just didn't fit perfect, so like any other GM I decided to write this and call it mine.

187583.name: Riders of the Pony Express
187583.description:
As riders for the Pony Express, you'll risk life and limb to make a buck in the old west.

Spend 3 weeks in the saddle, claiming parcels and planning your route from Missouri to California and back. Make your deliveries and pick up helpful items along the way.

Riders of the Pony Express uses a unique and tense "count-up" auction to claim parcels every round, and then hazard tiles can spice up the roues between towns, forcing players to stay flexible with their plans.

The rider with the most cash at the end of the game wins!

187584.description:
This Limited Edition expansion adds 14 new cards to the game.

Anomalies (4 cards)
Every time you go back in time, anomalies are added to the game. More anomalies means more variability!

Future (5 cards)
Instead of going back in time, you have the option of going into the future. Futures add a bit more complexity to the game, as each future trip allows you to take a bonus action. If you play the future right, you can unlock some fantastic combinations!

Office (5 cards)
The Office action cards replace the simple Trash action cards in the game. Now, instead of merely removing components in order prevent the loss of points, you can time your actions to gain points.

These cards were included for free for all backers of Loop Inc. on Kickstarter. However, these extras are available for purchase separately. None are Kickstarter-exclusive.
187584.name: Loop Inc.: Expansion Cards

187585.description:
This Limited Edition expansion adds 16 tiles to the game.

Performance Goals (7 tiles)
At the beginning of the game, each player receives one randomly dealt tile as a secret goal, hidden from the other players. Players who have fulfilled the goal listed on their tile score bonus points at the end of the game.

Waste Memo (5 tiles)
At the beginning of the game, one Waste Memo tile is chosen at random. During the game, component penalties no longer simply count as -1 points, but rather carry the penalties indicated on the tile. Components are left face-up in the penalty area to prevent confusion.

Butterfly Effect (4 tiles)
After shuffling these tiles, they are placed, one by one, face down above trip cards, starting with the trip cards that take travelers the furthest back in time. One tile is placed for each player in the game (i.e. in a 3-player game, the three furthest-back trip cards will each have one Butterfly Effect tile placed face-down above them). When that trip card is visited, the player picks up the tile and places it face up above any trip card later in the timeline. No trip card may have more than one tile placed above it. A face-up tile affects both trips on a trip card, and rewards or subtracts points at the end of the game.

These tiles were included for free for all backers of Loop Inc. on Kickstarter. However, these extras are available for purchase separately. None are Kickstarter-exclusive.
187585.name: Loop Inc.: Expansion Tiles

187587.description:
The ancient Greeks from Phocaea urgently want to expand further their domains. They are sailing for the Iberian peninsula to establish a permanent trading spot. In a tiny island close to the northern east coast, the newcomers, will found Emporion, the first great Greek settlement on the peninsula. From there, the well worn will try to increase their fame and fortune by commanding expeditions, trading valuable goods with Athens, competing to win the favor of Gods and promoting the Hellenistic culture throughout the Iberian lands.

Goal
During the game, players buy cards and place them in their play areas. These cards will help players to improve their armies, to build spectacular and diverse constructions, to trade goods, to explore new lands and finally to perform cultural events.


SPANISH

¡Las polis griegas quieren expandirse! Para ello surcan los mares rumbo a la península Ibérica, en busca de tierras fértiles. Fundarán Emporion, la primera gran polis griega en la península, y las familias aristócratas buscarán ganar prestigio comandando expediciones, comerciando con Atenas, ganando el favor de los dioses y expandiendo la cultura helenística por las tierras íberas.

Objetivo
El objetivo es lograr cartas que otorguen puntos de Prestigio, usando el comercio, la cultura o la guerra. Cuando un jugador coloca la decimoquinta carta en su dominio, o se agota el mazo, o se agotan las cartas de Prestigio, termina la ronda y se determina el vencedor contando los puntos de Prestigio que cada jugador tenga.
187587.name: Emporion
boardgamepodcastepisode: ET107: De Reseñador a Adivino pasando por Descubridor
RJ55: Buscant pistes a l'Off (4 mini-entrevistes)

187588.description:
Auction Heads nos pone en la piel de los subastadores de almacenes abandonados en Estados Unidos, al estilo de los populares programas de TV donde los participantes de la subasta de un almacén realizan pujas por quedarse con su contenido, del que solo pueden ver una pequeña parte, no pudiendo ver la parte de atrás del almacén ni tocar nada del contenido. De esta manera el que realice la puja más alta se quedará con todo el lote, que podrá darle beneficios o pérdidas dependiendo de su valor real.

ENGLISH



Auction Heads is a game of abandoned storage auctioneers, bidding on and winning the most bizarre objects, appraising the items found within, and selling the most lucrative and interesting pieces to gain the game. The player who make the highest bid will remain with the entire batch, and after the deck ends, the player with the most money wins. But, be carefully! There may be hidden illegal objects that can make you lose money!
187588.name: Auction Heads

187590.name: Pralaya
187590.description:
User summary:

Long ago in the southern ocean, there is a beautiful island Pralaya, which has been at the height of its prosperity. But a terrifying devil is threatening the island and sinking it under the ocean. You have to fetch treasures and evacuate to northern continent before the island is completely sunk.

Pralaya is played like a strategic game of dare. Your goal is to secure island relics and people, including yourself, and evacuate them from the sinking island by boat. The more you evacuate, the higher you score. You should collect them efficiently, but more importantly, you must stop collecting and evacuate from the island in time. Otherwise you miss the big points for saving yourself, though you still score small points according to the items you have rescued so far.

At the end of game, the player with the most points wins the game.

Publisher's summary:

遥か昔、南海には美しい島が存在しました。しかし恐るべき悪魔が島を海に沈め始めたのです。島が沈む前に多くの宝を集め北の地に脱出しましょう！

島の遺物と残された命を集め、北の地へ脱出する事が目的です。より多くを集めた人が勝利しますが、島が完全に沈む前に脱出しなければ命を落としてしまいます。遺物を効率よく集める事はもちろん、脱出のタイミングを見極める事も重要となります。なお、逃げ遅れたとしても集めた遺物だけでも事前に船で送り出していた場合、その功績は評価されるので必ず負けるわけではありません。新しいタイプの戦略型チキンレースです。

187591.description:
Expand both your Thunderbirds Board Game and Thunderbirds Roleplaying Game experiences with this bonus set of 5 Scheme cards to your Thunderbirds games. Also contains a reference card.

With these additional 5 cards you'll have an extra challenging Level I, II, III, IV and the first exceptionally hard level V Scheme. Prepare to launch as the Thunderbirds Devious Schemes are go!


5 new Scheme cards bring tough new challenges to your Thunderbirds games
Reference Card to show you how to incorporate the cards in your game


Included in the Kickstarter edition of the game.
187591.name: Thunderbirds: Devious Schemes Promo Card Set

187594.description:
Qwixx Replacement Pads.
Two double-sided 50 sheet score pads for a total of 200 sheets.
187594.name: Qwixx: Replacement Pads

187596.name: Unique
187596.description: A twist on the usual trivia games; players ask questions personal to themselves.

187597.name: Where's Wally? The Board Game
187597.description: Finding Wally is never child's play but it's even trickier when there's a board made up of four movable sections and a ticking timer to battle against! If you know a fan of the red and white jumper-wearing character, then they'll love the chance to show their stripes in this exciting fast and furious search and find game where they'll say goodbye to school holiday boredom and so long to rainy day blues. Great for girls and boys alike aged seven upwards (and fun-loving grown-ups too!), the Where's Wally? Board Game is a race against time where being eagle-eyed and speedy is a winning combination! Players must find the picture on the board which matches the picture on their card. It might sound simple but try doing that when the sections of the board have been rearranged and there's a constant tick telling you that time is running out. The aim of the game is to be the fastest player to find and cover Where's Wally? pictures on the board with a Wally token. The next player tries to do the same and so the game continues until the timer stops. A card with a number '2' on it means double the challenge - you have to match the picture on your card to the picture on the board twice before play moves on. And if you collect a card with an 'R' on it, the direction of play is reversed and the four sections of the Where's Wally? board must be rearranged too. Simply super stripy fun for Where's Wally? fans who like a challenge!

187598.name: The Secrets of the Divine: Death, Justice, Healing, & Madness
187598.description:
From publisher blurb:

Come Explore the Mysteries of Heaven and Earth!

A modular presentation of specific churches that you can easily place in nearly any campaign setting; including information on who these deities are, who worships them, quotes, prayers, special orders to help suspend the disbelief of Players and Game Masters alike.

You will also find out how each church interacts with society, governments, and the everyday lives of folks from all walks of life, but with a primary focus on adventurers so that those interactions can be role-played seamlessly. It also includes local mythology related to the deity making the religion have an actual impact upon campaigns; Manifestations of the deity so you can show through both subtle omens and blessings or the wrath of the gods as well. Each church also gives information on religious holidays to spice up the passage of time in a campaign.

Along with a host of new divine archetypes, domain feats, and other new custom game mechanics to bring The Secrets of the Divine to life!

This product contains:

Our Mother of Many Ways a chaotic church dedicated to genius & madness along with wine & hedonism.
Our Queen of Wisdom and Mercy a church for healers, peacemakers, and imprisoning foes.
Our Reaper of Death and Rebirth a dour deity of the dead, reincarnation, and killing immortals.
Our Steely Eyed-Judge a lawful church filled with those who seek truth, justice, and retribution.




Its new game mechanics include

Domain Feats for use with specific Domain powers, to make them even more useful and fun.
Slayer Talents for those who wish to take their foes alive.
Joyous Fellowship (Paladin Archetype) become a holy warrior filled with religious euphoria & bliss from which you gain special powers all while playing a hedonistic paladin.
Queen’s Men (Paladin Archetype) Enjoy the role of a holy bodyguard and dedicate yourself to the protection of a singular worthy individual, rather promoting the cause of righteousness in the world at large.
Harmonious Fist (War Preist Archetype) Leave behind lethal weapons and chose instead to defend yourself, while imprisoning your foes even when you are far away from civilization.
Ruiners (Fighter Archetype) Seek out and curse immortal and undying foes with curses the like of which will force them to seek their own deaths rather than suffer at your hands.
Phoenix-Child (Universal Archetype) Return from beyond the grave in a reincarnated form, so that you can seek redemption, and transform into a phoenix to see it done.
Thief-Taker (Slayer Archetype) bring’em back alive to face justice, or hunt down stolen goods for anyone who can afford your services.

187599.name: Drilled Teamwork Feat
187599.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring new tactical options to your game with the Drilled Teamwork Feat, an option that allows you to train others for specific functions and pass on feat related bonuses to them!

While a plethora of options exist to represent almost any kind of combatant in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, the fall-back method of representing the concept of a group of adventurers well-trained to work together in combat with one another is by having characters take various Teamwork feats. While this can be a viable option, many players may be reticent to permanently choose a teamwork feat that is really only useful some of the time. It also doesn’t represent as well the idea that a seasoned group of veteran adventurers could spend time preparing themselves for coming combat with a known threat (be it giants from the mountains, flying dragons, etc.). Just as a wizard with forewarning can have “just the right spell” for a given circumstances, the Drilled Teamwork feat presented here offers more martial characters a viable option for preparing for combat together.

Take your teamwork to the next level... Drilled Teamwork Feats in Sidebar #11 from Fat Goblin Games!

187600.name: ヘッジホッグジレンマ (Hedgehog's Dilemma)
187600.description:
In ヘッジホッグジレンマ (Hedgehog's Dilemma), you and your fellow players are hedgehog breeders who are trying to encourage the little critters to get closer to one another on a cold day, perhaps to form a hedgehog couple if all goes well, so they need to be close enough to meet but not too close.

User summary:
The deck has cards numbered 1 to 4. Players are dealt six cards to their hand and a number of cards are laid face-up matching the number of players. Everyone chooses a card from their hand and reveals it. Cards that match up go to the player, everything else is discarded. Repeat this until the players' hands are empty, then score. Total up the whole of the cards you collected, the player with the highest total wins a token. Shuffle the whole deck over, play another round. The game ends when the fifth token is given out, the most tokens wins.

Matching cards simply means matching the number on the card, so if the table shows 1,3,3,4 and you're the only one to lay a 4, you get both 4s. But if more than one player lays a 4, you all get nothing. If two players each laid a 3, they'd each get a 3 from the table. If one player laid a 3, they'd only get one 3.

But if a 1 is matched in a turn, then the highest value table card is discarded, and so any matches are also lost. This brings in double-think, what are they other players likely to do? Do you go for the 4, or try a safer 3? What looks like a simple game becomes more cunning and watching what cards have already been played matters.

The card art is lovely, showing a variety of spiny creatures, sea urchins, lizards, turtles, porcupines. The cards are quite thin but the game is well made.

187601.name: 100 Oddities for a Graveyard
187601.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to 100 Oddities for a Graveyard, the fourth entry in Skirmisher Publishing’s popular "Oddities" series!

As roleplaying locales go, graveyards are classic, and can play a part in just about any type of game. As long as adventurers venture and people die, there will be graveyards. Fantasy, historical, urban, modern, horror, and even sci-fi or post-apocalyptic games can all benefit from the occasional introduction of a graveyard — and we have the Oddities to help you “flesh” them out.

Oddities are intended to aid GM creativity, turning possibly bland areas or gaming episodes into something more, and the goal of this publication is to make things more fun and to take your imagination in directions it might not otherwise have gone. They fill in the corners of a bookshelf, a room, a level, a scenario, with all the sorts of things that add interest but take loads of time to come up with.

187602.name: Accursed Core 2
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
187602.description:
From publisher blurb:

Accursed is a dark fantasy setting that requires the Savage Worlds core rules and Savage Worlds Horror Companion for use. It includes background information on the nations of Morden. Game mechanics include horrific new Witchbreeds for use as playable characters, along with Setting Rules, Hindrances, Edges, and Powers suited to telling stories set in Morden. The full setting guide also includes detailed information on eight of the Witches and their banes, as well as a range of adventure hooks and a plot point campaign.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: Accursed Core 2

Witches have ruled the land since the last battles of conquest, but their Grand Coven has been sundered, leaving behind remnants of a once-mighty army. The survivors of the horde include captured citizens of the conquered nations that fought as the Witches’ shock troops.

187603.name: Kunterbuntes Früchtesammeln
187603.description:
Each player tries to find and assign the fruits in the correct order.
When it's your turn, you first try to find an apple in the hidden tokens. For this, you return one of the chips that are on the table.
If you have returned an apple, you can give it as food to the caterpillar. On your next turn, you will seek a pear, then a plum, and so on.
Continue in this way to find, little by little, the food for the caterpillar in the right order.
The first player who have returned all six cards wins the game.

187604.name: Saving Pirate O'Ryan
187604.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Swords & Wizardry Mini-Dungeon
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 5-7

It seems like it’s always raining in Dreadport. The party, eager to head for drier climes, takes a job as caravan guards for a merchant heading south. However the job isn’t what it appears to be... and neither is the cargo.

Saving Pirate O’Ryan is part of a series of mini-dungeons designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side quests or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

187605.name: Lerne zählen!
187605.description:
An apple, two pears, three plums? In the cards you see different images of fruits and with different amounts of numbers.
Mix all the cards and then You must try to correctly match the cards together.
The winner is the player with most matched cards.

187606.description:
"I know 3.029e+30 ways to drive you crazy."

Dive into the tumult and test yourself against the game and your friends in this frantic rush to prevent the disintegration of an otherwise nice and comely family. (Yeah, right...)

Tumult is a speed-puzzler that utilizes a random puzzle-generator mechanism to reach as many as 3.029e+30 different puzzles. All players solve the same puzzle simultaneously and compare results when time has run out. Every mistake causes tears, and whoever has caused the fewest tears at the end of a certain number of rounds wins.

Tumult reimplements Uluru/Pelican Cove, with some notable differences in the card set and gameplay. The physical and thematic design is also new; one particular improvement is that Tumult is playable even if you are colorblind!
187606.name: Tumult

187607.name: てづま師 (Tezuma Master)
187607.description: てづま師 (Tezuma Master) is a trick-taking game themed on "tezuma", or traditional Japanese magic/sleight of hand such as making a butterfly made of paper fly through the air. Each player secretly chooses one of three scoring cards for themself at the start of the round, and that determines how they'll score for the cards that they've taken. Each player also has a few special power cards that they can use when desired, and each of the four suits has a single trump card.

187608.name: Frag Doch Mal: Das Clevere Spiel
187608.description:
The oldest player begins by taking the top card from the pile and reading the question to the player at his left.

In the card the mouse, the duck and the elephant each offer a possible answer. Read these three possible answers and always say by whom the answer comes: From the Mouse, the elephant or the duck. You can check the right answer in the back of the card. There, the mouse, the duck or the elephant are displayed with a detailed response.

The game ends as soon as there are no more cards. The player who has the most cards wins the game.

187609.name: Ayakashi Soushi
187609.description:
In あやかし草子 (Ayakashi Soushi), players want to get rid of the tiles in hand quicker than anyone else. Tiles are hexagonal with a figure in the middle, and they feature borders of either a single unique color or two colors split evenly around the tile.

On a turn, a player places a tile on the board, triggering the special effect of the depicted figure if the border of that tile matches an adjacent tile. The tiles with unique colors each have a special power that takes effect when placed.

187610.name: Frag Doch Mal:  Das Kartenspiel Set 1
187610.description:
The oldest player begins by taking the top card from the pile and reading the question to the player at his left.

In the card the mouse, the duck and the elephant each offer a possible answer. Read these three possible answers and always say by whom the answer comes: From the Mouse, the elephant or the duck. You can check the right answer in the back of the card. There, the mouse, the duck or the elephant are displayed with a detailed response.

The game ends as soon as there are no more cards. The player who has the most cards wins the game.

187611.name: Frag Doch Mal: Das Kartenspiel Set 2
187611.description:
The oldest player begins by taking the top card from the pile and reading the question to the player at his left.

In the card the mouse, the duck and the elephant each offer a possible answer. Read these three possible answers and always say by whom the answer comes: From the Mouse, the elephant or the duck. You can check the right answer in the back of the card. There, the mouse, the duck or the elephant are displayed with a detailed response.

The game ends as soon as there are no more cards. The player who has the most cards wins the game.

187612.name: Ninja Ninja Ninja
187612.description:
Ninja Ninja Ninja features a 54-card deck, with cards numbered 0-5 in three colors, with each card appearing three times.

Players have a hand of seven cards, and they play three at a time to create strong card combinations, such as three cards of the same number and color (strongest), three cards in sequence, etc. As they reveal combinations, they can cause damage to one another based on the strength of their attacks and defenses.

187613.name: amiibo Figurines
187613.description:
Amiibo is Nintendo's wireless communications and storage protocol, for use between compatible Toys-to-Life items and the Nintendo 3DS and Wii U gaming platforms. These toys use near field communication (NFC) to interact with supported video game software, potentially allowing data to be transferred in and out of games and across multiple platforms.

Amiibo toys can be used directly with the Wii U GamePad and New Nintendo 3DS series, while an adapter for the rest of the Nintendo 3DS series was released.

Source: Wikipedia, "Amiibo", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

187614.name: Inquisition: Purge the Unclean
187614.description:
From the Introduction:

Inquisition: Purge the Unclean is a solitaire game, taking place in the Warhammer 40,000 universe. In this game, you'll be taking on the role of an Inquisitor; your mission is to eliminate all threats that occupy an underground base in Hive World Golgotha XVII.

In order to play Inquisition: Purge the Unclean you'll need a few six-sided dice, these rules and some scratch paper to track the Inquisitor's attributes and any other information.

187615.name: Castle Gargantua
187615.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ride the beanstalk and crawl into the sprawling halls of Castle Gargantua. There awaits the most legendary of giants and the fiercest creatures known to man. Delve further than ever for the great doors of Castle Gargantua have swung open once again, and what lies ahead isn't for the faint-hearted.

The biggest dungeon ever published by the OSR. A campaign, a massive generator, and a grotesque setting all-in-one.

It's not about killing monsters, looting treasure, and gaining experience as you delve deeper into some mad archmage's architectural folly. It's about surviving in a loathsome, terrifying environment where nothing is quite as expected. It's about atmosphere, gloom, and despair. It's a thriller.

187616.name: Mindent a helyére!
187616.description:
In this game for children, you need to move pawns into the holes with the corresponding shapes and earn the most victory tokens this way.
Contents:
1 gameboard
12 pawns (in 4 different color red, green, blue,yellow, and 3 different shape triangle, brick, roll in every color)
12 victory tokens
4 color tokens (in 4 different colors)
3 shape tokens
2 dice
When it's your turn, you need to take a step with a pawn. The goal is moving a pawn into a field having a hole with the same shape. When this occurs you can get a victory token. To take a step with a pawn, you need to roll with 2 dice. The first die identifies the number of steps, the second die identifies the color, so if you roll green and 2 you have to take 2 steps with one of the green pawns.
If you roll a star with the color die, you need to select a color token from the face-down pile and a shape token also from the face-down pile and these identify which pawn you must move.
The game ends when all pawns fell down in the holes.
The player with the most victory tokens wins the game.

187617.description:
Jules Verne's classic novel Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea tells the story of Captain Nemo and his astounding ship, the Nautilus. The second edition of Nemo's War, Victory Point Games' popular solitaire offering from designer Chris Taylor, is a greatly enhanced offering featuring mass-production printing and amazing Ian O'Toole art and graphics throughout.

Set in year 1870, you set sail in this amazing electric-powered submarine, assuming the role and motive of Captain Nemo as you travel across the seas on missions of science, exploration, anti-Imperialism, and War!

With this supercharged second edition of Nemo's War, prepare yourself for the adventure of a lifetime!

Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale

Solitaire Suitability: 9 on a 9 scale

Scale: Time is measured in Action Points which represent approximately 1 week of real time; each encounter is with 1 major ship (its crew and contents) and each area is 1 Ocean.
187617.name: Nemo's War (second edition)
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 090 - Cards of Cthulhu
1P 092 - Nemo’s War (2nd Edition) and the Top 100 Games
1P 094 - Hostage Negotiator & Dice City
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 010 – Our 2016 Wishlist
Episode 25: Shiny!
Low Player Count - Ep 17 - Replayability
Low Player Count - Ep 18 - The Pick Up & Deliver Episode
Victory Point Games - BGGcon 2015 Interview

187619.description:
Now it is possible to respond to the Daedalus challenge at home. Labyrinth game features four challenges where your task is to collect "livspuckar".

The game has 4 stages.

Stage 1. collect "livspuckar" in a labyrint while a robot chasing you.

Stage 2. build a pattern quckest.

Stage 3. jump on pods over a "slime sea"

Stage 4. memory.

on each stage you can collect at most 3 "livspuckar", most in the end wins the game.

Based on a swedish TV-show for children.
187619.name: Labyrint

187621.name: Heavy Gear D6
187621.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to the exciting world of Heavy Gear d6! Set on the distant colonly world of Terra Nova, Heavy Gear offers a rich and believable science-fiction setting for fast-paced Mecha action and adventure. Abandoned millenia ago by Earth's government, the colonists on Terra Nova were beset by the dangerous and diverse environmental conditions of the dry and hot planet. Despite this adversity, the proud and tough settlers banded together in polar confederations, developing advanced 4 meter tall walkers, or "Gears," to make the difficult work ahead of them more manageable. Today, the ubiquitous Gears are found across the desert world, whether in police forces, livestock ranches, gladiatorial bouts, construction teams or, most famously, mechanized military regiments. Gears have transformed life on the harsh world of Terra Nova, and colour every aspect of life here.

187622.name: Battlelogs: Gears of Peace River
187622.description:
From Introduction:

Battlelogs: Gears of Peace River is a supplement for Heavy Gear D6, detailing equipment of the Peace River Defence Force (PRDF). Gears and vehicles from the original Heavy Gear roleplaying game and the current Heavy Gear: Blitz! miniatures game are included. (The Cataphract from Heavy Gear: Blitz! is not included here, but will be included in a future supplement. ) New entries for Auxiliary Systems and Features (both positive and negative) are also include to expand the vehicle options available in Heavy Gear D6.

187623.name: Battlelogs: Gears of The North
187623.description:
From Introduction:

Battlelogs: Gears of The North is a supplement for Heavy Gear D6, detailing the Gears used by the Northern Guard and the member leagues of the Confederated Northern City-States. New entries for Auxiliary Systems and Features (both positive and negative) are also include to expand the vehicle options available in Heavy Gear D6.

187624.name: Battlelogs: Gears of The South
187624.description:
From Introduction:

Battlelogs: Gears of The South is a supplement for Heavy Gear D6, detailing the Gears used by the Southern MILICIA and the member leagues of the Allied Southern Territories. New entries for Auxiliary Systems and Features (both positive and negative) are also include to expand the vehicle options available in Heavy Gear D6.

187625.name: Marseille Sophistique
187625.description:
Marseille Sophistiqué is your guide to one of the most complex families of card games in the world! A 78-card deck, elegantly illustrated and faithful to the sensibility of its 15th century origins, updated with modern gameplay in mind.

The Tarocchi family of games is a historical set of point-trick taking games, played in a series of zero-sum hands. Most in the family include a signature fluctuating team system where one bids for the high-risk, high-reward position of the single opponent to the other players, who form a temporary team for the duration of the hand. Players may additionally bet on a series of secondary goals, to achieve bonus points along with those for the hand itself. A game is played to a variable number of rounds in which each player deals a hand.

Marseille Sophistiqué includes an introductory rulebook, containing historical game rules for
-Baronetti, a simple 2-player introductory rules set that focuses on the basic point-trick principles, also good for fast games and appropriate for children
-Scarto, a 3-player free-for-all
-French Tarot, the classic 4-player, team-based trick taking game, with variants for 3-6 players
-adaptations for 5-suited Poker

Free digital content extends these rules to include
-Droggn, a 3-4 player game with a smaller deck, more forgiving to the opponent.
-Hungarian Tarokk, a 4-5 player game with an advanced bonus system
-Illustrated Hungarian Tarokk, a variant for those who have mastered Hungarian Tarokk
-Rules variants reflecting some of the regional iterations of games

187627.name: Zombies and Survivors
187627.description:
Rules light skirmish game for 28mm scale zombie survival scenarios, played with miniatures and terrain on the tabletop using 20 sided dice. Suggested game size is 3-5 human survivors verses 36-150 zombies!

From the rulebook introduction:

ZOMBIES & SURVIVORS is the free downloadable fast play ‘fun’ Zombie game from Grekwood Miniatures. This game guide has all the information required to start playing the zombie apocalypse.

187630.name: Rooftops & Reindeer
187630.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spin up your Dentist's drill, take the reins as a rampaging Sleigher, or even bring peace as a merry Mirthweaver and become the protagonists in your own magical Christmas special! Whether you fend of a legion of vicious Sgnomes, protect your home from ravenous Wet Bandits, match wits with the wily Jack Frost, or awkwardly tip-toe around Zwarte Piet, there's loads of silly, pop-culture-y, sit-around-the-table-with-some-hot-cocoa-and-kill-stuff-with-your-family fun.

187635.name: Age of Craft Expansion #2: Architecture Alliance
boardgamepublisher: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)
187635.description:
This expansion for Age of Craft introduces Alliance Building cards, which can be purchased by neighboring players pooling their resources together. The Alliance Buildings are placed in between the two neighboring players and provide benefits to both.

This set also contains extra cards for use during 2-player games to make negotiation more effective, tweaked versions of base set cards, variant rules for a longer game, and additional cards for use with the first expansion.

187636.name: Wild Planet
187636.description:
First complete the puzzle about different terrains and animals.
Then take turns to spin the spinner and matching the different animals to the correct categories.
Who has placed the most tiles to the correct categories is the winner.

187637.name: Animals of the World
187637.description:
First complete the large world puzzle with different animals.
Then take turns to spin the spinner and matching the animals and fish to their correct habitats.
Who has matched the most tiles is the winner.

187638.name: Sacred Steel
187638.description:
User summary:

The action resolution method used in Sacred Steel involves a custom card deck with equal numbers of success cards and failure cards (any deck can be used with equal numbers of two types of cards--red and black, for example). Players draw one or more cards to determine success--any success card in the draw indicates success. Players draw more cards if they have better skill or ability in the area of action. In opposed actions each opponents draws cards and counts successes--the most successes win.

Players have five Skills: Awareness, Physique, Combat, Learning, and Interaction. Scores range from 2 to 6 (typically) with 3 being considered average. A sixth Skill, Magic, is used for some characters.

187640.name: Sacred Steel Cards & Sheets
187640.description:
User summary:

Sacred Steel uses cards to handle action resolution. Two print-and-use PDFs of cards are available for download--one with backs, one without.

Also provided as separate downloads are a variety of accessories including:


Character Sheet
Character Work-up Sheet
Character Tracker
Combat Tracker
Logo wallpaper
Map of the lands of Sacred Steel

187641.name: Maíandros
187641.description:
Maiandros is a 2-player connection game (such as Hex, Twixt, etc).

Games are always played in odd square boards with 9x9 being the minimum size recommended.In this game players alternate turns placing identical two-color tiles, each with an inverse side. Tiles must be placed in a way that its colours match the colours printed on the corners of each square (to ensure all tiles match each other). The goal of the game is to connect opposite sides of the board, be it horizontally (east-west) or vertically (north-south).

187642.name: Mouse Guard (2nd Edition)
rpghonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Winner
187642.description:
(publisher blurb)

Winner of the 2009 Origins Award for Roleplaying Game of the Year, 3 Silver Ennie Awards, and 3 Indie RPG Awards! Join the Mouse Guard and defend the Mouse Territories against predators and dangers, in this roleplaying game for the acclaimed Mouse Guard comic book series! Players form their own Mouse Guard patrol and attempt to complete missions while the Game Master takes on the roles of the weather, animals and the wilderness all trying to thwart the fearless mice. Designed by Origins Award-winning game designer Luke Crane for beginners and veterans alike, the game comes complete with three sample patrols and three sample missions, so you and your friends can get started playing right now. Includes art and extensive background material on the Mouse Territories specially prepared by Mouse Guard creator David Petersen.

187643.name: Saga Basic Rules
187643.description:
User summary:

Heroes (characters) have eight Attributes: Quickness, Dexterity, Endurance, Strength, Reason, Perception, Willpower, and Charisma. Each Attribute has a numeric rating of 1-9, with 5 being a "heroic" human average. Each Attribute also has a letter code (A, B, C, D, or X) which indicates the amount of training in the Attribute. Ability Codes are compared to an Action Table to determine possible actions.

Actions are resolved by playing cards from a hand. The Narrator (game master) will determine the Attribute used for an action as well as the Action Difficulty. The player then plays a card to determine success. Several rules govern card play. After the action is resolved the player draws new cards to a full hand. Combat is handled in a similar way but with more complication and options. Occasional Fate Cards provide for special actions during the game.

187645.description:
From the publisher:

Star Wars: Rebellion is a board game of epic conflict between the Galactic Empire and Rebel Alliance for two to four players!

Experience the Galactic Civil War like never before. In Rebellion, you control the entire Galactic Empire or the fledgling Rebel Alliance. You must command starships, account for troop movements, and rally systems to your cause. Given the differences between the Empire and Rebel Alliance, each side has different win conditions, and you'll need to adjust your play style depending on who you represent:

As the Imperial player, you can command legions of Stormtroopers, swarms of TIEs, Star Destroyers, and even the Death Star. You rule the galaxy by fear, relying on the power of your massive military to enforce your will. To win the game, you need to snuff out the budding Rebel Alliance by finding its base and obliterating it. Along the way, you can subjugate worlds or even destroy them.
As the Rebel player, you can command dozens of troopers, T-47 airspeeders, Corellian corvettes, and fighter squadrons. However, these forces are no match for the Imperial military. In terms of raw strength, you'll find yourself clearly overmatched from the very outset, so you'll need to rally the planets to join your cause and execute targeted military strikes to sabotage Imperial build yards and steal valuable intelligence. To win the Galactic Civil War, you'll need to sway the galaxy's citizens to your cause. If you survive long enough and strengthen your reputation, you inspire the galaxy to a full-scale revolt, and you win.




Featuring more than 150 plastic miniatures and two game boards that account for thirty-two of the Star Wars galaxy's most notable systems, Rebellion features a scope that is as large and sweeping as any Star Wars game before it.

Yet for all its grandiosity, Rebellion remains intensely personal, cinematic, and heroic. As much as your success depends upon the strength of your starships, vehicles, and troops, it depends upon the individual efforts of such notable characters as Leia Organa, Mon Mothma, Grand Moff Tarkin, and Emperor Palpatine. As civil war spreads throughout the galaxy, these leaders are invaluable to your efforts, and the secret missions they attempt will evoke many of the most inspiring moments from the classic trilogy. You might send Luke Skywalker to receive Jedi training on Dagobah or have Darth Vader spring a trap that freezes Han Solo in carbonite!

187646.name: Blood & Bronze: Rules Booklet
187646.description:
Some people gather in their cities, seeking refuge from monsters and foes behind massive walls or solace from the scorching sun under the many-colored tarps of the bazaars.
Some people live their lives bent before the ziggurats tremoring in awe of their sacred rulers.

But not you, for you are an adventurer! Driven by an urge for power, by curiosity or avarice, you and your band of likes travel this world seeking fame, gold and adventure.

This is the game of these adventures.

[back of book]

187647.name: Darksiders II: Deathinitive Edition
videogamecompilation: Darksiders II - The Demon Lord Belial
187647.description:
User Summary

In Darksiders II, you play as Death, one of the four riders of the apocalypse. You are trying to clear your brother, War, from his imprisonment based on accusations that he rode before the call was given to begin the "End War".

Darksiders II: Deathinitive Edition is the original Darksiders II game from Vigil Games and THQ re-released from publisher Nordic Games for current-generation systems (PS4/Xbox One), with polished graphics, reworked loot distribution and retuned combat. The re-release was performed by much of the original team now working as Gunfire Games.

The Deathinitive Edition contains all of the previous DLC integrated into the game (instead of clunkily dumped on you at the beginning).

187648.name: 5Crests
187648.description:
5Crests is a hybrid card game set in an alternate history, where the discovery of a magically imbued mineral called Villium gives rise to a stronger, more centralized criminal enterprise, the First Family. The family, in their quest to control this new power, created 5 different guilds, honoring the ways of their members to provide muscle and protection against any who oppose it.

You play the role of a fast rising street lieutenant in one of these guilds trying to carve out your own slice of the American Dream. Each player constructs a deck of various allies, weapons, trade fronts, and actions. Players can build and expand their arsenal by collecting more cards and trading with their friends to get more powerful allies and tools of the trade. Then you take to the streets and fight other street lieutenants for supremacy. Each lieutenant starts with a set amount of health based on their abilities, but winning requires that you bring the opposing lieutenants health to 0. Players expand their Villium trade by playing and controlling trade fronts. As these fronts bring in Villium, players are able to bring their allies and resources into the fray to battle with their enemies. Fights can be 1 on 1 street brawls, or all out mob wars between multiple players. Those left standing will continue their quest to gain control of the first family.

The family is calling, will you answer?

187649.description: Pack of replacement balloons, 50 x 20 Balloon sets
187649.name: Bumm Bumm Ballon! Balloon Set

187650.name: The Elder Scrolls Online - Orsinium
videogameexpansion: The Elder Scrolls Online: Tamriel Unlimited
187650.description:
The Elder Scrolls Online: Orsinium is the second official DLC game pack for The Elder Scrolls Online.

Orsinium features new zone with over 20 hours of story content, a new single-player monster arena, and new public dungeons. Orsinium takes the player to the mountains of Wrothgar, and to the Orc capital itself, to unravel plots and counter-plots, and clash with all-new enemies and allies.

Source: The Game Website.

187651.name: Nex
187651.description: Nex is a variant on the game Hex. Like Hex it is played on a grid of hexagons. One player is trying to connect the top and bottom with stones of their color, while the other player is trying to connect the other two sides with their color. The mechanism that makes it different from Hex is the addition of a neutral color. Each turn a player has a choice between two actions. The first is to simply place a stone of their color and a neutral stone. The second possibility is to replace two neutral stones with stones of their color and replace a stone of their color with a neutral stone. Neutral pieces are not considered part of any connection.

187652.description:
A candy themed card battling game, where players compete to win real piles of sweet loot!

I noticed that there aren't a lot of games that both kids and adults would want to play. Either games skew too young, and parents get bored... or the games engage only adults and are way too complex for a child. So this one has a lot of references aimed at the 20-40 year age range, but is totally family-appropriate for most kids 8 and over!

The gimmick is that each player brings a pile of real sweets (or a candy substitute of your choosing) to fuel their warriors in battle against each other, with a "Land Card" mechanism that keeps it from becoming "pay-to-win". Its perfect for gatherings with a lot of snacks, or for the holidays when there are lots of sweets to be divided up!

Why would you want to win a giant pile of candy? Candy is awesome! Who doesn't want first dibs on a giant pile of candy!? Plus, you can share it with your friends and family, silly!
187652.name: Eternal War of the Candy Realms!

187653.description:
Control your network of spies, gather intel, and break codes in Covert, a game of tactical dice placement, set collection, and timing set in Cold War Europe. Players race to complete high risk Missions by deploying their agents and acquiring the necessary equipment, all while keeping an eye on the needs of future missions and the advances of rival agencies.

Each round, players roll their hand of dice and in turn allocate them to different actions, like moving their Agents, acquiring Agency Cards, completing and acquiring new Missions, and more. Dice are placed on action circles that require players to place their dice numerically adjacent to dice that have already been placed, allowing for rival agencies to thwart their plans — but a good Agent always has a backup plan, and there are ways around everything that stands in your way.

Covert combines simple concepts with a depth of play that allows players the freedom to combine special abilities and card combos to complete their Missions and overcome obstacles. Utilize your assets. Make your move. Don't let anyone stand in your way.

187655.description:
Danger lurks in the halls of Northfield Elementary. The school yard is no place for the meek. Only one man can protect the innocent children from bullies, cheaters, and thiefs. But unfortunately Principal Jones is usually too tied up with PTA meetings, in-service days, and keeping his office chair warm. That leaves Adin Simon, private eye, gumshoe, and sleuth to clean up after the fact. Fourth grade may not be safe, but with a bit of grit and determination he'll solve your case and bring your culprit to justice...or get wedgied trying.

Fourth Grade Confidential is a microgame of deduction, bluffing, and cunning, based on Neal Simon's comic book project called Fourth Grade Confidential. The premise is that a fourth grader named Adin is a private eye at his school, working to solve the great mysteries of elementary school, like who stole his sister's stuffed pink bunny.

In Fourth Grade Confidential one player is the Sleuth while 2-4 other players are the Characters. Each round the Sleuth is trying to solve a different mystery. The Sleuth has six Sleuth Cards and the other 12 cards are dealt evenly to the Characters. The Sleuth has six turns to try to figure out which Character has the Target Item for that round by calling out various attributes and seeing who has items with matching attributes. Through careful deduction and use of actions the Sleuth and Characters all try to be the player to end up with the Target Item.

The Sleuth: Each round a new player will take on the roll of the Sleuth. The Sleuth will be questioning the Characters and following up clues. If the Sleuth catches Characters lying about the items they have he'll get to perform additional actions to help him narrow down where the Target Item is.

The Characters: All other players are Characters in the current mystery. One Character will have the Target Item that the Sleuth is looking for. As the Sleuth questions Characters they will begin to reveal items they have to prove their innocence, or to throw the Sleuth off the track. Can you be cunning enough to keep the Target Item hidden from the Sleuth? Are you going to help the Sleuth figure out who is the Culprit? Maybe you're just out for yourself. Characters get to take actions if they reveal items the Sleuth is looking for, without giving up the Target Item. But if they are caught lying the Sleuth gets extra actions to help him find the Culprit.

The round ends when the Sleuth runs out of Actions or when he finds the Target Item. Scoring can be totaled for each round and then scores totaled after everyone has had a chance to be the Sleuth an equal number of times.

187656.description:
Taking place some time after the first game, it stars Noah, the young boy who was awoken from a coma at the end of the original game. Now a teenager, he must return to his dream world to search for his younger sister, who was separated from him during a bombing raid on their hometown.
