187657.name: Sand (2000)
187657.description:
User summary:

Sand is a fairly simple role-playing game that was published in an unfinished state, at a point when the authors felt it could be used successfully in a campaign with an experienced game master to deal with shortcomings. Much of the rules are intended to focus on the harsh setting of the game but the setting, as published, is little more than a territorial map with the description of desert.

Characters has six Attributes: Might, Fortitude, Facility, Worldliness, Shrewdness, Essence, and Vitality. Vitality is parceled out among Head, Upper and Lower Torso, Left and Right Arm, and Left and Right Leg. Attribute have Points which are purchased during character creation, ranging from 1 to 6 (they may exceed that later during play). The same point pool also is used to purchase Skills (Skills are not defined though several are offered as samples). Vitality has a different scoring mechanism and starts at 900 (total).

Action resolution is performed by rolling a dice pool and looking for successes (using a peculiar method) against a target number. The number of dice in the pool is determined by the Attribute or Skill Points value associated with the action. The individual dice results are used to build a two-digit number that exceeds the target number. For example, a 4d10 roll of 2, 5, 6, and 8 would be scored at 86.

Combat is more complex and somewhat poorly defined. It also uses the peculiar method of dice result handling. Combat involves several "special case" rules for various weapons, armors, and so forth. Damage is calculated by a fairly strange method of doing two calculations, each of which does damage. A single hit may well do nearly 200 hit points of damage though 150 is probably more typical.

187658.name: Claw of the Savage Tiger
187658.description:
User summary:

Claw of the Savage Tiger is a one-page PDF document containing rules that add role-playing elements to another game, Kung Fu Dice. Generally, the role-playing elements are very light-weight and concern themselves with healing and gaining experience. A few optional rules are provided to support multiple players and weapons.

Kung Fu Dice is a stand-alone three-page PDF dice game that simulates kung fu fighting. It provides the entire combat resolution system for the Claw of the Savage Tiger role-playing game.

The combat system is exceptionally simple. Combat proceeds in rounds and all attacks occur simultaneously. Each opponent rolls a dice pool of D6 and discards any result that matches an opponent's result. The remaining dice are totaled and delivered as damage. The recipient subtracts 1D4 from the total ("shrugs off" a little damage) and records the rest. The first opponent to suffer 30 points of damage succumbs.

187659.name: War for the White House
187659.description:
Launch a military style campaign to capture 270 Electoral College votes by using power and influence to sway the voters, turning hot-button political issues into weapons of mass destruction. Shock and awe your opponents with a devastating arsenal of lethal ordnance to capture Primary and Secondary Objectives and earn the 270 Electoral College Votes needed to win the White House.

Deck includes: 52 Playing Cards and 4 Intel Cards
2-4 Players
Kids 6+ / Adults

The object of the game is to WIN 2 CAMPAIGNS. There are 3 ways to win a campaign:


Capture 5 PRIMARY OBJECTIVES for 270 ELECTORAL VOTES.
Capture 5 SECONDARY OBJECTIVES for 269 ELECTORAL VOTES + 1 PRIMARY OBJECTIVE to exceed 270 ELECTORAL VOTES.
Fight a WAR OF ATTRITION until all but one player runs out of cards and drops out of the game.


PLAYING THE GAME (Basic Overview)

Shuffle and deal out all cards evenly to all players (players do not look at their cards but keep them in a stack FACE DOWN on the table). During each round, players take turns drawing and playing their top card. Cards are placed FACE UP on the table.
When a player draws a PRIMARY or SECONDARY OBJECTIVE, the player continues to turn over cards until an ORDNANCE card (a numbered card) is drawn. The player with the highest card wins and captures all cards in play.

187660.name: Bugs Bunny Race in Space Game
187660.description:
Bugs Bunny is an astronaut on a mission to deliver urgently needed carrots to an orbiting space station. The object is to be the first player to deliver four carrots to their matching space station.

Players spin and move their pawn from their planet with up to 3 carrots of cargo at a time to the space station with the matching color. Players may move in any direction during each turn but diagonal, but they may not simply return to the square they started on. If a player lands on a space occupied by another player, the other player must take all their cargo and put it back at their home planet. They must then move back to the planet to pick up cargo again. Players do not need an exact count to enter their space station (or planet) and drop off the carrot cargo. After dropping off the cargo, they must return to their planet to pick up the remaining cargo and deliver it to the space station. First player to deliver four carrots to their space station wins.

187661.name: Shatra
187661.description:
Shatra (шатра), also known as Altay Shatra (Алтай-шатра), is a cross-over between chess and checkers, which is based on a traditional game of the Altay region whose exact rules were lost. It was re-created in 1960 by Saveliy Yakovlevich Pahayev, a professor of the Gorno-Altaisk Research Institute of History, Language and Literature. In 1974, some reasearchers of this institute "improved" the rules and, in the following year, the first tourna­ment was held in the capital of the Altay Republic. The game soon became a popular mindsport in the Altay region and is also play in Khakassia, Tuva and Buryatia. There were over-the-board tour­na­ments in Russia (Besh-Ozek (Altay), Chernogorsk (Khakassia), Elo (Altay), Gorno-Altaysk (Altay), Kosh-Agach (Altay), Kyzyl (Tuva), Onguday (Altay), Shebalino (Altay), Ulan-Ude (Bur­yatia)), Ust-Kan (Altay), and Yabogan (Altay).

In addition, there is another "Shatra", which is a little bit more chess-like and, which is mostly played outside of Altay. It was invented by Vladimir Leonidovich Taushkanov in the 1970s who helped to finalize the Shatra rules in 1974, but went a step further. The older variant popular in the Altay region can be called "Shatra I" and the slightly newer variant, which is today almost exclusively played outside of the Altay region (mainly in the European part of Russia) "Shatra II". There is also a four-sided variation of Shatra I that can be played by four players.

The goal of the game is to mate the opponent's king (biy). Besides the king, Shatra I has 16 pieces, which move like Russian checkers men. In Shatra II there is a king (biy), a queen (batïr), two rooks (tura), two bishops (jalkïn) and 11 pawns (šatra). Capturing is in both variants mandatory and by jumping similar to checkers. The board has a very unusual shape and was influenced by Chinese Chess (the autonomous Altay Republic borders to China). It has a battlefield, a ditch, a gate and a fortress.

Shatra I can be played online at Abstract Games (a Russian site) and Shatra II at Chess Variants Game Courier. Recently a book was published about Shatra I. Draws are possible and might be substantial similar to checkers and chess, particularly in Shatra I, if the game is played by masters. However, in Shatra I tournaments at Abstract Games, which are played among weak amateurs from Russia, Belarus and Germany, only every 15th game ends in a draw. In Shatra I, there are 400 possible board positions after ply 2. The branching factor is similar to chess.

187663.name: Star Wars: Death Star Attack
187663.description: Simple 2 player card game. The aim of which is to use the differently numbered cards in your hand to achieve a random number on a designated card. The plyer who does this the quickest then gets to move the 'Death Star/millennium falcon' card away from them.

187664.name: Monster Rush
187664.description:
You and your friends are part of an order known simply as the Keepers. The Keepers were sworn to contain any horrors that keeps coming out from Portals of Evil that appear in dungeons from time to time. It is your job to not only prevent them from getting out, but also to destroy the portal to prevent it from happening again.

Monster Rush is a co-operative tactical dungeon crawling game for 1-4 players. Play different card combinations to create a different hero every game and prevent the monsters from escaping the dungeon. Strategize and come up with adaptive tactics every turn, as monsters mass up and threaten to overwhelm you and your fellow Keepers.

187665.name: Witchfinder
187665.description:
Players try rooting out witchcraft in their opponents village.
Each player has a deck of 9 character cards which they will use by drawing one and then playing one each turn in an attempt to locate the opponents witch card and avoid taking curses.

187666.name: DamBeavers!
187666.description:
DamBeavers is the tile laying resource collecting game of beaver colony control and proliferation! Thwart hapless rivals by unleashing the wolverine, lumberjack or redneck farmer. Beaver tirelessly through the rolling seasons to make your colony reign supreme!

Begin by laying river tiles and placing initial dam pieces. Move through the three turn phases in each season. Lay terrain tiles, send out beavers to gather resources, build dams and lodges and watch your beaver colony grow. Fortify your lodges before winter or your baby beavers will perish. And at all times beware the wolverine! With each passing year when the river floods, the landscape changes more and more due to your damming activities.

When the final tile is plucked from the bag, the winner is the player with the most...DamBeavers!

187669.name: Die kleine Raupe Nimmersatt: 1 • 2 • 3 Stapelei
187669.description:
The caterpillar is hungry and eats its way through fruits, vegetables and all sorts of other goodies. Children help him fight his way through the largest possible number of threats. This creates a tower of cards. But be careful! If someone is not careful, the tower collapses and the caterpillar must start from scratch...

Every card has a hole in it. The first player has to stack one card of his choice over the caterpillar, always leaving the caterpillar's head visible. All players do the same, increasing the stack, and trying not to collapse the stack.
If you collapse the stack, all the other players gain a butterfly chip except you. If the players manage to put all the cards in the stack without it falling, then all players get a butterfly chip.

The game ends when one or more players have won five "Butterfly" chips. These players are the winners!

187670.name: Benjamin Blümchen: Mix Mal
187670.description:
Which head matches what legs? Which body is missing here? Who will be the first to assemble two matching Benjamin motifs correctly? A simple, entertaining game with the popular elephant.
The first player to assemble two Benjamin motifs with the tree corresponding cards, wins the game!

187672.name: RINPA
187672.description:
You are picture dealer of Japanese painting. You are being repaired the folding screen painting in cooperation with other picture dealer.
However, if it is possible to be repaired ahead of others, the painting can help you get.
Let's become a famous picture dealer by collecting more of the folding screen painting.

Rinpa is Rinpa theme of Japanese painting. And, it is a trick-taking game of the set collection.


Summary of How to play


Players, will do the trick-take by mast follow. All cards of trick-take have been used and arranged all in the center.
Cards, have been set for each 2 to 6 sheets - each set is folding screen picture - .
The player who draws one of the last in each set, gets its set.
Player to get the set is not a winner of each trick take. be careful!
To play all of the hand, The winner is player to get the most of the cards!

187673.description:
Description from the publisher:

Welcome to the next level. You may have gone through the world of A Ultima Fortaleza and Runicards: Battle for Tierra del Fuego, but now you will go through your experience better: the deck-building game Hérois & Monstros, which takes place in the same universe as A Ultima Fortaleza, but it is a totally different game and filled with new adventures.

The game world of A Ultima Fortaleza presents a world where monsters fight like heroes and heroes behave like monsters. Here, the medieval fantasy races — elves, dwarves and humans — usually associated with heroics, part of an extremist fundamentalist sect called the Order of Light The Order of Light, lead an inquisition against intelligent creatures of evil or chaotic nature, commonly. Monster races — the Greenskins, Immortals and Draconians — and virtually wiped out of the face of the planet.

The few monsters who survived the purge of the Order of Light have gathered in the rubble of the Last Black Fortress. They have to put their differences aside and use their instincts to find a way to, together, prevent their races from becoming extinct. But every leader of every race, in and out of Fortaleza, has a personal goal that can cause it to dominate other races once and for all and write your name in the history books, not as a monster, but as a hero.

Find new challenges and adventures in our new game Hérois & Monstros, plus you get special and exclusive cards that will help you defend your fortress. To ensure your game and the cards, click a reward to the side and take your pick: be a hero or a monster. Join!
187673.name: Hérois & Monstros

187674.name: Kings of Israel
187674.description:
User Summary

Overwhelmed by hordes of invading nations – and a series of corrupt kings – the fate of Israel is balanced on a knife’s edge! The Northern Kingdom’s only hope is that a band of prophets can cleanse it of evil and idolatry before the wrath of God does so – permanently.

Based on the strategic board game of the same name, Kings of Israel takes place in ancient Israel during the reign of its kings up until Israel’s destruction by Assyria. The player must use their team of prophets to fight evil growing within Israel, while trying to build the altars needed to win the game. Life will not be easy for the team of prophets! Each turn evil grows within Israel, idols may be built, and chaos continues every turn a bad king leads Israel. But if the player plans well, and uses their actions and resources carefully, they will prevail and go on to new, and more difficult, battles!

The Kings of Israel video game expands on the board game version of the game by allowing the players to level up the difficulty to the game as they play. For those interested in learning more about this period of time, a Bible Study mode can be enabled to ask questions at the start of each round pertaining to the kings, locations, or events during this period of time in Israel. Finally, detailed statistics of each profile's win/loss record are available to view at any time.

187675.description:
Ogoola Karuta is a westernized version of a 400-year-old Japanese card game called Hyakunin-isshu Karuta. The game is sometimes described as intellectual martial arts. It is about listening and being extremely focused and fast, just like the Samurai with their swords. Only here you fight with cards instead.

The game is comprised of two decks of cards, the Reader deck and the Player deck. Cards in the Reader deck contain short poems or poetry quotations while cards in the Player deck contain only the second part of these poems. To begin the game, a Reader is chosen (or you may opt to use the Reader app) and the players are divided into two teams sitting on opposite sides of the table or play area. The Reader shuffles the Reader deck and the Players mix, split evenly the Player deck between the teams and place them face-up in 3-4 rows in front of them. The Reader will read the complete poetry quotation on their cards and the player that finds the matching card first takes that card and puts it aside. If the card taken was on your opponent's side, you must give one card from your side to your opponent. The first team that has no cards left on their side is the winner (you must get rid of all your cards first, to win).

The game is set in Japan during the Genpei war (1180-1185). In order to win the war, you need a strategy. Place the cards you are familiar with close to you (in the beginning it is normal that none of the cards are familiar). If you know what cards your opponent is familiar with, place those cards as far as possible from them inside the playing field. Since the reader or app will always read the complete quotation, you do not need prior knowledge of the poems. Strategically place the playing cards in a way that you can find and take them quickly such as laying them alphabetically or categorize them under the same first words.

Ogoola Karuta Poetry Game is not a translation of the original Japanese game. In this first edition, we have selected 50 of the well-known classical poems written in the English language. It is the first western version of Hyakunin-isshu Karuta, which means Karuta: 100 poems by 100 poets.
187675.name: Ogoola Karuta: 50 English Classics

187676.description:
This starter set contains everything you need to learn and start playing Malifaux! Pit the forces of the mysterious Angel Eyes against the diabolical Dr. Grimwell in a series of starter games which teach you as you play. If you are new to Malifaux and want to know more, this box is for you. In addition to being a good starting point, every model has the "mercenary" characteristic, allowing you to use them with whichever Faction you decide on. Even if you're experienced with Malifaux, you may be interested in the brand new models for the Guild and Neverborn Factions this set contains.

Set Contains:

2 Crews (8 models)
8 Stat Cards
2 Upgrade Cards
2 Quick Reference Cards

Quick Start Booklet
Free Digital Rules Manual
2 Fate Decks
2 Measuring Tapes
187676.name: Malifaux Second Edition Starter Set

187677.name: Speedy Race: Disney Cars
187677.description:
It's a fast-paced race with Lightning McQueen and his friends. Bring your favorite heroes at the finish line first and win the thrilling race!
But be careful, several obstacles are awaiting you during the route, before the winner can roll to the finish.

Each player chooses a pawn and places it in square one.
In your turn, place Lightning McQueen at the center of the action platform and press it flat. Look
as it turns, and in what hole he randomly ends.
Each of the 9 holes has a different action\power that you have to perform.
The first player to cross the finish line wins.

187678.name: DunJon (Issue 1 - Aug 2015)
187678.description:
DunJon
Fantasy Femme Fatale eZine and Print Collection
Issue 1
August 2015

Models: Charlie Kristine, Kristy Harmer, Tam Bam, Jem Meer, Torri Fry and others.

187679.name: The Horus Heresy: Betrayal at Calth
187679.description:
From the official description:

"The Horus Heresy: Betrayal At Calth is a fantastic standalone boxed game of claustrophobic tunnel combat, set during the Word Bearers’ invasion of the Ultramarine world of Calth. Emphasising fast-paced squad-based combat during six exciting missions, it allows players to choose their side and command a force of beautifully detailed Citadel miniatures in a brutal war for survival, during one of the iconic battles of the Horus Heresy."

187680.description:
In Quests of Valeria you play the role of a Guild Master, recruiting and dispatching Citizens to complete quests posted in a tavern in the Capital City of Valeria to earn Victory Points. The player with the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins.

Quests of Valeria is a unique set collection game where players gather Citizens to fill requirements on a Quest. Hire Citizens from the line in the Tavern that provide you with additional actions to build combo's of free actions!

Players take turns taking 2 actions from the following: Drawing cards, Hiring Citizens, Reserving a Quest, or Completing a Quest. When Hiring a Citizen, players pay the cost by discarding cards in their hand and taking the Citizen from the Tavern to their Guild (tableau). Some Citizens have bonus actions and they trigger as soon as they enter a player's Guild. When Completing a Quest, players must send Citizens from their Guild that match the requirements on the Quest to the discard pile. When a player completes 5 Quests, the game ends and player's reveal their Guild Master and count up Victory Points.
187680.name: Quests of Valeria

187681.name: Trio of Taverns (System Neutral Edition)
187681.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trio of Taverns, the third installment in the Tangible Taverns line, features not one, but, you guessed it, three taverns. Give your players the chance to explore what happens when a capable barbarian known for beheading his opponents falls in love with jam making and settles down to open his own shop, or let your players try to seduce a city noble by taking her to the classiest and most romantic tavern in town, or just stick with the basics and let them dance the night away with great entertainment and delicious food, while avoiding the shadier elements.

This instalment of Tangible Taverns brings you three smaller scale taverns each with rumour and event tables, a tavern map, and a description of frequent faces about the establishment (which include names, physical features and personalities for some tavern employees and patrons).

With all that, more original artwork than ever before, and "More Faces at the Tavern", featuring NPCs ready to be slotted into the tavern your PCs are visiting, you are all set to have some role-playing fun when your PCs stop off for a drink.

187682.name: Uncharted Worlds
187682.description:
From the introduction:

Uncharted Worlds is a space opera of discovery and adventure, which explores a universe full of deadly beauty, hostile frontiers, rapacious organisations, and crippling debt. It’s a story-building game where dramatic encounters drive the narrative ever onward, building a solid, memorable universe that’s unique to each group. If you want to pilot your ship across the reaches of space, be the first human to make landfall on alien shores, bring back hard-won exotic cargo, deal with galactic corporations, go toe-to-toe corrupt empires and rebel scum, face down ruthless pirates (or perhaps engage in a bit of interstellar piracy yourself)... then strap yourself in, disengage your mooring clamps and prepare for one hell of a Wild Jump.

187683.name: Promoter
187683.description:
From publisher blurb:

Talking the Talk

As a promoter, it’s my job to make other people look good. It may not sound like the most prestigious work but I take pride in knowing that I’m the reason my clients have any worth. If it weren’t for me, they’d still be pit fighting in some dingy bar near the favelas. Sometimes I need to remind them of that fact, but I try to avoid doing so if they have a gun in their hands.

I may have built a career out of playing to crowds, but that doesn’t mean my talents are wasted else-where. My powers of persuasion are useful when dealing with individuals as well as groups, and my kind are often hired on the side to be negotiators, hagglers, and dealers. Whenever it isn’t appropriate for guns to do the talking, I’m the person you need to have on your side.

Psi-punk Archetypes: Promoter is all about the people who use the power of persuasion to bolster their allies, defame their enemies, and win the favor of the crowd. This supplement provides further insight into the archetype and offers suggestions for skill selections, Gifts, Faults, and Gear that would be useful to any Promoter.

187684.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 60 - Aug 1980)
187684.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 60
August 1980
Cover art by Cody

Published in PDF format September 2015.

187685.name: Medieval Stables
187685.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 24 x 30 inch, full color battlemap of a Medieval Stable.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps (VTT).

“Hurry, get the horses and the goods before we are discovered!”—Horse Thief whispering to his cohorts.

Medieval Stables is a map of a stable, a barn used as a storage building, and a small medieval house. This product also includes a page of top down grid-less horses, donkeys, cows, and an ox or bull for stable animals.

Medieval Stables is intended for use in fantasy or medieval historical period settings.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Thieves in the Night: In the middle of the night while staying at a nearby inn, the group hears sounds coming from the stables that contain their horses and wagons. Rushing to the stables, they find a group of rogues rummaging through their wagons or untethering their horses. The horse thieves mount their horses and ride off. A chase ensues, with the group trying to get back their horses and possessions.

187686.name: OneDice Spies: Cold War
187686.description:
From publisher blurb:

OneDice Spies: Cold War is a roleplaying game set in the Cold War period – a time of espionage, double agents and propaganda – where the stakes are high and the consequences of a wrong move are global annihilation!

OneDice Spies: Cold War provides the rules and information you need so you can play as a Spy – an intelligence agent, working for one (or both!) of the Superpowers; one of the exceptional men and women who relied on their training, wits and courage to complete their missions, rather than a briefcase full of gadgets or a submersible car.

Although this game is designed to reflect the tension and danger of real world spying, several “skins” are provided that offer suggestions on how to add more unusual operatives and situations to your Cold War missions.

Whatever your nationality and ideology, it is time to burn your briefing notes, collect your fake documentation and go to work.

187687.description:
On the Threshold of Discovery! The ancient lands of Osirion are blanketed by the sands of time, and eldritch secrets and vast riches lie just beneath the sun-blistered surface. As modern Osirion opens its tombs to outsiders for the first time in centuries, many of these lost treasures and secrets are now emerging—some more malign than others. Can your group of heroes brave terrible guardians, foul cults, and the burning sands of the desert to stop the rebirth of an ancient tyrant?

This complete cooperative strategy game pits 1 to 4 heroes against the monsters, curses, and traps of the Mummy’s Mask Adventure Path. Choose your character’s class, build a deck of equipment, magic, and allies; and explore dangerous locations as you journey through an exciting fantasy tale. As your adventures continue, your characters add unique gear and awesome magic to their decks as they gain incredible powers, all of which they’ll need to challenge more and more powerful threats.

The Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy’s Mask Base Set includes:

. More than 500 cards, featuring 7 character classes, a wide array of gear and magical treasures,
and dozens of allies, monsters, and villains from the Mummy’s Mask storyline.
. "The Half-Dead City Adventure Deck," which begins your journey through the Mummy’s Mask Adventure Path.
. A complete set of 5 polyhedral dice.
187687.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy's Mask – Base Set
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 60 - Interview with Lone Shark Games Mike Selinker

187688.name: Gutsy
boardgamepublisher: The American Museum of Natural History
187688.description:
PLAYERS WILL EXPLORE THE UNSEEN WORLD OF MICROBES LIVING IN AND ON US

The American Museum of Natural History is introducing an original card game in conjunction with its exhibition The Secret World Inside You, which opens on Saturday, November 7. While working on the development of The Secret World Inside You, exhibition co-curator Susan Perkins, an avid tabletop game enthusiast, pioneered an idea to create a card game allowing players to learn about the community of microbes that live in our guts, known as the gut microbiome. Gutsy is based on the various ways we interact with those microbes on a daily basis and turns those interactions into a fun and educational card game.

The object of the game is for players to attempt to be first to create a healthy gut by diversifying their gut microbiome, which is influenced by what we eat and drink, whom we interact with, and the medicines that we take.

Two to four players draw from a common card deck, collecting microbes and pathogens to build their respective guts.

The first player to have six different kinds of gut microbes wins. The game is intended for players ages eight and up.

Perkins worked with the Museum’s Associate Director for Digital Learning, Barry Joseph, and high school students in the Museum’s Lang Science Program, educators, as well as Eric Teo, from the New York University Game Center MFA program, to create Gutsy.

Playing on the popularity of social card games like Sushi Go! and Killer Bunnies, the developers used illustrations, photos, and information created for The Secret World Inside You exhibition.

187689.name: SWR JST DX Selective Memory Erase Effect
187689.description:
User Summary

A difficult platformer, you play a cat trying to get through some simple platforms guarded by hidden and difficult enemies. You pick up items, such as daggers, for points, but your main aim is to restore the memory of a young woman.

187690.name: Invictus (ICONS)
187690.description:
From publisher blurb:

World's Most Wanted helps you get to the fun faster with pregenerated villains and adventure hooks.

Invictus is a cybernetic terrorist ready for action now in your game.

187691.name: Theater of the Hammed
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
187691.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Adventure for 3rd and 4th-Level DCC RPG Characters

"The people of Minstrel need your help! A divine ritual meant to heal our sleepless king has gone abominably, giving birth to blood-thirsty creatures from the pages of fable! Now we are trapped between both the Western raiders which rule our port, and the nightmarish demons which hold our once great amphitheater. Scattered within the theater are the cursed fable’s pages, which we need to complete the ritual! Where could such a group of adventurers be found, who would dare face creatures and beasts so vile as to even hurl the imaginative minds of a theater audience into abject terror!"

Theater of the Hammed is written to be played by five to seven 3rd-level characters, or four to six 4th-level characters, in approximately six hours of playtime. Because of the dangerous encounters waiting within the amphitheater, it is recommended that the party have both a warrior and dwarf class. Over the course of the adventure, PCs will collect the scattered pages of an enchanted bedtime tale to decipher the weaknesses of their fabled opponents. While exploring the theater, characters will potentially fall deeper under its curse – bolstering both their own strength and their enemies. A new mechanic called the Misbelief Rating (MR) is used to track the players fall from reality. If players fail to manage their MR with vigilance, the adventure may become too much, as the blood-thirsty illusions lurking within complete their passage from the pages of fable into the planes of reality!

This 3rd and 4th-Level DCC RPG Adventure includes an illustrated set of Player Handouts that combine into “The Boy in the Golden Pantaloons” - A dungeon crawler’s fairy tale written exclusively for this adventure!

Theater of the Hammed also introduces a new DCC RPG game mechanic - titled, the "Misbelief Rating" - for tracking how lost within illusion your players fall!

The module includes a "Create your own Melodalia's Medallion of Misbelief" handout - a wearable dial for use within this adventure and future Order of the Quill Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG modules!

Theater of the Hammed includes:

An 8-page, fully illustrated fairy tale player handout!- Approx. 6 hours of gametime for 3rd and 4th-Level characters!
A new DCC RPG game mechanic - the Misbelief Rating!
And... Melodalia's Medallion of Misbelief! A create-your-own handout for the judge to craft his how Misbelief Rating tracker!

187693.name: Relativity Wars
187693.description:
Relativity Wars is an awesome god-type strategy game, set in a universe which obeys Einstein’s theories of relativity! You will be exploring the universe, commanding fleets and deploying weapons that bend the very fabric of space and time.

In Relativity Wars you play a God commanding a civilisation as they begin to explore the universe. Guide your charges in epic real time space battles against the Squishian menace!

Source: The Developer Website.

187694.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 62 - Oct 1980)
187694.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 62
October 1980

Published in PDF format in 2015

187695.name: Animal Gods
187695.description:
User Summary

Animal Gods begins in a sprawling central city area. The main character, Thistle, speaks cryptically of fallen gods, before hinting at what lies in the north, south, east and west. From here, you can choose from three of those directions right away, leading you down a long and very nice-looking road to the three main dungeons of the game.

187696.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 63 - Nov 1980)
187696.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 63
November 1980

Published in PDF format in 2015

187697.name: Friend or Foe
187697.description:
Recover the Summit, Rescue the Captive...

He’s been waiting, waiting for days. Hands tied, captured by enemy forces. He’s confident you will save him. You wouldn’t leave him to languish at the hands of his captors. Would you? Will he be rescued first? Or will his enemies destroy your clan to rescue their own captive?

You must make the treacherous journey across the Karrowlands. The Karrowlands are perilous; a vast and unending land stretching from the desolate desert to the arctic ice, from the rolling grasslands to the fields of lava. Recover the summit. It’s the only way. But who will be there waiting for you? Gwythral, the tameable dragon? Maneeri, the mountain giant known for taking captives of his own? Ragnash, The Wolf of the Underworld, who devours everything in his wake? Or perhaps your enemies have set up an ambush of their own? You must fight.

Control locations to gather resources. Deploy extra recruits. Battle the unsuspecting foes. Advance towards the enemy base. Will you team up with local kinsmen, or will you venture out alone? Choose your clansmen wisely.

He sits and prays for you, his compatriot, to come to rescue him; to save the day. He knows the journey will not be easy. Will you recover the summit and rescue the captive? Or abandon him to your foes. Only time will tell.

187698.name: Coin Crypt
187698.description:
User Summary

You are an adventurer seeking coins above ground and below, defeating enemies in coin fights and getting free coins at pillars. You pass by statues dedicated to the Coin Gods, like Greed and Bullion, wondering if they will awake. The graphics are retro but not extremely so, but the musics sounds 8 bit.

187699.description:

187700.description:
Welcome to the biggest sport of the future – GIANT KILLER ROBOTS : HEAVY HITTERS!

GKR: HEAVY HITTERS is an advertising-driven, televised combat sport where mega corporations fight for lucrative salvage rights and advertising dominance in Earth’s abandoned cities. But more importantly, they need you! Your skills as a pilot and tactician are needed to win, gaining your Faction more fans, and more importantly, loyal consumers.

You will be piloting a Heavy Hitter, the name given to the largest fighting mechs in the battle zone. Flanking your Heavy Hitter in these high stakes sport matches are 3 unmanned robotic support units, consisting of Combat, Repair and Recon. Fighting head-to-head using your Heavy Hitter, you control your entire team of GKRs, strategizing your way to victory. Any dumb mech-jockey can shoot, but can you STRAT? Guess we’re gonna find out!

GKR: Heavy Hitters - A new boardgame set in the world of Giant killer Robots!
187700.name: GKR: Heavy Hitters
boardgameaccessory: GKR: Heavy Hitters – Faction-Themed Defense Dice
boardgamepodcastepisode: 28. Devon Dice Podcast part 2, Show packed full of content.
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 025 – Gen Con 2016
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 039 – Top 10 Mechanisms

boardgameimplementation: Flames of War: Earth and Steel
187701.description:
This is a book which describes the forces that opposed the allied landings from 6 June 1944 to September of the same year.

You will be able to field the charismatic 21 Panzer Division with its captured equipment or attack the allied beacheads with the fanatic SS Tigers with Witmann on the lead.

This book is opposed to the one called Overlord, which covers the allied troops.
187701.name: Flames of War: Atlantik Wall – The German Defence of France June-September 1944

187702.description:
This book contains the forces that assaulted the French coast in 1944 to free it from the German occupation.

With this book, you can field parachute men from the famous 101st Airborne, men of the "Blue&Grey" 29Div. on bloody Omaha, british armoured spearheads heading to Villers Bocage to meet their fate or the powerful 2 Armoured Division as it crosses the Bocage breaking the front.

This book complements with Atlantik Wall, which is the book for the german forces.
187702.name: Flames of War: Overlord – The Allied Invasion of France

187704.name: A birodalom bajnoka
187704.description:
Roman Empire, 115AD... the almighty Emperor received some disturbing news about strange creatures roaming the Empire...

In A birodalom bajnoka (Champion of the Empire) you can play chosen warriors of ancient nations. Follow Jahmes the Egyptian, Labienus the roman legionaire, or Tancred the german chieftain on a mission to defeat a legendary mythological monster - but first you have to improve your skills to have a better chance in the final battle. Among many others, the hellhound Cerberus, the cunning Gorgon or the mighty Cyclops are waiting to meet their fate by your sword!

A birodalom bajnoka is an epic mythological adventure for 2-4 players, where each player controls a Hero, in search of a legendary monster. Players need to accomplish quests, face encounters and gather information about the creature's location.

During their turn players are moving around in ancient Europe, exploring locations and getting involved in richly detailed encounters by drawing Event Cards. Occassionally, they're getting into combat, where a unique battle card-based mechanism combined with dice-rolling determines the outcome.

The player, who finds and kills the monster, will be Champion of the Empire and thus gains eternal fame and glory!

187705.name: Romer
187705.description: A card game where you play cards to stacks and score points for having cards on your hand with the same last digit as a card on top of a stack.

187706.name: Harbinger of the Far Tide
187706.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Earthly manifestation of a preternatural being from beyond space and time. The existence of the Harbinger of the Far Tide makes it clear to those in-the-know that far darker, far more powerful beings are on their way. Your heroes have never faced a threat like this before.

187707.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (November 2015)
rpgissuearticle: 20 Magic Effects Affecting an Evil Altar
20 Minor Effects of Drinking from a Magic Pool
Valley of the Rocks: Notable Inhabitants
187707.description:
From publisher blurb:

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s on-going design of the megadungeon Gloamhold, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

This month’s issue features:

20 Magic Effects Affecting an Evil Altar
Tigley At A Glance (from Village Backdrop: Tigley)
Urban Riot: Minor Events (from Campaign Events: Urban Riot)
Valley of the Rocks: Notable Inhabitants (from Places of Power: Valley of the Rocks)
20 Minor Effects of Drinking from a Magic Pool

187708.name: GM's Miscellany: Village Backdrops III
187708.description:
From publisher blurb:

Village Backdrops are short, richly detailed supplements that each present a single village ready to insert into almost any home campaign. Perfect for use as a waystop on the road to adventure, as an adventure site themselves or as a PC’s home, Village Backdrop present the details so the busy GM can focus on crafting exciting, compelling adventures.

This GM’s Miscellany collects together the third twelve Village Backdrops, along with bonus, never seen before material, together in one place.

GM’s Miscellany: Village Backdrops III is the work of many talented designers and features the following villages:

Aldwater (by Jacob Triet)
Arrowhill (by Mike Kimmel)
Aubade (by Jacob W. Michaels)
Coldwater (by Creighton Broadhurst)
Denhearth (by Jacob W. Michaels)
Edgewood (by Mike Welham)
Fulhurst Moors (by Jacob Trier)
Hopespyre (By Jacob W. Michaels)
Idyll (by Mike Welham)
Kennutcat (by John Bennett)
Red Talon (by Richard Green)
Sea Bitch (by Richard Green)
Starspun Hollow (by Nicholas Wasko)
St. Fiacre (by Alexander Augunas)
Wellswood (by Creighton Broadhurst)

187709.name: Election!
187709.description:
George Washington and Abraham Lincoln are two of the most renowned figures in American history, but who would make a better President in 2016? In 1860? In 1792? Let the voters decide! Election! is an interactive family board game with a focus on America’s greatest leaders.

As a player, you have been granted the power to manage a political party that is desperate for control of the White House. In addition to selecting candidates, you may also take advantage of external factors to influence the election in your party's favor. Should you stay positive by gaining the support of a popular activist or attempt to smear an opponent's image by revealing a scandal? Do you take the high road and try to win ethically or attempt to sabotage your opponents through dirty politics? Should you throw in the towel or demand a recount? Votes are all that matters as you navigate your way to the White House.

GAMEPLAY

1) Determine the Election Year: Each round, randomly select an Election Year card that lists the most important issues of that time in American history.

2) Party Nominations: Each player selects 1 of the 5 Presidential Candidate cards from their hand. Players nominate a candidate based on ratings that show the card’s overall polling strength of the issues being discussed.

3) Roll Dice to Determine Votes: Custom dice are rolled based on a candidate's rating. The rating corresponds to the important issues set on the Election Year card. Higher ratings often result in more votes.

Bonus) Red Tape and Public Opinion cards are wild cards that have the power to impact an election (for better or worse).

4) The player with the most votes wins the election and advances along the game board. The winner is the first player to advance to the White House space at the end of the board.

After winning a series of elections with shrewd strategy and a bit of luck, the player who first advances to the White House space on the board wins the game and earns the right to be called Mr. or Mrs. President! Mudslinging and dirty politics guaranteed!

187710.name: ICONS Assembler
187710.description:
From publisher blurb:

Icons Assembly – with just a click!

Icons Assembler is a character creation and management application for Icons Superpowered Roleplaying.

Created by Joe Wetzel of Inkwell Ideas, Icons Assembler produces random characters using the tables from the Assembled Edition of the game (including material from Great Power and Icons A to Z), allows for unlimited character customization and editing, and features character sketch tools. It also provides in-play management tools and lets you save and share your Icons characters!

You get Windows .exe, OS X, and Java versions of the application with your purchase, usable for whatever platform you wish. Icons Assembler makes the quick and easy hero creation of Icons even faster with just a few clicks!

187711.name: Kaiten: Die Sushi-Bar
187711.description:
From the rulebook (translated):

In Kaiten: Die Sushi-Bar every player takes the role of a sushi chef. Collect the correct ingredients, produce different sorts of sushi and take care of your guests!
Full people are happy people and the tip will be generous - sometimes.
At the end of the game, the player owning the most money wins, called the most successful sushi chef!

Players have to buy and combine ingredients (wooden cubes) following different recipes (combinations) to make sushi (earn sushi tokens). These will be placed on player-colored plates onto a sushi-belt (the board) to feed up hungry guests. The guests - represented by guest cards and mostly with unique special rules - take place around the sushi-belt wishing for a variety of different sushi types.
On turn, players can choose from different fixed actions like buying ingredients, making sushi or cleaning dirty plates. Or they can roll a die to perform special actions (for example changing plates places on the belt) or to activate events like new guests or moving all the plates on the belt one field clockwise.
The game ends instantly when the last guest leaves the restaurant and the player owning the most money wins.

187713.name: The Avengers: Uniti per vincere
187713.description:
The Avengers - Uniti per vincere is a cooperative game where players join together their forces to save the world from villains.
Choose your favourite Avenger with his skill. Play rolling one or two dice and moving your counter on the board. Make the action according to the square you land: collect a token, move to a square as you want, draw a card, exchange tokens with another player.
Collect the tokens and try to defeat the villains, together with the other players.
If you’ll defeat all the villains before the game ends you’ll win!

Competitive play:
If you want, you can also play to be the best Avenger at the end of game.
At the start of game, each player receives 3 secret mission cards. Examples: “Defeat Loki” or “Have the most hammers”.
All players cooperate to defeat all the villains, and if they succeed, the player with the most points is the overall winner and the best Avenger.

187714.name: Exultate Deo -The Fluffy Rite-
187714.description:
User summary:
Exultate Deo〜ぬいぐるみ工房の秘密〜 (Exultate Deo -The Fluffy Rite-) in English means "Exultate Deo -The secret of the teddy bear atelier-. This is a no-bidding, no-trump, trick-taking game where you must follow suit without using any cards.

The players are craftsmen at a teddy bear atelier and make teddy bears to offer to the god Lord Teddy. The best teddy bear is offered to Lord Teddy and the craftsman who has created that teddy receives a trophy. The aim to receive the highest number of trophies.

Five cubes of different colors are used for the game. At each trick, the player combines two cubes from their hand. One of the two cubes represents the suit and the other the rank.

Publisher's summary:
カードを一切使わない、ノンビッド、ノートランプ、マストフォローのトリックテイキングです。
プレイヤーは、ぬいぐるみ工房の職人となって、ぬいぐるみの神『おテディさま』へ捧げるぬいぐるみを作ります。
最も上手に出来たぬいぐるみを『おテディさま』に捧げ、そのぬいぐるみを作った職人には栄誉が与えられます。
各プレイヤーは、この栄誉に最も多く預かることを目指します。
ゲームには5色のキューブを使い、プレイヤーは毎トリック、手持ちのキューブから2個を組み合わせて手を作ります。片方がスート、もう片方がランクを表します。"

187715.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Yugo Unleashed
187715.description:
A promo character for Krosmaster games.

This version of Yugo is still a member of the Brotherhood of the Tofu, and has the ability - "Wakforce"

Attack spells gain Pierces armour if the targeted character is adjacent to YUGO

187717.name: Tips Ahoy
187717.description: A stacking/balancing game with unique kinetic action. Draw a card to tell you which pirate to pile onto the ship and which water tile to use, then pull the water tile under the ship to make the boat rock on the waves. Try not to let your pirates fall overboard, but you might try to knock off your opponent's! Each player gets one coin for each of her pirates remaining on the ship after movement of the water tile.

187718.name: Sainome Colosseum
boardgamepublisher: MR エンターテイメント (MR Entertainment)
187718.description:
User summary:
サイノメコロシアム (Sainome Colosseum) is a card game where two fantasy characters fight each other. The publisher MR エンターテイメント (MR Entertainment) is the designer for this game.

Each turn, you may perform two of the following actions:
1) Fill your hand up to five cards
2) Equip yourself with cards in your hand and/or currently equipped cards
3) Play a card for a special effect
4) Attack your opponent

You have four slots to equip weapons, spells and/or items. In general, weak cards are versatile and can be equipped on any slot, but strong ones must be equipped on a certain slot.

When attacking, you roll a die to determine which slot is activated (roll of a 2 activates slot A, a 3 activates slot B, etc.), then damage and effect are determined. Used cards are discarded, so you will have to refill the slot, or your chance of a miss will be increased on your next attack.

Each character has their own special ability that goes well with specific cards.

You win the game when your opponent's life is reduced to zero.

Publisher's summary:
2人用の対戦型カードゲームです。
キャラクターに装備をつけサイコロを振り、出た目のカード効果で攻撃を行います。
最終的に相手のHPを0にした者が勝ちとなります。

187719.description:
The Banner Saga: Warbands is a cooperative game for 1-4 players. Players take up the role of the leaders in a warband tasked with keeping the warband together and alive. It is a cooperative, miniatures board game that deals with the difficulties and consequences of decision making.

There are four roles in the warband: Quartermaster, Keeper of Names, Warmaster, and Thane. Each role must aggressively push for resolutions that help out themselves, while being open to compromise for the good of the warband. It is this conflict and compromise that is the heart of Warbands.
187719.name: The Banner Saga: Warbands
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 006 – Top Kickstarter Games

187720.name: Skyfortress
187720.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is a deadly orbital defence installation.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

187721.name: Guild of Shadows: Rogues Hall of Fame
187721.description:
From publisher blurb:

Descriptions and stats for more than 25 famous rogues from myth and history. Featuring Guy Fawkes, Dick Turpin, Robin Hood, Colonel Thomas Blood, Blackbeard the Pirate, Jack the Ripper, and many more!

This product requires Savage Worlds and uses the new Edges and Hindrances from Guild of Shadows.

187722.name: Manor Houses
187722.description:
From publisher blurb:

Revised and expanded, Castle Builder Reforged, Chapter 2 takes you through the ins and outs of the myriad ways you can use manor houses to provide flavor to any adventure or campaign.

A partial list of what you’ll find inside:

Sample maps
some updated artwork
turning the manor house into a useable, lightweight fortress
understanding when and why that might be a good or bad option

187723.name: Bio-Tech 2100
187723.description:
From the publisher's website:

Make New Friends

In the future of Transhuman Space, no field has grown as much or had such a profound impact as biotechnology. The exploitation of new frontiers in space and underwater has pushed civilization's boundaries – but only because biotech has delivered improved humans capable of living there, not to mention bioroids and uplifted animals to do much of the work. And behind these visible innovations is a great deal of change, both scientific and social.

Transhuman Space: Bio-Tech 2100 complements Transhuman Space: Bioroid Bazaar, taking a closer look at the practical details behind upgrades, parahumans, uplifts, bioroids, and bioshells. It delivers setting information and game mechanics valuable to gamers interested in playing champions or enemies of the biotech revolution – friends or foes of the not-quite-human and nothing-like-human beings that now share the solar system. Contents include:

A review of Transhuman Space biotech from both scientific and social perspectives.
Notes on skills and abilities needed to create, identify, and even impersonate artificial life.
New looks at Legality Class and Social Stigma in a sprawling setting with endless societies, and at what "species" really means in game terms.
Stats for 11 uplifted or adapted animals, and seven bioroid animals.
Whether your goal is to design a custom pet, pick farmyard stock for your Mars colony, or track down rogue bioroids, Bio-Tech 2100 is here with the facts and figures!

187724.name: Planar Primer
187724.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Primer on the Planes of Existence

Includes an introduction to the planes of existence, an overview of the planar cosmology, a schematic of planar interaction, an introdution to travel & encounters on the Astral and Ethereal Planes, and information on plane-related magic.

187725.name: VersuS
187725.description:
VersuS is a board game for two to four players. Players take turns moving their pawns around a uniquely designed board, trapping and capturing other players' pawns until there is only one player left on the board, who wins the game.

Pawns move like castles in chess: up, down, left or right, as far across the board as the player wants, and can also push and pull other pawns or jump over pawns.

With three moves each turn and a new turn after every capture games move quickly and the winner is never clear until near the end.

187726.name: Gagario
187726.description: Gagario (ガガリオ) is a two-player only game consisting of only twelve cards in which players try to exit the round at the right time based on what's been played to the table and what they think the other player has in hand.

187727.name: The Waltzing Cat
187727.description:
The Waltzing Cat is a two-player game that consists of eleven wooden blocks, with each of those blocks depicting two differently-colored cats on opposite sides. Gold cats show up five times, red and blue four times, and white, black and green three times; no color is repeated on a block with another color that appears the same number of times, e.g., red doesn't share a block with red or blue, but it does with the other four colors.

To set up, shuffle the blocks without looking at them, then set them up so that each player can see only one side of each block. The player who sees more gold cats takes the first turn. On a turn, a player pushes a block away from them (so that it falls on the table), pulls a block toward them, or declares the end of the game. If you push a block and the face that lands facing up appears on another face-up block, then you keep the block that you just pushed over. If you pull a block — thereby revealing a face that you haven't seen — and the face that lands facing up appears on another face-up block, then you keep both matching blocks.

If you declare the end of the game, the other player takes turns either pushing or pulling blocks (claiming blocks when appropriate) until no further matches can be made; the player who claimed the end of the game then takes all remaining face-up blocks.

Players then tally their scores for the face-up cats in their collection. Each gold cat is worth 2 points, while each non-gold cat is worth 1 point. A pair of one blue and one red cat is worth an additional 3 points (for 5 total points). Whoever scores the most points wins!

rpgitemversion: Mouse Guard La Guardia dei Topi Gioco di Ruolo
187728.name: Mouse Guard Roleplaying Game Boxed Set (Second Edition)
187728.description:
Join the Mouse Guard and defend the Mouse Territories against predators and dangers, in this roleplaying game based on the David Petersen's acclaimed Mouse Guard comic book series! This second edition of the Origins Award-winning Mouse Guard Roleplaying Game Box Set contains everything players need to immerse themselves into the world of the Guard, including rules for forming patrols and leading missions into the beleaguered territories, as well as new art, additional Action, Weapon, and Condition cards, and a revised and updated rulebook.

-Source: Publisher's synopsis.

187730.name: Bugle
187730.description: Bugle (ビューグル) is a two-player only game of goblins vs. dwarves, with the two armies competing on a small battlefield and with the bugles determining in which directions an army can move on the subsequent turn.

187731.name: Tempest: Shards of the Gods
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games
187731.description:
In the world of Tempest: Shards of the Gods, the apocalypse has come and gone. The world as it once was has been shattered into countless shards of reality. The only things that remain are the gods and what pieces they could salvage before the end came.

Take the place of a god of ancient myth:

Anubis: leading the Egyptians
Athena: leading the Greeks
Inari: leading the Japanese
Heimdallr: leading the Norse




Tempest: Shards of the Gods features a number of unique mechanics:

Discard any card for resources. Resources do not build each turn; instead, every card you play comes at the sacrifice of another.
Tailor your deck to your opponent as you play. Split your resources between modifying and building your deck, or playing cards to fight your opponent.
Tell the best story to win. Demigod and Tale cards have Labors that can be completed to score Victory Points. Reach 5 points first to win the game.




Fight for dominion over what is left, conquer enemy shards to piece together a universe for yourself, fend off attacks from rival gods and set your name in myth.

187732.name: Phasic (Issue 1 - Aug 2008)
187732.description:
Phasic - A Tiny Little ENCOUNTER CRITICAL Fanzine
Issue 1
August 2008

187737.name: Opponent Opuscule
187737.description:
From the introduction:

Being a compendium of the creatures both fell and foul that inhabit the world of Vanth in the medieval sector of the galaxy.

User summary:

PDF layout is two-page per sheet, paginated for pamphlet printing. PDF has 40 pages; printed pamphlet has 80 pages. Original version was released in 1978; this "second revised printing" was released in 1981. Contains monsters, listed A to Z, like a traditional "monster manual". Stat block mirrors nearly exactly that used for Advanced Dungeons & Dragons 1st Ed.

187738.name: Critical Skills
187738.description:
User summary:

This document attempts to clarify under what conditions certain skills would apply and how certain skills may be used. Each skill presented in the core rules is listed along with comments on when they might apply, and how a player might use them to enhance their game. The product also contains hints for Journey Masters (game masters).

187739.name: Pagelaran Yogyakarta
187739.description:
Yogyakarta or Jogja is an Indonesia city state in the heart of Java island. This city are well known for their historical places and arts. Performing Arts also one of the reason the tourist from all over the places came to visit.

In Pagelaran Yogyakarta, Players take role as a new appointed manager of the fictional theater that on the brink of bankruptcy. They are challenged to save this building by manage the show that would interest the tourists that come to this building.

On each turn, a player will going to choose one of three possible actions. Are they going to looking for a funding, looking for show to perform on the next turn, or to perform a show from the show card that they have on their hand? Also there's a debt to be paid on the end of the month (every 4th round)

187740.description: Dominion: Fan-Edition I is a German language collection box, including promotional cards, blank cards and additional material.
187740.name: Dominion: Fan-Edition I

187741.name: What Are The Odds?
187741.description:
A roulette-style dare game where players take turns challenging each other to dares listed on black cards.

Each round, one player (The Challenger) draws a black card and challenges the rest of the players to do the task on the card. The rest of the players collectively decide what the odds are. On the count of 3, every player throws down one of their number cards. If your number matches The Challenger's, you have to do the challenge.

187744.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 2.11 - Nov 2015)
rpgissuearticle: What's Going On With Misfit Studios
187744.description:
From publisher blurb:

The monthly newsletters by Misfit Studios presents news regarding what is going on with the company, recaps the products it released during the previous month, and offers a product promotion.

187745.name: Papecarz: The Papercraft Racing Board Game
187745.description:
Papecarz is a "roll and move" racing game, a mix of strategy, placement & luck.
Two to six players control racing cars competing to win a single 8 lap race or a series of races.
As a driver, the player has to cunningly calculate every single move to make the most of the Caution Flags, restart, Slingshot Passes, Pushing and Shunting.
While as a crew chief, the player has to plan an effective and flexible race strategy and keep an eagle eye on the opponent's tactics.

The race is made up of four main phases:
-Pre start: you choose your setup and decide the start grid.
-Start: you want to try to get a good position straight away.
-First 7 laps: here you need to get as many Boost points as you can and try to avoid the Damage cards.
-Last lap: put the pedal to the metal! it’s your chance to cross the finish line first and win the race.
At the end of each lap you get a card depending on your position; the higher your position, the better your card.
1st: one White card =2 Boost points
2nd & 3rd: one green card =1 Boost points
4th & 5th: one brown card =damage (Watch out! you could be in trouble!)
6th: one black card= serious damage (Oh no! you're in big trouble!)
And when you pit, this is where your strategy comes in; each car has two possible setups.
It's the setup that tells you how many cards and kinds of cards you can turn over and convert.
Your setup also tells you when you can take a risk and roll the dice.
if the car in first place fails a dice roll...the yellow flag come out: CAUTION!
The race restarts with all the cars now bunched up together and some player starts cursing , while other players cheer (Yeah!); It all depends on your pit strategy!

187746.name: Auf dem Kriegspfad
187746.description: The players start at the big red space in the upper left corner of the game board. They have to spy on the enemy camp in the upper right corner and get back to the starting space near their own camp. At the red assembling points the players have to wait for all the other players on the same path, before they can move again. On the black spaces marked with a "T" the indians are trapped and have to wait for a trapper to come along and free them. Players of the same team may donate their die rolls to one another under certain circumstances. The first indian or team of indians to return home wins the game.

187747.name: Planiglob: Reise- und Handelsspiel
187747.description:
Before the start of the game, the payers agree on the starting harbor and destination harbors of the game. The destinations get marked with a lighthouse. At the harbors along the way the players may buy and sell goods according to the export-products-table while minding the loading capacity of their ships. Each player has to make a previously agreed upon number of excursions per train. When the players return to their home harbors, they sell the rest of their products, in which each subsequently arriving player gets less profit.

The game was published about 1900.

187748.name: White Lies
187748.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is best described by Director Connor Black, in his address to the newest round of fresh recruits:

Sometimes people tell lies for good reasons. Ask any parent who has lied to his child about the loss of a loved one. Ask any man who was ever asked if everything was going to be okay when he knew it would not. Sometimes the truth is too ugly for people to hear. Sometimes if the truth were known it would change everything. It’s these little white lies that people tell their children, men tell their families, and governments tell their people that keep us safe.

The Constitution lists eighteen specific enumerated powers of congress. One is omitted from public view though. The ones you’ve seen are what are shown to the rest of the world but nothing is as transparent as that. Even the founding fathers had spy networks, without which their revolution would have failed in its earliest days. There is indeed a nineteenth power in Article I Section 8. It’s very specific and highly secretive and involves the security of this nation, outside the scope of its military, navy, militia, or even the highly known FBI or CIA.

To execute this power, a bureau within the government exists, layered in secrecy and discretely funded. Bureau 19. New agents have been recruited and are about to be trained, and they stand beside you today.

I give you one last chance to voluntarily leave, before you learn things that cannot be unlearned. The questions you must now ask yourself: Are you willing to do bad things for good reasons? Are you willing leave the comfort of ignorance behind, and to take action on the truths you learn? Are you willing to live a life of white lies?

Based on Swords & Wizardry WhiteBox, White Lies brings all the simple elegance of WhiteBox out of the dungeon and into the realm of espionage and paramilitary action and adventure! The digital purchase includes character sheets (both class-specific and blank) and a small Admin toolkit called Echo Team, containing a team of pre-generated level 1 agents for you to use as NPCs or quick players characters.

187749.name: Operation: Snipe Hunt
187749.description:
From publisher blurb:

A sniper has been targeting citizens, police officers, city officials, office workers, hot dog vendors. No one is safe from the sudden and unexpected strike of a high powered round. An ambassador from a newly formed nation is scheduled to arrive tomorrow to meet with the Mayor. Your Agents are tasked with finding the Sniper and ensuring the safety of The City!

The clock is ticking and the city is terrified, can you succeed on a Snipe Hunt?

This is an adventure for DwD Studios White Lies Espionage RPG, but could easily be used with any other espionage system you enjoy. Designed for a small group of new to slightly experienced agents, this adventure combines investigation with the possiblity of gunplay, but take care or your Agents could find themselves in the Crosshairs!

187750.name: Alician Draughts
187750.description:
The rules of Alician Draughts were first described in the book "Les Jeux de dames non orthodoxes et autres jeux à pions" in 1956.

The standard game of International Draughts is played using two boards, A and B. The normal array is on board A; board B starts empty.

In turn, each player makes a single move on either board following these three rules:

1. A move must be legal on the board where it is played.
2. A piece can only move or capture if the corresponding destination square on the other board is vacant.
3. After moving, the piece is transfered to the corresponding square on the other board.

The original board (not the "mirror board") decides the game:

Whenever a player has no piece left on the original board, he loses even within a move. A move consists of up to three stages: Movement (which can be a jump in case of a capture), Transfer of the moved piece to the other board, Removal of any captured pieces. That is, if at any stage a player had no pieces left on the original board, he lost the game.

In practice, it is possible to play Alician Draughts on a single board, if the checkers have a piece of felt glued to their bottom. When a piece (men or king) is transferred to the "mirror board", it is just turned upside down.

Despite many similarities Alician Draughts is in fact a very different game. While in International Draughts more than 50% of all tournament games today end in a draw, in Alician Draughts a draw is impossible.

187751.name: Lee-class Merchant Vessel
187751.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gypsy Knights Games is proud to present the tenth entry in our line of products dedicated to the starships of Clement Sector.

In 2336, the small Boone based company Boone Starship Industries embarked on a program to modify the Rucker-class merchant vessel in order to improve cargo handling capability and to bring down monthly costs for operators. After a year of successive failures to bring this vision to reality, the design director took a proposal to the company board that a new design was what was needed instead of attempting to modify an already successful existing design.

The board of directors agreed and design work commenced on a new merchant ship (simply called type one) that included the cargo handling improvements initially proposed.

Over the six months of design, the initial three hundred tonne design was increased to four hundred tonnes to improve cargo capacity. Outwardly the type one was inspired by the style of the larger Atlas-class freighter which was license-built and maintained by BSI’s main shipyard orbiting Boone.

The type one became the Lee-class merchant vessel and is now one of the most popular new options for carrying cargo throughout Clement Sector.

The Lee-class merchant vessel is an ideal ship to be used for merchant characters within Clement Sector or in any Traveller setting. The ship's versatility allows it to be the home vessel for a variety of character groups from merchants to pirates to those simply needing an efficient vessel to get from Point A to Point B. The vessel has been designed to be used by a group of player characters and will become a valuable asset for Referees to use in any sort of Traveller game.

Ships of Clement Sector 10: Lee-class Merchant Vessel comes complete with beautiful views of the ship. The Lee-class is presented with full deckplans and statistics to make your use of our product simple, easy and fun. In addition, the Lee comes with a set of adventure hooks to get your characters right into the action as well as a short story written by Bradley Warnes.

Though designed specifically with our Clement Sector setting in mind, the Lee-class could easily be used in any Traveller setting.

Get on board! Adventure awaits!

187752.name: Catoblepas
187752.description:
From publisher blurb:

That cow you tried to milk? Too bad for you it's a catoblepas. Now you're a statue. Bad decision.

This monster is desgined for the 5th edition version of the most popular RPG. Print it out, and unleash it upon your unsuspecting players.

187753.name: Queen's Road Adventure
187753.description:
From publisher blurb:

Queen’s Road Adventure is the third offering in the Provincia series. The main road from the prior government is known as the Queen’s Road and spans the north-south axis of the land. While it has fallen into disrepair it is still used to get to the largest city in Provincia, Queen’s Point. This community sits on the Golleck’s Bay and is filled with opportunities for young adventurers…they just have to get there!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Provincia Campaign for a group of 4-6 adventurers that are level 2-4. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for several one shot adventures or a continuing campaign setting!

187754.name: Mascha und der Bär: Bühne frei für Mascha!
187754.description:
Masha lives in a little cottage in the woods. With her fun, games and pranks, she really turns the idyllic life of her neighbour, a former circus bear, topsy-turvy. All the bear wishes for is a quiet life, but bubbly Masha keeps on causing havoc, making sure the bear’s life is full of action and adventure!
Today is Masha’s big day: the stage has been erected and all of her costumes are ready and waiting for her appearance. All of her friends are attending the show.
Arrange exciting scenes and make sure to pay attention since also you will play an important role in Masha’s play! Fans of Masha can playfully test their memory with three amusing memo games.

The game comes with three variants, and everytime you play, you choose the variant you prefer:
Variant 1 - Can you see the difference?
Variant 2 - Memo
Variant 3 - True or false

The game ends as soon as each player has had four turns. The person with the most points after four turns wins the game.

187755.name: Showdown
187755.description:
From the publisher website:
Showdown è un gioco che parla di due persone bloccate in una lotta l'una contro l'altra, e con sé stesse, che può finire solo con la morte di uno di loro (e probabilmente con la sconfitta morale di entrambi).

English translation:
Showdown is a game about two people locked in a fight against each other, and with themselves, which can only end with the death of one of them (and probably with the moral defeat of both).

187756.name: The Geomancer's Handbook
187756.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Geomancer’s Handbook is an expansion to the Nature sphere from the Spheres of Power magic system. Inside these pages you’ll find new talents, new packages, new magic items, new rituals and incantations, and even nature-themed monsters transposed to using the Spheres of Power system.

The Geomancer’s Handbook is book 1 in a multi-part series, funded via Patreon.

187758.name: The Original Question
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
187758.description:
From publisher blurb:

When exposing corruption and crime through journalism fails to stop it, Vic Sage transforms himself into the mysterious Question to make sure justice is served.

The Question is considered as one of Steve Ditko's signature works. The Original Question collects all the stories he drew and plotted featuring the character. Also included is a new history of the character that incorporates him into NUELOW Games' comic book/RPG universe, d20 Modern feats and talents, and a ROLF! battle scenario so you can bring the Question (or a character like him) into you home games.

THERE ARE QUESTIONS TO ASKED... AND ANSWERS TO BE QUESTIONED.

187759.name: Monsters for the Masters: Great Insects
187759.description:
From publisher blurb:

Does your Fifth Edition game need more monsters? Then look no further! This supplement, Monsters for the Masters: Giant Insects, provides Game Masters with seventeen giant insects to use in their campaigns. Ranging from a Challenge Rating (CR) of 1/8 (the giant leech) to 8 (the giant slug), these monstrous vermin are a fantastic addition to any Fifth Edition Game Master's arsenal of monsters.

This book is part of the Monsters for the Masters series, a set of 5E-compatible bestiary supplements released under the Open Gaming License. Each supplement focuses on a particular type of creatures, such as giant insects, dinosaurs, demons or angels. The discerning Game Master need only pick up the monsters he desires that fit his campaign needs, without having to spend a significant amount of money on a larger tome for only a handful of useful creatures.

This bestiary supplement uses a common OGL monster entry format as its base, with modifications to support the presentation of Fifth Edition monster statistics that are easy to read and easy to use at the table, all while remaining within its Open Gaming Content roots.

187760.name: Modern Options: The Tome Of Talents
187760.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modern Options: The Tome of Talents is a complete compendium of 23 new talent trees for use with your D20-based roleplaying games based on the Modern System Reference Document. This 15-page supplement contains 78 new talents and 10 new feats intended to expand the options in your modern and near-modern D20-based campaigns. It's ideal for GMs and Players alike!

187761.name: A Primer
187761.description:
From publisher blurb:

Out towards the rim of the Milky Way galaxy, a thousand parsecs away from Old Earth, far from that little yellow sun called Sol, lays a region of space known as the Azri Drakara sector!

Flynn's Guide To Azri Drakara: A Primer is a campaign resource and sourcebook for Traveller that introduces a complete game setting which can be used with the Traveller system, or even other science fiction rules sets. This book provides an overview to the setting, including a history of the Dracosian Republic, a map of Azri Drakara sector, an introduction to 11 different interstellar polities that exist within the sector, details for 15 intelligent species (both human and alien) frequently encountered within Azri Drakara sector, and some design notes providing a behind-the-scenes peek at some of the elements included in this new Traveller campaign setting.

187762.name: Republic Starships
187762.description:
From publisher blurb:

Flynn's Guide To Azri Drakara: Republic Starships is a campaign resource and sourcebook for Traveller that describes starships common to the Dracosian Republic. This book provides an overview of the use of starships within the Republic (including a hierarchy of military vessels, the proper use of distress signals and an alternate approach to the Ship Shares material benefit), detailed descriptions for 18 different space vessels, and a complete set of space encounter tables and rules.

187763.name: Patrons By The Dozen
187763.description:
From publisher blurb:

Flynn's Guide to Azri Drakara: Patrons by the Dozen is an adventure sourcebook for Traveller that contains a dozen Patron Encounters, each one defining an adventure scenario with six possible resolutions. These adventures can be used with the Traveller system, or even other science fiction rules sets. These Patron Encounters are intended for use in the Azri Drakara campaign setting, but can be used in any Traveller campaign with little or no changes.

187764.name: Rodan Subsector
187764.description:
From publisher blurb:

Flynn's Guide To Azri Drakara: Rodan Subsector is campaign resource and sourcebook for Traveller that provides a complete game setting which can be used with the Traveller system, or even other science fiction rules sets. This book focuses on the 40 primary worlds located within a single subsector on the frontier of the Azri Drakara sector. It provides astrography maps, world data, library data, rumors and a number of patron encounters to help you begin your next science-fiction campaign among the borderworlds of the Dracosian Republic.

Flynn's Guide to Azri Drakara: Rodan Subsector is the first product of the Flynn's Guide To Azri Drakara series. This series provides details on the Azri Drakara sector, a region in space where Referees and players can engage in all manner of science fiction adventuring.

187765.name: Cepheus Subsector
187765.description:
From publisher blurb:
