Flynn's Guide To Azri Drakara: Cepheus Subsector is a campaign resource and sourcebook for Traveller that provides a complete game setting for use with the Traveller system, or even other science fiction rules sets. This book focuses on 39 primary worlds located within a single subsector on the frontier of the Azri Drakara sector. Inside its covers, you will find astrography maps, world data, library data, an overview of the structure of the Dracosian Republic, and a new system for creating adventure seeds, all designed to help you begin your next science-fiction campaign among the borderworlds of the Dracosian Republic.

Flynn's Guide to Azri Drakara: Cepheus Subsector is the latest product of the Flynn's Guide To Azri Drakara series, which provides details on the Azri Drakara sector, a region in space where Referees and players can engage in all manner of science fiction adventuring.

187766.name: OGL Alternatives: Alternate Advancement System
187766.description:
From publisher blurb:

OGL Alternatives: Alternate Advancement System provides Gamemasters with an alternate method for calculating advancement that is both easy and fun to use. Designed with flexibility in mind, AAS gives the individual GM the means to reward only those aspects of the gaming session that he wishes to emphasize, and then only use those aspects to advance characters towards their next character level.

This product also provides details on how to convert from a standard XP-based game to an AAS-based game, how to convert Session Points into Experience Points and vice versa, notes on individual awards versus group awards, notes on using the system without giving up the traditional XP Table, and even includes a lengthy example of the advancement system in use.

This fully-bookmarked roleplaying product offers discerning Gamemasters a powerful tool for bringing the fun back to character advancement. Though geared towards D20-based gaming systems, AAS is easily applicable to any level-based roleplaying game system.

187767.name: Masha and the Bear: Trouble in the Garden
187767.description:
Masha and Bear lavish care and attention on the fruit and vegetables in their garden: the strawberries, raspberries, carrots and all the other healthy delicacies. They love picking them and nibbling on them. But what’s THAT? Every night, uninvited guests get amongst the beds and help themselves to the fruit and vegetables. Who on earth can it be? Get your thinking caps on and start guessing!
Who knows which animal is going to cause havoc in Masha and the Bear’s garden next? The player to guess correctly the most times can advance his figure the furthest, and wins the game.

Each player selects one animal card. Each player places the selected animal card face-down in front of them. The other three animal cards are put to one side, also face-down.
Once all the players have decided on one animal and have put down the animal card in front of them, face-down, the youngest player takes the shaker, shakes it vigorously and then tips all the chips out onto the table. The chips must be separated such that the top side of the chip is clearly recognised.
Now each player turns their selected animal card face-up and compares it: How many animal chips can you see that show the same animal as depicted on your own card? You are allowed to move your figure precisely the same amount of fields up the game board.

The player whose figure is the first to reach the final field is the
winner.

187768.name: Mascha und der Bär: Chaos vor der Party
187768.description:
Tidy up the room along with Masha. Before the guests turn up, each and every object must be in its own place.

At the beginning of the game, each player is allowed to turn over one tile such that it is visible for all players. Once you have remembered your pictures, turn the tiles back face-down.
The youngest player casts the die and performs the action. The die is then cast in a clock-wise direction. Each die has a different action.
You all play together, so you are allowed to give each other tips.

Once all the objects are in their right places, face-up so that they can be seen, you have tidied up Masha’s room in time and, therefore, have won!
Once Bear, Rabbit and Squirrel reach the front door, you are allowed to turn over all the tiles. If all the objects happen to be in their right places, you have still won. If, however, you haven’t managed to tidy up in time, sorry but you have lost this round and the only thing to do is play another round!

187769.description:
Rolling World, based on the 2014 release Rolling Japan, is a light "multiplayer solitaire" dice game. Each player has a map of the world that's divided into regions, which are then bunched together into six differently colored areas.

On a turn, a player draws two regular six-sided dice from a bag and rolls them; the bag starts with seven dice, six matching the colors of the areas on the map along with a wild gray die. All players now write down each number rolled on any state of the matching color, i.e., if the blue die shows 4 and the yellow a 2, write a 4 in one blue state and a 2 in one yellow state. If the gray die is rolled, you can place this number in a state of your choice; additionally, three times per game you can choose to use a non-gray die as any color. However, neighboring states can't have numbers with a difference larger than 1; if you can't place a number without breaking this rule, then you must place an X in a state of the appropriate color. (If all the states in an area are filled, you can ignore the die or use one of your three color changes to place the number elsewhere.)

After six dice have been rolled, mark one round as being complete, then return the dice to the bag and start the next round. After a number of rounds the game ends, and whoever has the fewest Xs on their map wins.
187769.name: Rolling World

187770.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 225 - 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
People are Strange when you're a Stranger
187770.description:
"The Chase Is On"
Cover by the Fraim Brothers

187771.name: Bibi Blocksberg: Verhexter Hexenbesen
187771.description:
You start the game with the enchanted witch broom. For this game, it's important to listen and react quickly, because the broom emits several sounds that are associated with different destinations.
Based on the destination cards and the enchanted witch broom you can play several different games of your choice where you can help Bibi Blocksberg break the enchantment of her broom.

187772.name: Book of Races
187772.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you are like many fantasy gamers, you've probably spent a small portion of your gaming budget here and there collecting plastic miniatures, and perhaps you've ended up with a number of figures for characters that aren't detailed in Swords & Wizardry or some other preferred retro-clone system. Maybe you are trying to convert modules or campaign settings from one of the latter editions of the "World's Most Popular Roleplaying System" into a simpler and potentially more elegant gaming system, and want to offer new racial options for characters in such a campaign. It might even be that you are seeking new and unusual racial character options to add spice and variety to your own homebrew setting. Whatever your reasons for wanting more Old School character races, the Book of Races intended to help you meet those needs and then some.

Welcome to the Book of Races. This supplement has been developed with the Swords & Wizardry rules system in mind, and should prove easy to use for both Referees and players alike. Other “retro-clone” rules systems may find the material useful with only minimal conversion efforts. This supplement is divided into two sections. The first section, New Races, describes a dozen new races for use in your fantasy campaigns. In this section, each race is described with game mechanics as suggested by the Swords & Wizardry Core Rules, which details fantasy races as a game mechanic separate from character classes. The second section, Racial Classes, provides specific racial classes for Referees that prefer their non-human characters to operate in a character class structure similar to Fighting Men, Clerics and Magic-Users.

The Book of Races details the Artathi, the Duar, the Elde, the Eldeblooded, the Feytouched, the Giantkin, the Goblin, the Hyrknoff, the Kelshan, the Ordath, the Vaelan and the Wyrmblooded. As an added bonus, an appendix detailing an alternate Simple D6 check system is included at the end of this supplement.

187773.name: MyD20 Lite Player's Guide
187773.description:
From publisher blurb:

Conceived as the Second Generation of Old School gaming, MyD20 Lite combines the simple, rules-light rules of the original edition of "the World's Most Popular Roleplaying Game" with innovations from the last decade of the Open Gaming movement to create a lightweight and enjoyable gaming experience.

If you have burned out on Third Edition gaming and want a lightweight game that captures all of the flavor you've come to appreciate in your fantasy gaming experience, MyD20 Lite is for you! If you love the Original game, but like some of the more popular variations from the Third Edition, then MyD20 Lite is for you! If you want a game that lets you use adventures and supplements from any edition of your favorite roleplaying system, then MyD20 Lite is for you!

Inside MyD20 Lite Player's Guide, you'll find everything you need as a player, except dice. This guide contains details on character creation, five individual races, four archetypal classes, a simple skill system, an equipment list inspired by actual medieval prices, advanced combat options that still provide a streamlined gaming experience, a complete selection of spells and more.

If you're looking for the next generation in Old School Gaming, then MyD20 Lite is your portal to a multiverse of fantasy gaming!

187774.name: MyD20 Lite Bestiary: Common Creatures
187774.description:
From publisher blurb:

Running a game of MyD20 Lite just got a lot easier! The MyD20 Lite Bestiary: Common Creatures is intended to provide the Referee with a basic list of more than sixty different monsters that are common to many fantasy campaigns, some of which have multiple stat blocks for variant monsters, leading to almost seventy-five different unique monsters ready to populate your adventures!

In addition, you'll also find rules on how to create your own monsters in the MyD20 Lite system!

MyD20 Lite's small, spartan rule-set frees up your creativity to create a fantasy role-playing experience without the hassles found with larger, more complex gaming systems.

187775.name: Hammersong's Legacy
187775.description:
From publisher blurb:

It has been a century since the War of All Gods has ended, and the land of Cameria has yet to heal from the devastation. The Duar Protectorate stood guardian over the people of the Shattered Territories, under the watchful eye of the great warrior-king, Ollum Hammersong. Despite the twisted monstrosities that roam the wilderness, the people of this realm have made their first steps toward recovery. Now, however, the great king is dead, and not everyone in the High Courts of the Duar Protectorate holds such noble goals as their former liege. A Regent's Council rules temporarily, while agents of the High Court of Balmordak travel abroad in search of the king's missing heir.

Hammersong's Legacy provides a strong foundation for running a campaign set in this post-apocalyptic fantasy setting. This sourcebook provides full details on the Gods of the New Order, the sentient races that inhabit the region, the history and culture of Cameria and the Duar Protectorate, the village of Rynoc's Reach to serve as a base of operations, a wide and varied range of over sixty adventure seeds, a small fantasy bestiary of more than sixty creatures and more. In short, Referees will find a rich and vibrant setting for their fantasy campaigns within this sourcebook, which in turn will provide hours of joy and entertainment as players and Referees alike explore the shattered realms of Cameria and discover the secrets of Hammersong's Legacy.

187776.name: Orcam of Porphyra
187776.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heroes of the Northern Seas!

The orcam people are closely related to the intelligent and powerful whales that ply the cold seas, living in close-knit pods and scornful of those who would take indiscriminately from their waters… flee to the land or face their jagged blades and muscular might!

Orcam of Porphyra takes a closer look at a fascinating aquatic race of humanoids, suitable for player character play, above or below the water! In Orcam of Porphyra you will find:

All statistics for playing orcam, racial traits, alternatives, feats, and racial archetypes for classes
New equipment, spells, magic items and more!
A playable 1st level orcam character, with stats, gear and background in the Patchwork Planet of Porphyra

187777.description:
Endure the Stars is a 1-6 player cooperative action survival game set on the planet-colonising ship, the N.W.E. Hikari. Players pick up the story one year into the Hikari's colonisation efforts and everything has fallen to ruin. Scientists aboard the ship were attempting to genetically engineer life forms to explore the planet below, unbeknownst to the ships general populace. But a series of tragedies lead to the truth being discovered and the ensuing chaos released the creatures from containment, where they rampaged through the ship, killing anyone they came across. Now the remaining crew live in small groups, salvaging whatever they can to survive.

Game overview
• In Endure the Stars, players take control of one or more survivors and attempt to complete missions by exploring the ruins of the once thriving ship. Players control 6 unique character classes, each with their own special abilities that can turn the tide of any game.
• Complete various missions as a standalone game or an overarching campaign
• Search the ruins of the once thriving ship for powerful weapons, items, helmets and armour
• You’re not the only thing still alive on the ship. The escaped genetic experiments, known as the GEPs, are lurking everywhere and if spotted will not stop hunting you
• The GEPs are controlled by the game itself and start each mission represented by radar tokens. You’ll not know what lurks under the token until you make visual contact, so you must be ready for anything
• One GEP stands more powerful and dangerous than all others, the fearsome Titan. Its actions are controlled by its own deck of cards, making it unpredictable, gargantuan and deadly. It will take everything you’ve got to bring this leviathan down
• The game tiles that represent the ship have been designed in a modular style, which allows for near limitless map sizes and set-ups. Games can last anywhere between 30 minutes to 3 hours depending on the chosen scenario and difficulty, so there's never an excuse not to play!
• The ship is in a constant state of decay and is prone to black outs, power failures and much more that affects how the game is played and causes you to constantly adapt

Endure the Stars contains:
• 6 unique character miniatures
• 30 Swarmer miniatures
• 20 Jaeger miniatures
• 20 Icarus miniatures
• 1 Titan miniature
• 1 Titan miniature
• 9 game tiles
• 6 character dashboards
• 8 dice
• 150 cards
• 86 tokens
187777.name: Endure the Stars
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 23: Bloody Scotland

187778.name: The Plan (2013)
187778.description:
The Plan is a little experimental videogame. A fly ascends to the skies, pondering the pointlessness of its brief existence. You can download the game for free from the project website. Enjoy! The score, Grieg’s Åses Død, was recorded by Naxos International and performed by Oslo Camerata.

Source: The Developer Website.

187779.name: Crowntakers
187779.description:
Dark times are imminent: the king’s abduction throws a once peaceful land into turmoil. Being the chosen one elected by the king himself through one of your dreams, you embark on an adventurous journey to free him from the hands of the evil duke and go down in history as the kingdom’s greatest hero. But time is of the essence…

Crowntakers combines turn-based strategy with RPG elements and takes you at the behest of the crown into a medieval fantasy world full of challenging encounters and epic adventures. With its randomly generated world, Crowntakers offers a varied gaming experience every time you set out to fight evil. As a hero on a mission, you’ll have to assemble a group of brave mercenaries to take on cruel enemies like barbarians, ferocious animals or deceitful thieves. Embark on challenging quests, gather vital resources and finally banish evil from the world.

Source: The Publisher Website.

187780.name: Danmaku Unlimited 2
187780.description:
Steam Store Page

Classic Japanese style vertical manic shooting action! Shoot, dodge and explode your way through the second entry in the critically acclaimed Danmaku Unlimited series. Battle through nail-biting bullet patterns and compete for dominance on the global leaderboard!

187781.name: Shattered Planet
videogamehonor: 2014 CVA Best Canadian-Made Game of the Year Nominee
2014 PAX Curse Award Best Graphics of the Year Winner
187781.description:
Punching aliens … for science!

A survival adventure on a dangerous world, searching for the cure for an all-devouring darkness.

In Shattered Planet, you’re a hapless clone sent to document alien species and technologies, or die trying. Mostly, die trying. You could call it a roguelike, or a survival-exploration RPG on an endlessly dangerous planet. You lose your items when you die, but you keep any scrap metal or crystals you find to invest in permanent upgrades, or to invent new items.

Source: The Developer Website.

187782.description: マタンガ！キッズ＆エキスパート (Matanga! Kids & Experts) allows younger players to get into the Matanga! challenge of marking out all the numbers on your scorecards first, with the scorecards featuring a wide variety of layouts for the numbers, including on clocks, the backs of bugs, and the midst of a whirlwind.
187782.name: マタンガ！キッズ＆エキスパート (Matanga! Kids & Experts)

187783.name: Best of Fenix Volume 1 (2015)
rpgissuearticle: Fenix Fighters – A Complete Card Game
Long Have I Desired to Look upon the Kings of Old
Once Upon A Time In The North
The Chamber – Legacy of the Apocalypse
187783.description:
From the back of the Issue:

BEST OF FENIX – VOLUME 1
Best of Fenix includes some of the best gaming material from the Swedish gaming magazine Fenix – translated to English. In Best of Fenix you will find inspiring material written directly for Fenix’ readers by renown international game designers such as Kenneth Hite and Pete Nash, but also some of the best from the Swedish arena. To top it off, we got our own comic strip Bernard the Barbarian, created by Åke Rosenius and at least one stand alone game in every issue. In this our first anthology you will find myths and legends of different kinds, some true to classic source materials and others warped through a brand new filter.

187784.name: Cost of War
187784.description:
Throughout the history of mankind conflict is at the core of our evolution, evident in each generation with war and expansion of territories to show dominance of one empire over its rivals. Such aggression is not a choice of right or wrong, but is instilled into our DNA through the course of evolution.

This strategy game challenges players to execute military war tactics, allows for population growth, encourages development of city infrastructure to fuel the economy, forces long term rewards to be weighed against immediate benefits, and calls for the management of your civilization's resource expenditure. Winning is a combination of dice rolls and decision making. The key to success is using your economic engine to fuel growth and strategically engage in battles to weaken your opponent and strengthen your dominance on the map. Victory points are gained through killing enemy population, building a city capital, being the peace maker, acquiring special events, and conquering enemy land. No one strategy wins the game but is a combination of several of the victory points to win.

How the game is played section: Players have two choices at the start of their return, (1) Improve Economy or (2) Battle. Improve Economy allows 4 action items for the player; (1) Roll dice which generates resources for all players by collecting resource cards based on dice outcome and the location of their pieces on the game board, (2) Player draws their own event card which generates additional resource cards, (3) Using resources can purchase buildings, population, and increased military strength and placement of those pieces on board, (4) Tactical movement which allows for 1 unit to be moved on board.

Alternatively, Battle allows 4 action items (1) all military units can be moved on board, (2) Engagement in battle which results in offensive pieces on board attacking defensive pieces and outcome decided by die roll, (3) Acquire a special event card through dice outcome, (4) Using resources can purchase buildings, population, and increased military strength and placement of those pieces on board.

How are units killed and battle outcome decided section:
Offensive team rolls X number of dice based on the strength of their military, and outcome of dice is based on value rolled:
(1) capture civilian
(2) kill civilian
(3) kill military
(4) kill military
(5) nothing
(6) special event

Defensive team rolls dice, and outcome is based on these values:
(1) kill military
(2) kill military
(3) steal resource cards from offensive team(called Cost of War)
(4) nothing
(5) nothing
(6) nothing

Purchase of the following can be made:
Barracks; generates Military based on dice roll
Bank; generates resources cards based on dice roll
Fort; provide military defensive mechanism when being attacked
Fortification; provide first line of defense when being attacked
Civilians, allows for collection of resources based on dice roll
Infantry, allows player to initiate military attacks
Land purchase, allows player to control more tiles of board

How to win, first to 6(2-player game) or 7(3-player game) Victory points:
Manifest Destiny; placement of 6 civilians on 1 tile; 1 VP
Established Capital; all buildings + 6 civilians on 1 tile; 2 VP
Peacemaker; 2 unused special event cards, 1 VP
Conqueror; capture enemy owned tiles, 2 VP
Slaughterer; 10 kills by military; 2 VP
Genocide; 18 kills by military; 3 VP
Assimilation; capture enemy capital; 3 VP

boardgameimplementation: Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
187785.description:
Description from the publisher:

Rebellion simmers in the corners of the Galactic Empire and several rival factions are gathering forces in the hope of overthrowing the corrupt Senate by defeating the Sentinels that keep them in power. These rebel factions, each with their own vision of what life in the galaxy should be, despise each other almost as much as they hate the corrupt Galactic Senate. However, only one can wield ultimate power in the galaxy.

You are the leader on one such rebel faction You must recruit and train key specialists to help you fight and win a Galactic Rebellion. Scientists will perform research on new technologies that can tip the balance in your favor. Smugglers will help you build a trade network while Diplomats will join the Senate in hopes of influencing critical decisions. Heroes will conduct Covert Missions to aid your rebel cause and Troopers will fight your battles as they flare up on planets across the galaxy.

Empires: Galactic Rebellion is a sequel to Empires: Age of Discovery using similar overall mechanisms. However, many of the specific actions have been reworked to follow the theme and new spheres of activities have been added to create an entirely new experience, including Covert Missions, The Galactic Senate and Capital Ship Fleets.

As the Rebel Faction Leader, you must lead your rebellion to free the galaxy from tyranny and thereby achieve ultimate victory!
187785.name: Glen Drover's Empires: Galactic Rebellion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 32 - Holiday Gift Giving Guide
Favorite Games of 2015
RDTN Episode 103: Empires: Galactic Rebellion, Guild Ball, Warmachine, & Tanks
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 56!!!

187786.name: The Undercroft (Issue 7 - Oct 2015)
rpgissuearticle: The Omnicron AKA The Freedom Beat
187786.description:
(from the back cover)

A beast of obsessive anarchy

The tunnels between places and the worm within

The tragic consequences of belligerence

A dissertation on the beast of our loins

An old witch and a tree

187787.description:
We are a group of nerd inventors. In this competition, who can invent the most prolific inventions and become the nerdiest inventor?

Nerdy Inventions (発明オタクの怪奇な傑作) is a game for 2-4 players that takes about 25-30 minutes. Players take turns until the game meets one of the ending conditions.

In each turn, the active player rolls 3 dice. Then he may do the following 4 actions as many times as he wants (the actions can be done repeatly). When he cannot or decide not to take any more actions, he passes and next player's turn begins. The 4 available actions are:

Use your own invention card
Charge your own invention card
Research (Swap uninvented cards)
Build (Take) invention card




Invention cards provide victory points and abilities. At the end of the game, the player with the highest total of victory points wins the game!
187787.name: Nerdy Inventions

187788.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 189 - Nov 2015)
187788.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 189
November 2015

7Wonders Duel
Beam up for epic exploration and conquest in Wizkids' Star Trek: Frontiers!
Find fun among the stuff of nightmares in Z-Man Games' Castellion!

187789.name: Saviors
187789.description:
From the introduction:

Saviors is a roleplaying game. It uses the FUDGE rules, which are available for free in the internet. Saviors is a science fiction game about energysword-wielding heroes facing countless combatdroids in a postapocalyptic Earth. It's fun and loose for the most part.

User summary:

The Saviors game is presented in four major HTML sections: Main (introduction), World (setting), Rules, and Stories (fiction). For the most part, the rules are a straightforward implementation of Fudge.

187790.name: By the Shadow
187790.description:
From the introduction:

In By the Shadow, players encounter a world of the dead. People who die usually dissipate into levels we don't know of or maybe they disappear into nothingness. In some circumstances, they're left in the shadow world, the land of the dead. Some types of dead can interact with the living world and some can't, but they all have one thing in common: all kinds of occult-dwellers are intrigued by them. Players can portray either dead people or occultists.

User summary:

The rules are presented in five major HTML sections: Main (introduction), Character Creation, Rules, World (setting), and Adventures. The Rules present a fairly straightforward implementation of Fudge. Adventures presents a few plot hooks which would require substantive development prior to play.

187791.name: セブン (Seven)
187791.description:
セブン (Seven) is a reimplementation of 7 Symbols, and 7 Nations, a trick-taking game with a unique deck of 49 cards in which the cards are in seven suits with one suit going 1-7, the next 2-8, and so on up to the final suit of 7-13. Thus, the deck has seven 7s in it, and to win the game, you need to capture the most 7s.

セブン also includes rules to two other games played with the same deck.

187792.name: Anime Isles
187792.description:
From the introduction:

What follows are my modifications and clarifications to the original Anime RPG System rules. This does repeat text from that document, in my own words, but this way you don't have to mess with two piles of paper. Well, the Power Point cost tables are found in the original book as are the attributes and skills, but looking those up shouldn't be much of a hassle.

User summary:

Anime Isles is a reinterpretation of the Anime RPG; it would require substantial GM input or reference to the Anime RPG to be usable as a complete system.

187796.name: School Daze Playtest
187796.description:
From the introduction:

A lightweight RPG designed to evoke the feel of High School. Can be used for almost any type of scenario.

Conflicts are resolved using the roll of a single d6. 5-6 is a success. 1-4 is a failure.

All players take the part of Students that attend Trowbridge High. The Administrator plays the parts of all the other high schoolers, as well as the teachers, parents, and various other people the Students will interact with.

User summary:

This is the playtest version of the game that was released under a Creative Commons license prior to the commercial version.

187797.name: Raiders of the Mercenary Coast
187797.description:
From the introduction:

The PCs are gathered at the New Rose Inn, a frequent rest stop along the southern border of Blackhawk. The tavern at the New Rose is a, sort of, employment office for men-at-arms in search of their next honestly earned coin purse. This evening’s post of interest states:

Help Wanted! Heroes and warriors needed to defeat raiders which terrorize our trade routes. Rewards of not-less-than 250 gold will be provided by the Central Vanthian Capitalists’ Guild.

187798.name: The Forgotten Ruins
187798.description:
From the introduction:

One day’s walk from your average farming village there are the remains of some long forgotten society. But these ruins are never visited; they are only the stuff of wives’ tales. The former inhabitants of the ruins have been forgotten but the ruins have served as the source of ghosts, haunts and all form of creeps for many generations of scolding mothers.

187799.name: Veranthea Codex
187799.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Goblins. In. Dirigibles!

Within these 300+ pages are entire player classes, numerous archetypes, new feats, new races, and over 100 base class NPCs perfect for use in any Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

Whether you’re an adventurer in the grip of Grethadnis’ internecine conflicts, finding your destiny in Urethiel, advancing your monstrous stake in Trectoyri, searching through the Forever Dark for technological glory, or a player interested in the goblin pistoleer gunslinger, merchanteer paladin, or scientific innovator, or a GM looking for a bigger roster of enemies and challenges for their group—the world’s most radical Pathfinder campaign setting is for you!

187800.name: Indie+ Horror Anthology 2015
rpgissuearticle: And This Is How She Died
rpg: And This Is How She Died...
187800.description: Welcome to the second Indie+ Anthology, released just in time for Halloween weekend! Enjoy eleven different short horror pieces from the Indie+ staff, special guests, and friends of Indie+ to celebrate the creation of our Indie+ Community page on G+!

187801.name: Star Wars Trivia Game
187801.description:
From the back of the box:

"Test your Star Wars knowledge with hundreds of questions from the Star Wars Universe OR place the Timeline cards in the correct chronological order. So the more you know about the facts, and when they happened, the better your chances to win."

Gameplay is a combination of standard trivia, with multiple-choice answers, and a version of the game Timeline, where you need to put events from the films in the correct order. You get a point for each correct answer, but you lose a point for each incorrect answer. Each point is a segment of your lightsaber. Be the first to complete your lightsaber and you win!

187802.name: American Deadvolution
187802.description:
From the introduction:

This young country is in chaos. It was not too long ago that the founding fathers drafted the Declaration of Independence and formally recognized their separation from England. This is a tense time, one where a young nation should be developing its policies and stabilizing it’s government and economy and is instead being besieged on all sides by enemies. Two wars are being waged; a physical war against two distinctly hostile forces both looking to destroy the bonds holding the people together, and a spiritual war. Not just a war of ideology, but an attack on the essence of humanity. An unholy force of darkness is assaulting both the people’s militia and the greedy war mongering British. This chapter is intended for people with little knowledge of American colonial history. If you do not need context you can skip ahead to the section entitled “The End of Hope".

User summary:

This game combines fairly traditional role-playing rules (Attribute, Class, Skill, etc.) with an unusual and slightly comedic setting of Revolutionary-era Colonial America suffering an undead plague. Much of the setting is presented as a series of short fiction pieces. Just as America is plagued by the undead, the book is unfortunately plagued by typographical errors.

187803.name: Forever Folio (Issue 3 - Jul 2015)
187803.description:
Forever Folio
Issue 3
July 2015

All Hail the King - Yellow Dawn
Fighting Fantasy
The Unsung Weave

187804.name: Forever Folio (Issue 4 - Aug 2015)
187804.description:
Forever Folio
Issue 4 - Extended Summer Edition
August 2015

Vathis Needs Heroes
The Unsung Weave
Gen Con 2015

187805.name: A Lexicon of Thieves Cant
187805.description:
From the introduction:

This lexicon is based on a number of books published between the late 18th and early 20th centuries that examined the historical slang of England, most specifically the area around London. Despite their date of publication, it can be used in FRP campaigns by those who desire a detailed use of thieves cant without the necessity of trying to understand older forms of English which are not particularly intelligible to modern eyes or ears.

187806.name: TimeBomb II
boardgamepublisher: 新ボードゲーム党 (New Board Game Party)
187806.description: TimeBomb II has a title and a few other details announced for it, but nothing else.

187807.name: しまんちゅ (Shimanchu)
187807.description: In しまんちゅ (Shimanchu), players try to collect resources to assemble items that they can then sell to customers — assuming that the demand on the market exists, of course.

187808.name: Front Toward Enemy
187808.description:
From the publisher:

Three years after the collapse of South Vietnam, General William Westmoreland announced that “militarily we were successful . . . we didn’t lose a single battle above company level.” It was in these intense company- and platoon-level firefights, which characterized most combat in the Vietnam War, that military engagements could be won and lost. At close quarters in the jungle, at night, and in hamlets surrounded by rice paddies, American soldiers faced their North Vietnamese and Vietcong enemies on even terms. FRONT TOWARD ENEMY allows players to explore intense company- and platoon-level battles from the perspective of a company commander, using a fast-playing system that provides the feel and unpredictability of small unit combat.

Front Toward Enemy is a simulation that recreates tactical engagements during the Vietnam War at the scale of 50 meters per hex and five minutes per turn. Units represent fire teams, heavy weapon sections, leaders, vehicles, and helicopters. Eight scenarios with set-up options recreate twelve missions that typified company-level engagements during the Vietnam War, including airmobile insertions, assaults on fortified positions, and classic search-and-destroy operations, among others.

Rules cover all of the elements associated with combat in Vietnam: helicopter gunships, armored vehicles, artillery support, snipers, sappers, civilians, booby-traps, medics, evacuation of the wounded, prisoner interrogation, tunnels, hidden caches, and more. Winning doesn't always mean holding the objective if the cost in casualties is too great. Sudden combat in difficult terrain causes command and control to quickly break down. A chit-pull system means command and control is erratic, and volume of fire is rewarded, but results are fickle. The unforeseen occurs, ranging from non-combat injuries to interference from higher headquarters to so-called “friendly fire”. Immediate action drills, staying close, and the ability to move and act as a coordinated unit ensure survivability in this environment.

Front Toward Enemy puts you in the middle of the toughest fighting of the longest war of the 20th Century.

Front Toward Enemy scales:


each turn is approximately 5 minutes
each hex is approximately 50 meters across
counters represent Infantry Units of one to four men (Fire Teams, Weapons Teams, Leaders, and Individuals) Helicopters, and Vehicles
Additional markers represent Civilians, Caches (rice, medical, and ammo), Bunkers, Foxholes, and Tunnel entrances

187809.name: Super 4: Die Zeit läuft!
187809.description:
You want to help Super 4 to defeat their enemies, the Black Baron, Shark Beard, Dr X and Baba-Cara? Your mission is to complete all ten tasks with Alex, Ruby, Gene and Étincelle in the four different worlds of Super 4 and to collect more gold in each of the worlds. But beware, in this game time is mercilessly against you.
Super 4 is a cooperative game where you all win or you lose.
During the game, you can consult and help each other, however each player does not perform his turn alone, they do it together.
By throwing dice and moving in the board, you receive tasks that you have to fulfill one by one. Your objective is to fulfill all ten tasks.
If you get to complete the ten tasks and collect four key pads in gold, before time runs out, congratulations you have all won!

187810.name: Doomtown: Reloaded – Dirty Deeds
187810.description:
Description from the publisher:

The fight for the Morgan Cattle Company takes on a new twist!
Lula strikes a deal with the devil for the heart of the Morgan Cattle Company, someone is looking for Sloane and he won’t stop until he finds her, and the Eagle Wardens are desperate to reach Mayor Whateley. But why?

Dirty Deeds is Doomtown: Reloaded’s seventh Saddlebag Expansion. Featuring a complete playset of 21 new cards to customize your Doomtown decks, Dirty Deeds expands your options for takin’ over Gomorra, whether you’re looking to be shootin’, spell castin’, or just trying to show that you have more money and influence than the next person!

187811.name: Schein
187811.description:
User Summary

The plot line is a father trying to get through a swamp in search of his lost son, but the real point is to navigate through platformer puzzles using a light that overlays the base screen with other steps, levels, cogwheels, and lanterns. The dull grey-brown of the swamp still shows, while a small circle around your character is illuminated in mostly bright greens to show the other level. Eventually you meet up with level bosses to defeat in order to resolve the plot. This game won quite a few awards.

187812.name: Monster High: Potworrrnie wciągająca gra!
187812.description: A simple kids' game about collecting monster girls of Monster High. The deck consists of 14 different girls, 4 of each. On your turn you play a card and draw a card. If you played a card that's already visible on the table (either in the centre or at another player) then you put the card on the top of the similar card(s) and place the stack in front of you. When a player starts their turn with a given number of stacks in front of them (2 players: 8 cards, 3 players: 6 cards and so on) the game ends and they've won!

187813.name: Kaiser's War in the East
187813.description:
S&T 301, Sept-Oct 2016

Kaiser’s War in the East is a strategic level simulation of World War I on the Eastern Front, 1914-17. This is a two-player game; One player controls the Central Powers, the other player controls the Allies. The concept of “victory points” (VP) is central to play of game. Players begin each scenario with a designated number of VP. They gain new VP as a result of achieving objectives; they lose VP when they lose units in combat. They may expend them to gain reinforcements and carry out certain actions. To win the game you must have more VP than your opponent, so play is a balancing act between expending VP and attaining objectives.

187814.description: Great Northern War is a wargame covering the Swedish-Russian War of 1700-09. This period of the war ended with the decisive battle of Poltava. Scenarios show various periods of fighting. There are two sides in the game, the Swedish Empire (Empire for short) which is defined as Sweden and its allies, and the Russian Coalition (Coalition for short), which is defined as Russia and its allies. Players conduct Actions which generate discrete movement, combat, and other operations. Each turn represents a season of operations. During each turn, players take various Actions, alternating one at a time with the other.
187814.name: Great Northern War

187815.description:
Modern War #24, Jul-Aug 2016

LZ Albany depicts the ambush of US air cavalry units by the North Vietnamese Army on 17 November 1965, during the Pleiku Campaign. Turns cover one hour, with multiple impulses driven by a random chit draw. Additional chits add extra assets like artillery and air power. US and NVA platoons maneuver through areas of jungle, sawgrass, and clearings. Leaders magnify unit abilities but are vulnerable. The NVA player is bent on maximizing US losses before being overwhelmed by firepower. The US player must stabilize the situation, maximize NVA casualties, and evacuate wounded to prevent their falling into enemy hands.
187815.name: LZ Albany

187816.name: October War
187816.description:
Modern War #25, Sept-Oct 2016

October War is a wargame of the 1973 Arab-Israeli War. There are two Theaters of Operation: Sinai and Golan, both portrayed as a point to point system (since most of the major actions were fought over key points or lines of communications). There are two players in the game, one commanding the Israelis, and the other the Arabs, and the game emphasizes critical factors of the conflict, but allows for large units to break down into smaller units, representing organizational flexibility and cohesion. The game is driven by the drawing of event markers which represent major tactical and strategic factors that affected the course of the campaign historically.

187817.name: Modern Battles II: Kaliningrad & Mosul
187817.description:
Modern War #27, Jan-Feb 2017

Modern Battles II is a grand tactical simulation of battles that were or could possibly be fought in the era since the fall of the Berlin Wall and into the near future. Players control actual and hypothetical combat units utilizing a wide range of technologies and forces to gain objectives. Modern Batles II includes two games: Kaliningrad, covering a hypothetical Russian clash with NATO forces at the Russian Baltic Fleet forward base, and Mosul, a clash between ISIS and Coalition forces in Iraq. There are two players in each game, commanding opposing forces. Both games use a main body of shared rules, and each also has its own scenario special instructions.

187818.name: Alexia Crow and the Cave of Heroes
187818.description:
User Summary

This game draws on Greek Mythology to background the adventures of Alexia Crow, a young anthropologist trapped in a cave. The puzzles vary from jigsaws of moving pieces to more complicated logic puzzles.

187819.name: Asphyxia
187819.description:
User Summary

This visual novel revolves around relationships among young girls going to the Lake District in northern England by train. The graphics are almost watercolour-like. The resolutions include bi- and lesbian endings.

187820.name: Axis Football 2015
187820.description:
User Summary

This football game has set plays for passing and running that are specific to each team. Team names and players mimic real NFL teams. Can be played in various modes from coach or full season. This game is constantly being modded and updated.

187821.name: Disney Infinity 3.0: Star Wars
videogamehonor: 2015 Game Critics Best Social/Casual/Puzzle Game of the Year Nominee
2015 The Game Awards Best Family Game of the Year Nominee
2016 SXSW Best Convergent Game of the Year Nominee
187821.description:
User Summary

The third in the Disney Infinity series. This one focuses on Star Wars with 2 of the 3 playsets, and a large number of the figures, being Star Wars based (from all seven of the films). The third playset is based on DisneyPixar's Inside Out. There is also a selection of new figures from other Disney IPs.

Like Disney Infinity 2.0 it is backwards compatible with all previous Disney figures. Thankfully!

187822.description:
User summary:
パイレーツコード 2　-海賊同盟と呪いの王- (Pirates Code II: Pirate Alliance and The Curse of the King) is an expansion to Pirates Code, but you can also play this set alone.

This expansion adds the "Alliance Battle". This is a co-operative game players work together in pairs to decrypt the code. Alliance Battle rules are for four players only, but when you decipher a code in co-operation with a partner, the sense of accomplishment that you get becomes higher than just playing the base game.

In addition, the card called "Curse" appears in this set. It interferes with the action of the opponent so that you gain advantages, making Pirates Code even more fun to play.

Publisher's summary:
「パイレーツコード」の拡張セットです。拡張ではありますが、このセット単体だけでも遊ぶことが出来ます。
この拡張では、新しくペアで協力して暗号を解き明かす「同盟戦」ルールが加わります。 同盟戦ルールは4人専用となりますが、仲間と協力し見事推理を的中させたときの達成感は今までの勝利より、さらに一層の達成感を得ることができます。 また、「呪い」という自分に有利な行動を取るように相手の行動を制限する意地悪な効果を持つカードが登場し、パイレーツコードをより一層楽しいものにします。
187822.name: Pirates Code II: Pirate Alliance and The Curse of the King

187823.description:
This promo pack was available as a free bonus for kickstarter backers and at the Essen 2015 convention. It will not be in the retail edition of the game.

Includes the following:

1 new role: Consulting Detective
2 new clue cards: Password and Website
10 new means cards:
Game Pieces
Shipping Container
Dice Tower
Microphone
Spoiled Food
Poisonous Mushrooms
Lab Sample
Anthrax
Ladder
Elevator Shaft
187823.name: Deception: Murder in Hong Kong – Promo Pack

187824.name: The SCORE Core Rules
187824.description:
User summary:

The SCORE is a generic, universal role-playing framework that is intended to be adaptable to any genre. The author has used the system to support a science fiction and a fantasy campaign.

In the system, characters have Attributes (Strength, Agility, Endurance, Willpower, Perception, Intellect, Intuition, Charisma, Appearance, and Morality) that start with a Rating of 3. Higher Ratings are purchased form a point pool. Skills also are purchased from the same pool; Skills have a numeric Level. Tasks, including combat, are resolved with a modified dice roll (2d10, usually) against a target Difficulty. Combat has various additional rules, including specific rules for unarmed combat, missile combat, and other special situations. An optional Degree of Success by Difficulty table can give variable success/failure results. Characters gain experience points and spend them to increase numeric ratings.

187825.name: 片目の商人 (One-Eyed Merchant)
187825.description:
Once this country knew of a genius merchant called the "one-eyed merchant", who regularly combined two products into a single auction to cross-sell them to the public, a process by which he built up enormous wealth.

In 片目の商人 (One-Eyed Merchant), each player bids on "cross-sold" commodities at the market, trying to gain the most money and become something of a "one-eyed merchant" themself.

187826.name: Viridi
videogamehonor: 2016 Steam Awards Sit Back and Relax Nominee
187826.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

Nurture a small pot of succulents that grow in real time. Viridi is a safe haven, a place you can return to for a moment of peace and quiet whenever you need it.

187827.name: Prof. Atmos (Supers!)
187827.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes things go wrong in the lab. It could be that stray wire not connected properly or someone spilling coffee on a keyboard. On that fateful day, it was a Prometheus Strike Team. No one knows how Simon survived the accident. Everyone knows it was his company trying to profit from his pain, that drove him to become Professor Atmos!

187828.name: The Fighter
187828.description:
From publisher blurb:

Like The Bard and The Druid, this class is designed to fix the issues we have with the default Dungeon World fighter.

Rather than being largely defined by a single piece of equipment, you’re defined by your skills. At the start of the game, you choose what sort of weapons you’ve trained the most with: one-handed weapons and a shield, big-ass, two-handed weapons, a ranged weapons, or two weapons at once. You’re also good at sizing up your opponents, and creating makeshift weapons.

As you level up, you choose if you further specialize in your weapon(s) of choice, improve your skills with other weapon types, learn to create better weapons and armor on the fly, become tougher, learn other tricks, and so on.

This product contains three files.

One is a letter-sized character sheet that uses our new character sheet layout: it was the only way to cram in the 29 advanced moves! The print book has guidelines on swapping out your weapons and armor beyond the defaults, so we opted against a character sheet with the gear tacked on.

The other two are digest-sized books, one in color, the other in black and white (to make it easier to print off at home if you want). They both contain:

The fighter class (again, with 29 advanced moves).
New weapons and armor.
Three extra moves for if you want to make an "agile", DEX-primary fighter (good for the ranged and two-weapon fighting specializations).
A director's cut with questions to ask yourself, explanations and suggestions for some of the moves, guidelines on modding your gear loadout, and some extra moves that literally couldn't fit on the sheet.

187829.name: Armory 1: Equipment and Item Cards
187829.description:
From publisher blurb:

Armory 1 is a supplement created under the Hero Kids Compatibility License. Inside you will find six new Equipment cards and six new Item cards. These cards are inspired by the fantasy cartoons of my youth and I hope you enjoy them!

I have included two versions of each card. The first version contains stock art along with the description. The second version has a white space where the kids can draw their own Items and Equipment!

187830.name: Forgotten Constructs
187830.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world's most famous fantasy role-playing game has a huge monster book, but many creatures we loved in prior editions were overlooked. The 5e Fiendopedia brings some of these back and updates them for the 5th edition rules.

This PDF includes 5 creatures. Four exist in prior editions: ice golem, wood golem, iron cobra, and retriever. One creature is new: totem golem.

Each creature gets a full-color image, 5th edition statistics & abilities, and background/ecology information.

187831.name: Underground Humanoids
187831.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world's most famous fantasy role-playing game has a huge monster book, but many creatures we loved in prior editions were overlooked. The 5e Fiendopedia brings some of these back and updates them for the 5th edition rules.

This PDF includes 5 creatures from prior editions: dark creeper, dark stalker, derro, morlock, and skulk.

Each creature has a full-color image, 5th edition statistics & abilities, and background/ecology information.

187832.name: Revenge in the Crater
187832.description:
From publisher blurb:

Revenge in the crater is a random dungeon adventure, with both a low and high level of difficulty. The lower level is designed for a group of 4 level 2-4 characters whilst the higher level is designed for a group of 4 level 9-11 characters, with the option for some variation. Deep within the forest a pale and unearthly light has been seen between the rotten trees. The area is said to be the sight on a fallen star and the locals hunters and trappers avoid the site at all costs. In recent months to accompany the haunting light, a soft and unnerving song floats through the woods, beckoning passers by to investigate and find the mysterious source. This is an adventure made primarily for use with the 5th edition of Dungeons and Dragons but can be used for other rule systems with some tweaking.

187833.name: The Burning Goblins
187833.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Burning Goblins is ideal as a first adventure for new GMs and players, and is designed for a group of 4-5 level 1 characters. The most recent raid by The Burning Ones goblin tribe has left the village of Greendale in a state of uproar. The miller's daughter has been kidnapped and the mayor has put out a call for adventurers to hunt down the goblins and find the missing girl. But is there more to these raids than meets the eye? Why are the goblins burnt and timid? Only a strong band of heroes will be able to find the answers and save the girl from a gruesome death. This is an adventure made primarily for use with the 5th edition of Dungeons and Dragons but can be used for other rule systems with some tweaking.

boardgamepublisher: トーホクウィステリア (Tohoku Wisteria)
187834.description:
User summary:
Discuss and decide how to save your fishing village from depopulation!

漁村においでよ! (Gyoson Ni Oideyo!), a.k.a. Come to Fishing Village!, is a co-operative card game in which players try to revitalize their village by successfully accomplishing big projects. The game can be played solitaire.

While progressing your projects, you have to undergo a book-closing audit every year. Your village's population may increase or decrease according to the result. To make matters worse, you have to deal with land sharks who interfere with your book-closings.

If your village survives 24 book-closings and still has any population, all of you win the game.

This game is nearly language-independent. Only card names are written in Japanese and English, but you don't need to remember them to play.

Publisher's summary:
過疎の漁村を町おこし！みんなでわいわい話し合う協力型のカードゲームです。

プレイヤーは地上げに対応しつつ、人口を確保し町おこしのためのイベントを
開発していく必要があります。

24年にわたる決算を乗り越えたとき、
漁村が滅びず人口が残っていれば勝利となります。
187834.name: Come To Fishing Village!

187835.name: The Masters of Chakra
187835.description:
From publisher blurb:

Chakras Reimagined

There are many exciting secrets and bits of obscure lore to find in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Occult Adventures, and on the surface, it seems like the rules for chakras are among them. This mystical eastern tradition of unlocking the body and spirit’s hidden potential by channeling energy through our bodies in specific ways has captured imaginations for centuries, and finally they’ve gotten a spot in the limelight for Pathfinder. Best of all, you don’t even need to take a feat or class or anything: if you have access to ki, you can start using chakra right away.

Unfortunately, these rules have some issues, including being extremely expensive in total ki point expenditure for what you actually get, requiring incredibly high saving throws each round at high levels, and being completely inaccessible to anyone without a ki pool. This book aims to fulfill the promise of fun and exciting chakra use made by Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Occult Adventures, by providing a way for characters to specialize in chakra use and be rewarded with more useful chakra abilities by doing so. Included are two prestige classes centered on chakras. The chakra master gains improved benefits from each of the chakras, and can activate chakras more cheaply and more often. The kundalini acolyte, by contrast, doesn’t even use ki to access chakra, and instead opens chakras by performing specific ritual actions.

187836.name: Species Spotlight: Abhorrans
187836.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Never has intelligence, avarice, and vileness combined so dangerously...”

Crouching behind the hives of wretched villains in the galaxy are their masters. a foul species that is the very embodiment of avarice, gluttony, and sloth. These are the Abhorrans.

In this Species Spotlight supplement you will find:

A Race of Vice: The Abhorrans, a foul species that is the very embodiment of avarice, gluttony, and sloth.
A Race of Oppressors: The Abhorrans are Tyrants, brutal leaders who rule their planets with iron fists and live to dominate their hapless subjects.
A Race of Opulence: The Abhorrans have a ravenous appetite for the finer things, and their Yachts are famous for vulgar excess.




Do you have the courage to face a species whose vengeance is the stuff of legend?

187837.name: Kata Kumbas
187837.description:
From publisher blurb:

Siete stufi dei soliti goblin e orchetti? Preferite le storie popolari italiane di astuti frati e prodi paladini alle saghe nordiche?

Allora cosa aspettate a varcare la Porta di Livello e a inoltrarvi nelle lande di Laìtia, dove l’aria profuma di basilico e rosmarino e Fauni e Ninfe
amoreggiano nei boschi?

Questo manuale è la riedizione, ampliata e adattata a Savage Worlds. di uno dei grandi classici del gioco di ruolo italiano: Kata Kumbas!

In esso rivestirete i panni di Ladri e Giocolieri, Fattucchieri e Alchimisti, Cavalieri e Paladini, Mistici e Predicatori e molto altro ancora.

Attenzione! Kata Kumbas non è un gioco di ruolo come tutti gli altri, è un gioco di proiezione: se vorrete, sarete voi stessi, in prima persona, ad avventurarvi tra le colline della Landa delle Furenti Viole o tra i vicoli bui dell’antica città di Maro.

Siete pronti ad affrontare l’avventura?

Se sì, aprite questo libro, e in bocca al Vendramino!


Translation courtesy of Google:

Tired of the usual goblins and orcs? Favorite stories popular Italian friars of smart and brave knights to the Norse sagas?

So what are you waiting to cross the gate level and could also explore the lands of Laìtia, where the air smells of basil and rosemary and fauns and nymphs
flirt in the woods?

This manual is the new edition, expanded and adapted to Savage Worlds. one of the great classics of Italian RPG: Kata Kumbas !

In it you rivestirete the role of Thieves and jugglers, sorcerers and alchemists, the Knights and Paladins, Monks, and Preachers and more.

Attention! Kumbas Kata is not a role-playing game like everyone else, is a game of projection: if you want, you yourself, in person, to venture into the hills of the Landa Furious Violas or among the dark alleys of the ancient town of Maro.

Are you ready for the adventure?

If so, open this book, and in the mouth Vendramino!

187838.name: Hopelessness
187838.description:
From publisher blurb:

For all of their efforts in the defense of the Sticks, the Vigilantes have been branded criminals. And not just petty criminals, either – they have been labeled terrorists. Which means that they now face an opponent like no other: the entire might of the Ultrapolis. They are to be hunted down and executed. Their hidden benefactor is already dead. The Vigilante group is finished. Their only hope of survival is to flee the city and live in hiding far away. Only, there are monitoring devices all throughout the Ultrapolis. To go out into the streets of the city is to be instantly spotted. Their chances of escaping are so slim as to be non-existent. ...But to remain in the city is to guarantee that they will be caught and killed, eventually. So, they will take their one, small chance and hope. For as long as hope lasts.

187839.name: Infinite Weapons 2
187839.description:
From publisher blurb:

What Sci-Fi is complete without some cool gear to play with. Well Avalon is here with a whole new series of gear books for IF 2.0. Inside you will find all kinds of cool weapons to use in your game, so strap on your new toys and conjure the universe.

187840.name: Ifrit!
187840.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Amazing Races PDFs introduce new archetypes, feats, character traits, racial traits, and archetypes for the core, featured, and uncommon races described in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide. Every PDF contains two full pages of high quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Amazing Races: Ifrit! includes new racial feats, ifrit character traits, and alternate racial traits for Ifrit. In addition, this product features a new archetype for Ifrit barbarians: the Flamerager!

187843.name: Brighten The Life
boardgamepublisher: ワイビーワイゲームズ　(YbY Games)
187843.description:
User summary:
ブライトゥンザライフ (Brighten the Life)

DNA damage pouring on the earth. The survival of the fittest. Fierce and merciless battles between living creatures. How will you survive? By breeding, preying upon others, or evolution?

Whether by breeding or preying upon others, living creatures manage to thrive by making the most of their abilities. Furthermore, in the long history of evolution, they've managed to evolve by overcoming the DNA mutation in the ever-changing global environment. We've made a game with a theme of such life.

The future changes every moment according to the surrounding environment. Living creatures must simply choose the best move.

Brighten the Life is the game to make all living creatures shine most brilliantly.

Publisher's summary:
地球に降り注ぐDNA ダメージ。弱肉強食。生き残りを賭けた生き物同士の無慈悲で壮絶な争い。生き残る術は増殖か、捕食か、進化か。
生き物は増殖が得意なもの、捕食が得意なもの、それぞれ自分の持つ能力を最大限に生かすことで繁栄を勝ち得ている。また、長い進化の歴史の中で、生き物は地球環境によるDNA 変異を受けながらも、それを克服することで進化してきた。そんな地球上の生き物の営みをゲームにした。
未来はとりまく環境によって刻々と変化する。いま生き物ができることは、いま最良の行動を選択するのみ。
生き物を最高に輝かせるゲーム「Brighten The Life」

187844.name: Spacemen Come!
boardgamepublisher: ワイビーワイゲームズ　(YbY Games)
187844.description:
User summary:
スペースメンカム! (Spacemen Come!)

To protect the Earth from the attack of the irrational aliens from outer space, it's vital to detect your own talent and make it bloom!

When you manage to unlock your innate talent and master your way, you'll rock the universe.

Publisher's summary:
常識が通用しない宇宙人の襲撃から地球を守る。頼れるのは自らの才能を見抜くこと、そしてその才能を開花させろ！
才能が開花し、その道を極めたとき、宇宙は震撼する。

187846.name: Ninja Outlaws
187846.description:
From the introduction:

Ninja Outlaws is an anime/chambara-inspired RPG campaign set in feudal era Japan, using the Cineflex system. The player characters are all ninja, fighting for their lives and their clans’ honor against the backdrop of Oda Nobunaga’s campaign to unite Japan by force. A fantasy element is optional.

187847.name: The Cargo of Doom
187847.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure is an introduction to the Secret of Zir’An Role-Playing Game. It contains a quickstart rules guide and a short scenario complete with sample characters that should last a few hours for two to five players and a Hand of Fate (the storyteller or game master). Moderately experienced gamers familiar with RPGs will find this adventure a mix of action-packed roleplaying, exploration and combat, suited to the abilities of the Adventurers provided.

187848.name: Shakhàn Book A: Introduction / Game Setting
187848.description:
From the introduction:

Shakhàn is set in the cold northern regions of the imaginary world of Telostic, a world in which many of those things known to be fables in the "real" world such as magic, supernatural monsters, deities, enchanted swords and the like really do exist. The setting of the Shakhàn game environment is largely pre-industrial – that is, the level of most Telostician societies is equivalent to those on Earth just after the collapse of the Roman Empire – but there are hints of earlier, greater civilisations with a much more highly developed level of technology.

User summary:

The Introduction / Game Setting book provides a somewhat short overview of the game system and setting. The material presented is covered in greater detail a second time in subsequent volumes.

187849.name: Shakhàn Book B: Establishing a Character
187849.description:
User summary:

Establishing a Character presents all of the rules involving character creation for the game. As the rules are tightly integrated with the setting, many of the rules governing race, class, and skill selection include a large amount of setting detail. Characters select a Species (Race), and then create Characteristic Scores (Ability Scores) by one of several methods. Primary Characteristics (Strength, Agility, Constitution, Dexterity, Intelligence, Psychic Ability, Mystic Ability, Willpower (Morale), Vision, Hearing, Sense of Smell, Taste Sense, Touch Sense, and Physical Beauty) lead to several derived Characteristics.

Social Class is determined and subsequently determines starting money, equipment, contacts, and other aspects (language, literacy, etc.). Characters also select Professions and Skills.

187850.name: Shakhàn Book C: Combat on Telostic
187850.description:
User summary:

The combat mechanism used in the game is quite complex and involves several derived characteristics ("combat-related factors"). Combat occurs in rounds, each Round (5 seconds) being further sub-divided into Pulses (1 second) during which characters can execution actions based on their Tactic Card Allowance. Characters have a Combat Factor that derives from numerous other statistics; likewise a Missile Factor is derived. Exertion is noted against a Fatigue Point Reserve while damage is tracked against a Body Damage Reserve. Combat is planned with Tactic Cards and then executed.

Generally speaking, the rules favor highly detailed combat over speed of play. Combat involves many numbers, numerous tables, and several calculations.

187851.name: Shakhàn Book D: The Supernatural
187851.description:
User summary:

The Supernatural is a tightly integrated presentation of game setting and rules governing magic. The game presents two types of magic: Secular and Religious. Secular magic falls into several categories based on effects; Religious magic derives from one of numerous deities that vary by region. Much of the information presented details the various deities, religions, and rituals of the major locales in the setting. Even Secular magic spells vary by region.

Spellcasting is a complex action that allows casters to create numerous magical effects as "Spells". The rules include Magic Resistance, Saving Throws, Magic Energy Points, Magic Energy Accrual and Storage, rules for learning spells, and so forth.

187852.name: Shakhàn Book E: Adventures in Northern UsHù'l
187852.description:
User summary:

Adventures in Northern UsHù'l presents a general overview of running a Shakhàn campaign. For the most part, the volume is intended for the Game Master. Topics include things like establishing and using marching orders, overland movement, weather, encounters and treasure, and divine intervention.

In addition to these various rules and implementation details, the volume provides setting information and details such as equipment types and availability, standard encounter and event tables by locale, and information on how to develop Non-Player Characters. Much of the setting detail is focused on the region of Northern UsHù'l.

187853.name: Shakhàn Book F: Bestiary of Northern UsHù'l
187853.description:
User summary:

Bestiary of Northern UsHù'l is essentially the "monster manual" of the Shakhàn game system. The manual is organized by type, not alphabetically. Major types include: Avians, Brhà, Canines, Crustaceans/Amphibians, Demons, Felines, Herbivores, Humanoids, Large Insects, Small Insects, Tlatlèelyo, Maritime Creatures, Mêm-Uhùryo, Plants, Reptiles, Slimes/Amorphous Creatures, Ursoids, and Unusual Creatures.

The book also includes general comments on running an encounter and establishing a hostile encounter of an appropriate difficulty. Note that in Shakhàn most monsters have a particularly wide range of abilities and also exhibit a wide range of variability in statistics, etc.

187854.name: Shakhàn Book G: The Watchers
187854.description:
From the introduction:

The Khùl-Algrenàthi'i or "They Who Watch the Many Planes", are extremely old. Their presence in Ushù'l – and, it appears, most of the rest of Telostic – dates back far beyond the start of recorded history, as it is commonly accepted by modern scholars.

The Watchers are a group of nearly immortal, semi-divine sapient beings, most (but apparently not all) possessing an Aablùshyé or "Pendant of Ruling in Glory Over Reality", supposedly, some sort of extremely powerful magical or technological artifact.

User summary:

By far the shortest volume of the main rules series, The Watchers probably is also the least significant in terms of game play. It also was the last-developed segment of the game and did not appear in any form until the Version 4.1 release.

187855.description:
Expansion for the Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Men of Hawkshold faction.
It includes new types of cards (Knights and Pikemen) besides more of the already existing ones.
187855.name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Men of Hawkshold Reinforcements

187856.name: The Great and Powerful Emperors of the Rocto-Ardae Empire
187856.description:
From the introduction:

Descriptions of the lives and accomplishments of those leaders known to have ruled the New Rocto-Ardae Empire for approximately the last two thousand years. An important fact to remember when considering the lifespan and reign of any Emperor, is that a year on Telostic is 500 days of approximately 25 hours each; for example, an Emperor of Roctien who has ruled for ten Telostician years, would have been in power 14.24 Earth years.

The descriptions of many of the Emperors, particularly the early ones prior to the First Osche Dynasty, are incomplete; historical records of the early years of the Imperium lack details in many important areas. Many of the Emperors (cf. Gnuga X) do not first appear to recorded history as the first of their namesake. There are various reasons for this, usually previous namesakes having controlled semi-independent fiefs, but in some cases there is no known explanation.

187857.name: Scenario 1: The Streets of Ròlon Revisited
187857.description:
From the introduction:

The Streets of Ròlon Revisited is an introductory scenario, designed to introduce the Referee and players to the mechanics of Shakhàn. The scenario revolves around the adventure party being hired by the Wéznu (Lord Duke) of Fief Rolòni to solve a series of mysterious crimes that have recently been committed in the streets of the Fief's capital city, Ròlon. It is meant for 3 to 6 characters of relatively low Experience Level, from I to III in the primary Level and no more than I to II as a secondary or tertiary Level.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as a ZIP archive that includes a DOC file and two CorelDraw image files (maps).

187858.name: Scenario 2: ...And Night Must Fall
187858.description:
From the introduction:

...And Night Must Fall is a mid-range scenario, designed to introduce the Referee and players to the combat mechanics of Shakhàn, as well as to demonstrate the unique characteristics of Telostic's dank, sinister Underworld complexes. The scenario involves an adventure in the Underworlds to the east of the city of Ròlon. It is meant for two separate groups – one aligned towards "good" and the other aligned towards "evil" – each of 3 to 6 characters of moderate Experience Levels, from III to VI in the primary Level and no more than II to IV as a secondary or tertiary Level. Due to the objectives (see below) assigned to each party, the "good" group should either include one or two more characters (player or nonplayer) than the "evil" one, or, alternately, should have more characters of higher level than the latter.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as a ZIP archive that includes two DOC files (the scenario and an announcement regarding tournament play), four CorelDraw image files (maps), and fifty-one excel files (character sheets).

187859.description: Expansion for the Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Undead Army faction. It includes new types of cards.
187859.name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Undead Army Reinforcements

187860.description: Expansion for the Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Orc Army faction. It includes new types of cards.
187860.name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Orc Army Reinforcements

187861.description: Expansion for the Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Elves of Ravenwood faction. It includes new types of cards.
187861.name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Elves of Ravenwood Reinforcements

187862.description: Expansion for the Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Dwarves of Runegard faction. It includes new types of cards.
187862.name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Dwarves of Runegard Reinforcements

187863.description: Expansion for the Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Lizardmen faction. It includes new types of cards.
187863.name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Lizardmen Reinforcements

187864.description: Expansion for the Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Monsters & Mercenaries faction. It includes new types of cards.
187864.name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Monsters & Mercenaries Reinforcements

187865.description: Expansion for the Battleground Historical Warfare: Alexander vs. Persia. It includes new types of cards.
187865.name: Battleground Historical Warfare: Alexander vs. Persia Reinforcements

187866.name: Scenario 3: The Tombs of the Elder Kings of Jèglur
187866.description:
From the introduction:

The Tombs of the Elder Kings of Jèglur, the third scenario that has been made available for players of Shakhàn, is a mid- to high-range scenario, designed to introduce the Referee and players to some of the more sophisticated and powerful spells and creatures of Shakhàn, as well as to demonstrate the unique characteristics of Telostic's dank, sinister Underworld complexes. The scenario is, essentially, a "dungeon crawl" – an adventure in the mid-lower levels of the Underworlds to the east and north of the city of Ròlon in the central Rocto-Ardae Imperium. For optimum play balance, the adventure party should include approximately 3 to 6 characters of mid-high Experience Levels, specifically from V to IX in the primary Level and from III to V as a secondary or tertiary Level.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as a ZIP archive that includes a DOC file and a CorelDraw image file (map).

187867.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Fleet mini-expansion includes 8 Salty Captain Cards, 8 Inuit Fisherman Cards, 3 Wharfside Casino Cards, and 3 Nunavut Weather Authority cards.
187867.name: Fleet: Mini Expansion Pack

187868.description:
From publisher's website:

Includes 8 House Boat cards, 12 Charter Boat cards, 8 First Mate cards, 6 Trophy cards, 4 Salmon Boat base licenses and 16 Boat cards (Rules included in Fleet: Arctic Bounty base game).
187868.name: Fleet: Arctic Bounty – 54 Card Expansion Pack

187869.description:
First published in 1990 and included in Reiner Knizia's book Dice Games Properly Explained

It's a dice game played with 6 regular dice

Trying to get the highest score in 18 rounds in 4 categories:
Numbers, Rungs, Clusters and Patterns

Roll dices up to 3 times and enter the score in any free row

187870.description:
The Frostbyte Ravagers warband box brings the unparalleled brutality of the orcs to Super Dungeon for the first time! Rampaging through the Frostbyte Reach, the savage hordes have spilled out into Crystalia. Combining potent offense and a hardy resilience, the orcs are driven into further frenzy by the ferocious Rage Fiend Mini-Boss. Standing in their way is the Lightning Mage, whose crackling bolts arc through multiple foes with a single blast.

CONTENTS:
Lightning Mage Hero Model
Rage Fiend Mini-Boss Model
14 Orc Monster Models: 2 Skull Stone Spawning Points, 4 Neck Splitters, 4 Face Beaters, 4 Knuckle Smashers
Game Cards: Hero, Classic Monsters, Arcade Monsters, Treasure Card
187870.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Frostbyte Ravagers

187871.description:
The Crown Guard warband represents the doughty men and women who join their local village militias, town watches, or regional military. Devoted to combined arms and defense, the Crown Guard can protect weaker monsters around them, shielding them from attacks. Occasionally, the Crown Guard are even forced to maintain the peace against rambunctious Heroes, or—in more dire situations—turn to the service of the Dark Consul. While orcs are ferocious, they are not unintelligent, and the Crook-Eye Tracker has recognized the threat of the Dark Consul, lending his considerable survival and hunting skills to the good of the land.

CONTENTS:
Crook-Eye Tracker Hero Model
Royal Knight Mini-Boss Model
14 Crown Guard Monster Models: 2 Watchtower Spawning Points, 2 Sergeant-at-Arms, 4 Longbowmen, 4 Swordsmen, 4 Pikemen
Game Cards: Hero, Classic Monsters, Arcade Monsters, Treasure Card
187871.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Crown Guard

187872.description:
The Midnight Tower level expansion reveals the dreaded armies of The Midnight Queen. Armies of baroque-armored Nether Elves issue forth from the corrupted Tower of the Goddess. Within their ranks, cursed Spider Speakers summon scuttling hordes of spiders, spinning webs of shadow and poisoning their foes. Alongside them march powerful Knights of the Tower on spectral steeds, while Tower Stalkers lurk in the shadows weakening the mightiest Heroes, before their fellows strike the final blow. Three new Heroes take up the call to adventure: the rugged Hearthsworn Tincan, sneaky Cat Burglar, and brutal Riftling Warrior.

CONTENTS:

3 Hero Models: Hearthsworn Tincan, Cat Burglar, Riftling Warrior
Midnight Queen Dungeon Boss Model
Daemonus Construct Model
Knight of the Tower Mini-Boss Model
8 Spider Monster Models: Spider Nest Spawning Point, Nether Elf Spider Speaker, 3 Crawlers, 3 Shadow Spinners
14 Nether Elf Monster Models: 2 Shadow Tower Spawning Points, 2 Tower Stalker, 4 Tower Blackblades, 6 Tower Arbalists
Game Cards: Heroes, Classic Monsters, Arcade Monsters, 6 Treasure Cards, 12 Explore Cards
187872.name: Super Dungeon Explore: The Midnight Tower

187873.name: The Experiments
187873.description:
The Experiments is a Traveller one-shot scenario for 1-5 players. Designed to be played in a single session, the PCs find themselves in a horror survival situation. Convinced they were about to start a new life on a new world as part of the first wave of workers, they instead wake up in an underground facility on an operating table. With the lights failing, water pouring down the walls, and strange dangerous creatures coming up from below, this was not what they expected.

- Publisher Blurb

187874.description:
Carpe Diem and Vae Victis Brothers and Sisters of the Order!

For thousands of years Fate has had a plan for you. As a member of the Eternal Order of Perseus you know your destiny has been written… your path chosen. You are tied to the of ones who came before… you’re A Bastion of Hope… A Beacon in the Darkness... an Ender of Doom, a Saver of Souls, you are Fate’s Crusader… you’re on a quest… and you’re the one who can sense what needs to be done to reach your true potential.

Fate can not be chosen, it is set and those who fight against fate betray their destiny… if destiny is betrayed then your quest becomes tainted and you may become a Traitor!

In Secrets of the Lost Tomb: Fate's Fortune, as you explore the Tomb, each adventurer will begin the game with a Fate Card sending you on a secret quest, that upon completion, unlocks your Adventurer’s True Power! On the back of each Adventurer Sheet, there is now a unique Ascended Adventurer with their own Unique Equipment Card, Upgraded Attributes, Abilities, and Courage Track!
