In addition, all Ascended Adventurers have their own unique alternate artwork and standee, rewarding the player’s successful completion of their quest!

But be warned, some of these quests can optionally be “Traitor Quests”, when this player completes their quest a harsh crisis will fall upon the other Adventurers as the newly revealed Traitor turns on their former friends and joins the side of Evil in the active scenario.

Are you brave enough to fight for your future... are you prepared to meet your destiny when faced with… Fate’s Fortune?
187874.name: Secrets of the Lost Tomb: Fate's Fortune

187875.name: The Adventures of Peter Rabbit & Benjamin Bunny
187875.description:
Game Box

Beatrix Potter's classic characters spring to life when your child enters this interactive storyland featuring Peter Rabbit and his friends.

187876.name: Il Grande Gioco dei Quiz
187876.description:
A challenging and fun game with many quizes developed in collaboration with the editors of Focus Junior.
Over 1000 questions designed for children in school age on many subjects like Science, Geography, Curiosity, Sports, Entertainment and more.
Very original and surprising game mechanics where everyone must bet, in fact, in the response of the opponent!

187878.name: Pathways (Issue 53 - Nov 2015)
rpgissuearticle: 20 Things to Find in a Dusty Crypt
20 Things to Find in a Vampire's Lair
Questhaven: Karnak -- Island of the Archosaurs
187878.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Horrific Pathways

How can you say no to even more FREE Pathfinder content. A monster template, horror traits, a vicious centaur; Dungeon Dressings for dusty crypts and vampire lairs, plus more Isle of Tranquiliy, as well as episode #18 of the Path Less Traveled Comic by Jacob Blackmon. If you say no, Steven D. Russell and cover artist Manfred Rohrer will release a gallows duergar upon you!

Rite Publishing brings you Pathways, a free 'zine packed with plenty of Open Gaming Content you can bring to nearly any table. You'll find articles by Justin Sluder (Faces of the Tarnished Souk), Jonathan McAnulty(Curse of the Golden Spear Adventure Trilogy), Steven D. Russell (Book of Monster Templates) and Creighton Broadhurst (Raging Swan Press) plus an interview with the force behind Ponyfinder, David Silver.

187879.name: GooCubelets
187879.description:
User Summary

You move a green cube to hit a blue cube and place it in the target area. Yellow cubes do not move and you must be at least two spaces from a blue cube to move it over on contact. The graphics have a gooey residue that is left slighty behind and the music is simple techno.

187880.description: This packet of Munchkin cards has Munchkin backs (half are Treasure cards, half are Door cards) and blank fronts. Create your own ridiculous monsters and super-powerful treasures!
boardgameaccessory: The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin
187880.name: Munchkin: Blank Cards

187881.description: This packet of 20 Chez Geek cards has Chez Geek backs and blank (all-white) fronts.
187881.name: Chez Geek: Blank Cards

187882.name: Tinker Tactics
187882.description:
Tinker Tactics is a free, abstract microgame for 2 or 4 players and takes around 5-10 minutes to play.

Rules:


1D8, 2D6, 2D4
Each player rolls dice but hides them from opponent
Each player announces score. All players adjust dice to match the highest score (except highest scorer)
All players arrange dice as they wish on their board
Players reveal and connect board to each other
Players take it in turn to move each die. Die move the same number of spaces as pips on the die
They can move across filled spaces but must land on empty space
Dice cannot move diagonally, nor are diagonally situated dice affected by enemy dice
Any enemy dice adjacent reduce number on die by 1
Any dice reduced to 0 are removed from the board
A player is eliminated from the game when they have only 1 die left
The last player remaining is the winner

187883.description: Promo Card for The Three Pillars: A Paranormal Card Game. Game text reads, "Plays in your evidence pool. This card is worth +1 O at the end of the game. May not be canceled." This was a promo card available to attendees of GameHoleCon 2015.
187883.name: The Three Pillars: GameHoleCon Promo Card

187885.name: Kettousi Cardgame
187885.description:
User summary:
決闘師カードゲーム (Kettousi Cardgame) means The Duelist Cardgame in English.

In the game of Kettousi Cardgame, two characters fight each other with character-specific decks of 18 cards each.

You play a card to move yourself or force your opponent move in 5 x 5 square grid board.

You win a round if your opponent cannot play a card, and you win the game if you win three rounds.

Publisher's summary:
それぞれ18枚、非対称のデッキを使う2人用対戦カードゲームです。
カードをプレイすることで自分のコマを移動。または相手のコマを移動させることができなくなったプレイヤーがそのラウンドを落とします。
先に勝利点カードを3枚手にしたほうが勝ちます。

187886.name: Hotori
187886.description:
User summary:

In the game of ほとり (Hotori), you are a commander of a battle and your goal is to gain strategic advantages over your opponents. You earn points by deploying soldiers and building citadels in the right places. The player with the most points wins the game.

Publisher's summary:

場に並べたカード「戦場」に兵士コマを配置して、
その配置した地形の価値を上げる。
もしくは価値の高いカードに兵士コマを配置することで得点を競うゲームです。

187887.description: This set of 5 Istanbul Wheelbarrow overlays helps to keep your resource cubes in place and expands as you visit the Wainright to purchase extensions. The constant turnover of resources in Istanbul makes knocking the cubes around on the wheelbarrow inevitable, and could be costly in your quest for rubies. Our overlay makes sure that no table bump will cost you resources and the win.
187887.name: Istanbul: Wheelbarrow Overlays

187888.description: Istanbul Location Overlays are laser cut from 3mm clear cast acrylic for the Post Office, Sultan's Palace and Gemstone Dealer in Istanbul and complement our Wheelbarrow overlay. Made for keeping gemstones and cubes in place while rolling dice, and moving your pieces and family members.
187888.name: Istanbul: Location Overlays

187889.name: Tinboy
187889.description:
User Summary

As a manufactured tinboy, you have the power to shoot arrows upon which you can jump to higher levels. Some arrows allow you to swing by an attached rope or get catapulted high with a timed bomb. The aim is to exit the room, taking as many bonus icons as possible.

187890.name: I.Q. Games: Culture Classics
187890.description:
From the box:
"Learn about the exciting, mysterious and adventurous world of literature and the arts as you play this fast-paced quiz game! Each card contains five clues. Answer on the first clue and you earn five points. If you answer after all five clues (including a picture clue), you still earn a point! The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!"

One player starts by drawing a card depicting a famous artist or work of art (concealing the picture on the front and covering the clues one the back). He or she reads the first clue the player to the left. If that player answers, he or she earns five points. If not, the first player reads the next clue to the next player. This sequence continues until a player answers correctly, earning a decreasing number of points depending on how many clues have been revealed. The final clue is the picture on the front of the card. Once a card has been solved, the player earning the points draws the next card, and play continues until all cards are used. The player with the most points wins.

187891.name: Animal Match Puzzle Cards
187891.description: Animal Match Puzzle Cards is a matching game designed to teach reading skill to young children. It consists of a series of cards depicting animals and matching puzzle pieces showing the written names of the animals. The picture cards are placed face-up on the table. The name pieces are stacked face-down. Players take turns choosing a name piece. They must then read the word and correctly match it to its animal picture card. If the puzzle piece fits the card, the player is correct and keeps the pair. If not, the name piece is placed back on the bottom of the pile and the animal card is returned to its place. Play continues until all pairs are claimed, and the player with the most pairs wins.

187892.name: The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing: Final Cut
videogameseries: The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing
videogamecompilation: The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing
The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing II
The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing III
187892.description:
Discover a monumental Gothic Action RPG with protagonist Van Helsing and his witty ghost companion, Lady Katarina. Explore an industrial world filled with dark magic, grotesque monsters, and vile machinery. Defeat hordes of creatures that threaten Borgovia, hunt for better equipment and more treasure!

Developed by independent game studio NeocoreGames, The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing was originally released as a trilogy of 10-hour campaigns with various multiplayer modes, and has sold over 1 million copies worldwide. Now that the story is complete, you can get it in one package with extended single- and multiplayer content. You can play though the whole saga with only one install and get all the content from the original trilogy and much more!

Source: The Developer Website.

187893.description:
The 2015 Halloween Promo Gear card was included with the 2015 Halloween Special Pinup Twilight Knight and available only during the 2015 and 2016 Halloween weekends.

The figure itself is not part of the game.

Gear Recipe
Cost: 1x Skull, 1x Scrap, 1x Organ
Innovation Requirements: Momento Mori
187893.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Jack O' Lantern Promo

187894.name: Orc Slayer
187894.description:
Orc Slayer is a First Person Shooter (FPS) set in a semi-medieval time period. You play as a lone inventor who has crafted a revolutionary weapon, one that may just be capable of putting an end to the Orc occupation.

Source: The Game Website.

187895.name: Tongue Twisters
187895.description:
From the box:
"Tired tigers, ruffled rabbits, wiggly worms and others get together to make a very funny learning game. Your children will play again and again by themselves by themselves or with friends, at home or in the car. They listen to the Tongue Twisters on the cassette and match them to their lotto board.

To play, each person takes a lotto board and nine coloured tokens. Start the cassette at any point on either side for a different game every time. Find the picture of the Tongue Twister and cover it with a token. Cover all your pictures to win. For a real challenge, use the letters only side of the board."

187896.name: Deadlands Noir - That Old Time Religion
187896.description:
User Summary

You play a Sam Spade style gumshoe looking into supernatural crimes, often being approached by Jewish religious figures. You choose action moves at times and live by the consequences, although sometimes allies are there to help you. The graphics are stills in black and white and the music is punctuated by sound effects (like shot-gun blasts) depending on the script.

187897.name: The Shell Roleplaying System
187897.description:
Form the introduction:

This is the skeleton of a FRPG system. It is just the rules; not the world, or the campaign, or even the equipment charts or anything. To flesh this system out into a playable game, one must first provide the genre, which is a list of equipment and their stats, monetary systems, spells and how they are learned, character advantages and disadvantages, and available skills.

User summary:

Characters have Primary Attributes (Strength, Agility, and Intelligence) as well as some derived Primary Attributes (Encumbrance, Damage, and Attack/Defense). Characters also have Secondary Attributes (Health, Hit Points, Endurance, Willpower, Charisma, and Perception). Characters may have additional Secondary Attributes depending on their race. Characters also may have Skills which are placed in Skill Groups. Resolution of all actions consists of a die roll plus modifier compared to a target number.

187898.name: Swords & Crossbones: An Epic Pirate Story
187898.description:
User Summary

With comedic dialogue and characters, you fall into a group of pirates and work out of an island to increase your power but also to succeed in your quest to find the lost treasure of the Cenote. There are lots of RPG aspects to develop in the game and even lots to explore, especially if you want to discover all the repartee that the devs have given to different characters and situations. The battles are fairly straightforwardly turn-based and the graphics are fairly basic.

187899.name: Starship Traveller
187899.description:
User Summary

Although the names have been changed, this is really a Star Trek adventure done up as a Choose your Own Adventure. It is a direct version of Steve Jackson's RPG game Starship Traveller, and includes basic decisions as well as dice rolling to pass tests. It's big on adventure and atmosphere, keeping the charm of other Steve Jackson adventures.

187900.name: Slayer of Dragon
187900.description:
From the introduction:

Slayer of Dragon is not about martial science. If there are rules for something, it is only because that something is cool. Cool enough to spend time talking about it. Everything else is fluff.

User summary:

Characters in Slayer of Dragon have Attributes (Power, Quickness, and Chi) that have ratings measured from 1-5, with 2 being Typical. Ratings are purchased from a point pool. Characters also have four basic techniques (Punch, Kick, Wrestle, and Block). Each technique has a rating, also purchased from a point pool. Characters have a few other atypical scores, including Void Points (spent to alter narrative events), Star Power (the character's narrative significance), and others.

187901.name: Wyrd Con 2014 Companion Book
187901.description:
User summary:

This is the companion book to the 2014 Wyrd Con, edited by Sarah Lynne Bowman. It contains articles on RPG theory, including:


The State of Amtgard
The Theory Game: Nordic LARP, Psychotherapy, and Player Safety
Culture Shock: Building a Freeform Scene in Edmonton
The Origins of Geek Culture: Perspectives on a Parallel Intellectual milieu
Playing with Myth: Applying Mythic Imagination to Live Action Role-Play
The Parlor Sandbox: Counter-Players and Ephemera in American Freeform
Entering and Leaving the "Magic Circle" as Symbolic Acts: The Case of Russian Field Larps
Level Up: Guys, We Need to Talk
The Academic Section
Pulling the Trigger on Player Agency: How Psychological Intrusions in Larps Affect Game Play
Educational Live Action Role-Playing Games: A Secondary Literature Review
Larping the Past: Research
Lessons Learned from Larp: Promoting Social Realism in Nursing Simulation

187902.name: Oodlegobs
187902.description:
User Summary

In Oodlegobs, the player controls a virus that has been uploaded into MewTube, a video streaming website focusing on cat content. The virus - called oodlegobs - grows more entities if it consumes the cat data from the website. Each new oodlegob moves in sync with the original oodlegob, and can stack and gather to move around the treacherous terrain.

187903.name: Player of the Game Basketball
187903.description:
Player of the Game Basketball is designed to provide a quick method of resolving a basketball game between any two teams. Where this game is truly unique is in its ability to not only provide you with a final score, but it will also give you individual point, rebound and assist totals for each player that participates in the game.

Once you understand the concepts behind the game, you’ll be able to play out a full game in 5 minutes for the basic game, and 7-10 minutes for the advanced game.

The game offers two levels of complexity. For those gamers that wish to use Player of the Game Basketball in conjunction with another basketball title that resolves games in a possession by possession manner, the basic version will more than likely provide you with all of the detail that you require. Since the basic version plays quicker, it should be a great tool for single team replayers that want to get a snapshot of the rest of the league.

The advanced version of the game is designed for gamers that wish to conduct a series, or a complete season using only Player of the Game Basketball. The advanced version will provide you with hot and cold streaks for players, as well as a realistic game pace factor that will provide you with a realistic method of reproducing the high and lower scoring affairs that occur in basketball, all with their real-life frequency. The advanced version is a great method of playing cross-era teams to see who was truly better.

You will need 2 D10, not included with the game. You use the d10 rolls to determine which players on a given team will play in a game and what his potential scoring total is. Additional rolls are used to calculate adjustments due to defense, home court advantage and other factors.

187904.name: Roguelight
187904.description:
User Summary

Originally made for #gbjam3, this is a one-life platform adventure game that allows the player to unlock permanent upgrades between attempts.

With a theme of light and darkness, the player uses arrows to light the way and to defeat monsters.

The game is by Daniel Linssen with sound and music by Jonathon Tree.

187905.name: Dracula's Legacy
187905.description:
User Summary

A hidden object mystery but with a harder horror edge. You and your fiance boyfriend go to a ghost town in hopes of discovering answers to your dreams. You are attacked and your boyfriend is taken away.

187906.name: Les Débogueurs
187906.description:
This game is a snakes and ladder kind of race with a twist.
Set inside a computer, the goal is to race from start to finish. Special face-down tiles are placed on the board with various chaotic effects. Movement is driven by cards and players will get attacked or powered up by viruses along the way.

187907.name: Lift It
187907.description:
User Summary

As a weightlifter, you train in a gym to increase your strength or dexterity stats on the various exercise areas: bench, squats, dead lift, and treadmilll. Once your stats are high enough, you can go to other island to challenge competitors, win money and but items.

187908.name: Authentic Professional Football Game
187908.description: In Authentic Professional Football Game, players use a stack of cards to simulate the plays in a football game. The offensive player chooses his play and then picks a card. Each card lists a result for all possible plays. The player checks his chosen play and applies the result by moving a football marker on a football field board. Downs, first downs and scoring work as they do in American football. Kicks (kickoffs and punts) are resolved by drawing one card for the kick distance and another for the return distance. When a play results in a penalty, interception or too-short field goal, another card is drawn to show the result. When all the cards in the stack are used up, a quarter ends. The deck is then shuffled and the next quarter begins. The second half (or third quarter) begins with a kickoff. As in a typical football game, the player with the most points after four quarters wins.

187909.name: Hexaclub
187909.description:
1964 Canadian abstract game with a colorful hexagonal board.

Each player has pieces of three different colours, which behave differently if they are on "home territory" or "enemy lines" (different colours).

The goal of the game is to send your pieces to the central "fortress" hexagon, but you can be sent back to your home square by an "assault" of an enemy piece.

187910.name: Asylum Staff Manual
187910.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first supplement to the Asylum game.

Find out about the Staff -- the people in charge of the Wards -- and their headquarters, known appropriately as Offices. Learn what life is like in Offices, how the Staff live, what they do to maintain the Ward, and how to play a Staff character. It's a whole new side to the insanity!

187911.name: Flowing Water Style (Martial Arts Style Feats)
187911.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Flowing Water Style allows the warrior to use a wide variety of weapon ranging from the bo staff to the Yueng Yang Blade in a style that allows the wielder to effectively make two weapon attacks, disarm foes, feint opponents, and even sunder weapons and armor. This feat style path allows characters to emmulate the effects of other feats that may have limitations based on ability scores or class requirements. The supplement also introduces several new oriental weapons for the Pathfinder game including the Gunbai (war fan), Chin Zi Dao (double weapon), and Sun & Moon Ring.

187912.name: The Giant's Tribute
187912.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for master characters

For ten years the people of the village of Rowanrest lived in the shadow of a giant, a lazy brute named Roog Muttonfist. Regular tributes of livestock and beer were a small price to pay to keep the huge lout from knocking down houses or eating people, and the farmers of Rowanrest had enough to spare. But something went terribly wrong with this month’s offering. Last night Roog came down to Rowanrest and demanded people instead of sheep—and the terrified villagers know that the giant might destroy the whole town and kill everyone if they refuse him.

The Giant’s Tribute is an adventure for master characters. The group completes the adventure when they deal with the giant and uncover the reason for the unsettling demand.

187913.name: Calypso
187913.description:
From publisher blurb:

The power of the elements, the fury of a goddess... Calypso!

A Power Level 12 Rogue, Calypso is the fury of the sea personified! Calypso is an iconic character in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Calypso is designated "Red" for her naturally occurring meta-human abilities. Before taking the name Calypso, she was known as Janet Brooke, a teenaged athlete growing up in a world filled with superhumans. Her worst nightmares were realized when her own latent meta-human abilities surfaced in a moment of panic, and her life came apart at the seams. In an extreme case of denial, she now claims she is the goddess Calypso, and is always ready to unleash her mad fury upon any heroes unlucky enough to cross her path. In her hysteria she is a threat to everyone around her, though she is most likely to focus her wrath on heroes who are known to have special powers or who might have a personal connection to her.

187914.name: Guild of Shadows Campaign Guide
187914.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Thieves Wanted' for this dark fantasy role-playing campaign setting for Savage Worlds.

An elite thieves’ guild operates within the darkened alleyways of crowded city streets, skillfully pulling the invisible strings of its inhabitants. Join the Guild of Shadows, and play the role of a guild member, planning and executing skilled robberies, confidence schemes, smash and grab jobs, and even the occasional murder....

Featuring:

Seven new archetypes including the assassin, pick pocket, swindler and more!
More than 30 illicitly themed Edges and Hindrances.
Specialized rules for Disguises and Poisons.
Full background and plot hooks for a stand-alone city ready to be dropped into any campaign world.

187915.name: Guild of Shadows Adventures
187915.description:
From publisher blurb:

A three-pack adventure bundle featuring: 'The Initiates Path' details an exciting introduction for new guild members.'The Vipers' Nest' has the players going head-to-head with a rival guild in the city. 'Kurstwahl's Eleven' is a challenging adventure in which the players target the city's most exclusive gambling hall.

These adventures require the [Guild of Shadows campaign setting].

187916.name: U Mad Bro?
187916.description:
Cthuhulu awakens, promptly dies from pollution, and his corpse washes up on the Jersey shore. You're a boardwalk bro looking to impress some babes, but these girls are demanding you grab some tentacles off that nasty dome and don't care about the stuffed banana you won at ring toss! Keep grabbing tentacles until you either give up or go crazy in this pub style push your luck card game.

There are three types of cards: tentacles, junk, and madness. Players want to get as many tentacle cards as possible to win the round, but anyone who draws a madness card goes crazy and is out. Dawn cards are kept face down, so players don't know how many of anyone else's cards are tentacles, and how many are junk. First to win three rounds, wins.

187917.name: #30 Bloodrager Organizations
187917.description:
From publisher blurb:

Don’t Make Them Angry!

Within #30 Bloodrager Organizations, you will find over 50 pages detailing the complex societies the hybrids of eldritch might and uncontrollable wrath belong to.

Join the Bane of the Moonshifters, who have all lost someone close to lycanthropes and sworn vengeance as they seek to reclaim the portion of their own souls stolen by the were-beasts. Avoid the Djinn Touched, fanatics who obey their Lady Ja’li’Tahl, helping her achieve her dream of enforced peace through conquest and war. Moreover, learn from the Weaponmasters of Seething Anger, who serve the three grandmasters with unquestioning obedience as the use their sorcerous anger to forge a better world.

This product includes first person narratives for each organization, so that you have an immersive guide for interactions with each society detailing their alignment, tenants, entry requirements, leadership as well as custom character options. These included both Alternate Class Features as well as new and exciting Feats so that each bloodrager you create or encounter can be a truly unique individual.

If you have a violent temperament coupled with the ambition born of arcane talent, you should peruse these pages until you find the organization right for you or your campaign.

187918.name: Coastal Region
187918.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I wisely started with a map and made the story fit.."

Costal Region, a new offering from Tommi Salama the gifted cartographer for Kobold Press, Rite Publishing, Raging Swan Press and many more, gives you a new region to use in any campaign! This elegant, coastal regin is a spoiler-free unlabeled versions, created in hand drawn gorgeous full-color, This file includes a JPEG plus a printable map pck in Letter pages so you can lay it across the table.

187919.name: Arcana Journal (Issue 78 - Nov 2015)
187919.description:
From publisher blurb:

The true wonders of Arcana are explored in the monthly journals. Each issue focuses on a hex within the game world, offering rumors, hidden lore, and detailed descriptions of all the important sites and people of that area. Full color maps (also offered in print-easy black and white) are provided on the hex itself, plus all sites of worthwhile note, such as towns and major adventure sites. Floor plans of castles and other location are also offered.

In addition to this detailed write-up of the hex, each issue will also focus on other aspects of the game world, its history, important people, the Magi and gaming classes. When you add it all up, these journals take the mundane and make it magical. It is through the journals that the Arcana game world will grow, expand, and become a living place of adventure.

This issue of the Journal will cover the following aspects of the game world.

House Cardholder
School of the Art
Magic Symbols

187920.name: Fate Codex Volume 1 Anthology
rpgissuearticle: Action As Intent: Adding Discover to FATE Core
Changing Skills: A Matter of Survival
FATE Is A Safe Place: FATE Core as A Tool For Inclusive Gamers
Game Creation Tips: Managing the Coversation
How To Train Your Mutant Fire Dog
Lock and Load: Using Ammo in FATE
Quick Start Adventure: The Dead and The Doomed
Quick Start Adventure: The Pilots of Eden
Voyages: A Skill Set For Getting There
187920.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The Fate Codex is a mostly-monthly e-zine featuring Quick Start Adventures and more for the Fate roleplaying system. The project, funded through Patreon, grows and swells as more patrons support our work. We've been lucky to have lots of folks pledge, enough to finish up our first year--and volume--of The Fate Codex!

Now we've put together all the issues of that first volume of The Fate Codex into this one anthology. Inside, you'll find issues 1 through 7 of The Fate Codex, complete with the fiction, essays, systems, quickstarts, and art that make The Fate Codex great.

The pages of this volume fature the over 400 pages of original Fate Codex content produced by a massive miscellany of authors, including: Brian Engard, Leonard Balsera, Brie Sheldon, Mark Diaz Truman, Ryan Macklin, Phil Lewis, Quinn Murphy, John Adamus, June Shores, Christopher Ruthenbeck, Nick Bate, André La Roche, Phil Vecchione, Chris Sniezak, J. Huston Todd, Shoshana Kessock, Marissa Kelly, Tara Zuber, Kira Magrann, Rob Wieland, Steve Radabaugh, Carrie Harris, Brendan Conway, Eddy Webb, Cheyenne Rae Grimes, and Nicole Winchester.

The art from the original issues is carried over to the anthology as well, with works by such artists as: Marissa Kelly, Juan Ochoa, Tom Miskey, Kaitlynn Peavler, Mike Mumah, Claudia Cangini, Liz Courts, and Jeremy Kostiew.

Now we're bringing this content to you on DriveThruRPG, so you can find and download the entirety of the first volume of The Fate Codex with ease. Pick up this anthology, and you'll be swimming in fantastic content for the Fate system, from systems for how to run zombies in fate or how to use skills like Survival in new and different ways, to essays on how to collaboratively construct your worlds with your group or adding Discover as a main action to Fate's system, to quickstarts featuring fighter pilots in space or lesbian crime noir.

Huge thanks to our production team members who helped make these issues a reality--John Adamus, Amanda Valentine, Shelley Harlan, Thomas Deeny, and Sally Christensen, thank you all for your amazing hard work! And thanks especially to Thomas Deeny for making this anthology a reality! We hope you enjoy this first volume of The Fate Codex!

187921.name: Infiltration
187921.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Argo Galaxy is growing – not physically but figuratively. After years of study, the House of the Alliance has finally decided to open the Hastilion Expanse for full settlement and corporate utilization. Researchers identified numerous planets and moons as optimal for civilization and corporations from around the known galaxy, including Drake Mining and Manufacturing, are making plans to acquire land.

Since its inception, Drake Mining and Manufacturing has prided itself on mining resources and creating high-quality products from those resources to support the entire galaxy. Moving into the Hastilion Expanse provides them with a wealth of opportunities to expand their operations and grow their business. That is, of course, if their new facilities can survive.

New planets are always fraught with hidden dangers from native flora and fauna, pirates, rival corporations, and rebellious populations. Only the strength of Drake’s mercenary force will help them overcome any roadblocks and become successful. As long as they don’t get killed in the process.

Infiltration presents the Veteran portion of the Hastilion Expanse campaign for Mercenary Breed Savage Worlds or it can be used as a collection of adventures for any sci-fi setting. While parts of it were originally published in Savage Insider Premium and the Hastilion Expanse Compendiums, this new campaign book updates that content to Mercenary Breed 2.0 and expands on it.

Infiltration includes:

Veteran-rank campaign missions.
A collection of additional Veteran-rank adventures based within the Drake Mining and Manufacturing setting.
New Xenopedia entries.

187922.name: Infinite Armor
187922.description:
From publisher blurb:

What Sci-Fi is complete without some cool gear to play with. Well Avalon is here with a whole new series of gear books for IF 2.0. Inside you will find all kinds of cool armor to use in your game, so strap on your new toys and conjure the universe.

187923.name: Master Artist Series: The Master Dancer
187923.description:
From publisher blurb:

With style and grace, no foe can match the speed and fluidity of your movements. Utilize your talents to maneuver around attacks and control your enemy step by step, evolving your plan of attack each step of the way.

Glance over the playbook preview to learn how you can become your enemy's worst nightmare, with abilities to parry, deflect, and lock up your foes at your whim.

Demonstrate your strength and grace both on and off the battlefield as... The Master Dancer!

187924.name: Gothnog's Exceptional Spells & Rituals (Fifth Edition)
187924.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's Magic!

Spells and rituals are perhaps the most iconic aspects to most fantasy role playing games. The purpose of this book is to expand upon the standard magical repertoire, giving spell casters over 100 unique spells.

In addition to the obvious benefits that these spells provide, many also offer rich opportunities for character and story development. In some cases, a brief historical reference has been provided for a spell to give it a bit of a back story that the DM can then weave into her own campaign setting.

187925.name: Storage Shed
187925.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 277th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a small storage shed hidden among a copse of trees.

The map is 14 x 20 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 4 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2880 pixels in size at 144dpi.

187926.description:
The Kickstarter Edition includes the Metropolis Expansion, which comprises 40 new building cards and 2 extra Reputation cards.


In Islebound, you take command of a ship and crew. You sail to island towns, collecting resources, hiring crew, and commissioning buildings for your capital city. Each building has a unique ability, and your combination of buildings can greatly enhance your strength as a trader, builder, or invader. You also recruit pirates and sea monsters to conquer towns, which, once conquered, allow you to complete the town action for free, and charge a fee to opponents if they want to use it. Alternatively, you can complete events that give influence, which can be used to befriend towns.

There are many routes to success. Will you be a ruthless conqueror, careful diplomat, or shrewd merchant in your race to the top?

The player with the most wealth and most-impressive capital city will win the game!
187926.name: Islebound (Kickstarter edition)
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 1: T.I.M.E Stories and Literally the Worst Games

187927.name: Geldeheim
187927.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Geldeheim Castle article describes the settlement's history, government, religion, economics, and military forces. Includes a full description and color floor plans for the castle, along with color GM and player maps of the settlement. Brief descriptions are given for many local craftsmen and other locations in the town. Several locations are given an expanded treatment and have detailed descriptions, color floor plans, and adventure hooks. These include the temples of Sarajin and Agrik, the college of heralds, the shipyard, a hideworker's shop, and the ruins of Annwyn, an ancient and abandoned hillfort.


User summary:

Article contains 28 pages:

Geldeheim overview article (14 pages)
Geldeheim #2 location details (2 pages)
Geldeheim #3 location details (2 pages)
Geldeheim #4 location details (2 pages)
Geldeheim #7 location details (4 pages)
Geldeheim #21 location details (2 pages)
Geldeheim #40 location details (2 pages)

187928.name: Orbaal (Geldeheim)
187928.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map H2 covers the area around Geldeheim, seat of the King of Orbaal, and the rest of the Geldesfjord, the kingdom's most populous region. Major settlements include the castle towns of Geldeheim and Vaagel as well as the fortified thrans of Fjaga, Shien, Ebein, Zynholm, Daasen, Aaldem, and Pethwys. Like the rest of Orbaal, the terrain here is mountainous, with scattered villages, towns, and cultivated lands mostly along the rough coastline. The wild terrain, harsh seas, barbarian tribes, colonies of gargun (Hârnic orcs), and much more offer plenty of opportunities for adventure.

187929.name: Le zug
187929.description:
Le zug is played on the dark squares of a 17x17 board (the four edge squares must be dark). A game starts with 12 pieces per player. Nine pieces of each color are placed on the first and the last row. In the first move (each player's first turn) the players put their three remaining pieces on the row next to their other pieces in any order they want them.
After that players move at their turn one of their pieces diagonally forward to an adjacent empty square. Players also can jump over their own pieces or over those of their opponent (even combining both colors) similar to Halma but only diagonally forward. However, they don't have to jump, if they don't want to, and they can stop a jumping move anywhere, not making the largest jump possible. After the last jump they are allowed to move the piece, which did the jump, one square diagonally forward to an adjacent empty square. Again, this is not mandatory. No pieces are ever captured and the jumped pieces remain untouched.

The first four rows of each player are called their "railway station" ("gare" in French; "Bahnhof" in German). Players are not permitted to enter their opponent's railway station, before they have vaca­ted their own one. After a player has entered all of his pieces into the opponent's railway station, he is allowed to move or jump backward to reach the final goal position, but only as long as all of his pieces remain in the opponent's railway station.

The object of the game is to place nine pieces on the last row and the remaining three pieces anywhere on the penultimate row, that is to recreate a valid start position on the opponent's side of the board.

The name of the game is French and German mixed together ("le" is the masculine French article; "zug" means train in German). The game is meant to celebrate friendship between the French and the German peoples after centuries of wars fought between them. It is related to Halma and Salta. Le zug was first described in the book "Le livre de tous les jeux" (Edition Solar), which was published in France on January 1, 1989.

187930.name: Seven Leagues (Demo Version)
187930.description:
User summary:

A "demo" version of the game was circulated as a freely downloadable PDF of 50 pages. The content of included pages is identical to the full commercial product. The "demo" includes these pages: Cover, ii, 4-16, 21-22, 28, 36-39, 43-50, 74-84, and 91-99. The cover graphic density ("resolution") is not as fine as the commercial product.

187931.name: Slayer: Roleplaying in the World of Buffy the Vampire Slayer
rpg: Slayer: Roleplaying in the World of Buffy the Vampire Slayer
187931.description:
User summary:

Slayer: Roleplaying in the World of Buffy the Vampire Slayer was provided in two formats--an HTML format that was unusual in presenting numerous full-page graphics with embedded text, or in an eFAX format that required the user to download and install a custom executable that would then retrieve completed PDF pages from a (now defunct) server. The game presented extensive photographs that were "taken without permission".

The game is similar to most Buffyverse systems with the exception that is proposes a change in the milieu that allows for multiple (many) slayers to exist simultaneously. This allows every player to create and run a slayer character in the same campaign and even party.

187932.name: Sangin Despatches No.2
187932.description: This 76 page supplement includes additional scenarios and rules for the Skirmish Sangin miniatures game. The book includes six new scenarios, additional rules for JTAC’s, Helicopter, Drones and Combat Engineers. It also contains a new 16 page Taliban ORBAT (order of battle) that includes everything you need to know about building a Taliban Insurgent force, including Chechen allies.

187934.name: Skirmish Sangin: Maalintii Rangers
187934.description: This 84 page Battle Book includes additional scenarios and rules for the Skirmish Sangin miniatures game. The book includes the key scenarios and all the additional rules to re-enact the Battle of Mogadishu - a battle made world famous, first by the book, then the film of Black Hawk Down.

187935.name: Congregate
187935.description: Congregate is a social political game where players use various Representatives to accomplish their hidden Agendas in a series of votes. Each Session (round) a player will choose a Proposition for all others to debate and vote on. Players augment their votes with different types of Representatives, from the highly influential Councilors to the destructive Spies. Whatever the approach, players must do anything in their power to accomplish their hidden Agendas and amass the most wealth.

187936.name: Carnivorous Coin
187936.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each release for Crawthorne's Catalog of Creatures for the Pathfinder RPG presents a single, new creature for your Pathfinder RPG game, as presented by the famous and retired monster hunter and adventurer, Lord Crawthorne. Each release presents game stats for the new creature, as well as three adventure ideas to help insert them into your game.

The Abroa, also known as a carnivorous coin, is capable of camouflaging itself to appear to be a precious coin. When disturbed, however, it reveals its true nature and attacks with piercing mandibles and dripping acid. Game stats are provided for a single abroa and an entire swarm of the nasty coin creatures.

187937.name: Treeshadow
187937.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each release for Crawthorne's Catalog of Creatures for the Pathfinder RPG presents a single, new creature for your Pathfinder RPG game, as presented by the famous and retired monster hunter and adventurer, Lord Crawthorne. Each release presents game stats for the new creature, as well as three adventure ideas to help insert them into your game.

As part of their variation on fey religion, the Treeshadow believe they have been charged with protecting their kin from outsiders, whether they like it or not. These dark fey do so with violent and intent and means, making best use of their ability to merge with trees to enhance their strength and hide from unwary intruders until the time is right to spring their ambush.

187938.name: Werespider
187938.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each release for Crawthorne's Catalog of Creatures for the Pathfinder RPG presents a single, new creature for your Pathfinder RPG game, as presented by the famous and retired monster hunter and adventurer, Lord Crawthorne. Each release presents game stats for the new creature, as well as three adventure ideas to help insert them into your game.

The Werespider is an orderly, dangerous hunter that enjoys sitting at the center of its web as its prey walks in to get caught. This product presents game stats for the werespider in its human and hybrid form, as well as three new feats appropriate to such characters.

187939.name: The Sleeping Imperium
187939.description:
From the introduction:

Here before you lies the wisdom of the ages: the accumulated knowledge of the Blarch, the Notwi, the Chirga, and the magnificent Advawi; the utterances of sage and Vadabaule; the whispers of the departed dead to the movha'jiit; the howls of colliding stars and dying worlds; and the secrets of the Unknowable Other. Before you is the Encyclopedia Imperium, collected by the agents of the Emperor, in this, the sixteen thousandth year of his reign. Read, and be enlightened.

User summary:

The Sleeping Imperium is an ambitious and major implementation of the D20 system in a science fantasy setting. The game was published in various formats including this HTML presentation of the rules. The major HTML sections published include:


Encyclopedia
Rules
