Many of the individual sections of the HTML were released as RTF documents; other sections were released in slightly different formats as PDF documents. Note the "2000" version of the website offered the rules as a single monolithic HTML page.

187940.name: Ioun Eater
187940.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each release for Crawthorne's Catalog of Creatures for the Pathfinder RPG presents a single, new creature for your Pathfinder RPG game, as presented by the famous and retired monster hunter and adventurer, Lord Crawthorne. Each release presents game stats for the new creature, as well as three adventure ideas to help insert them into your game.

An unusual and diminutive construct, the Ioun Eater is solely motivated by its desire to seek out and swallow ioun stones to bring back to its master. It will go wherever it needs to find them, taking them without pause or permission. As it feasts upon ioun stones, the construct grows, gaining strength. It can also expel an ioun stone it has previously swallowed, transforming the artifact into an explosive attack.

187941.name: Suke'jha: The Way of the Inner Self
187941.description:
The Psionics of the Sleeping Imperium

From the introduction:

Suke’jha: The Way of the Inner Self is a comprehensive psionics system for use with the Sleeping Imperium d20 Campaign setting.

This document assumes that you are using The Grim-n-Gritty Hit Point and Combat Rules. These rules provide some variants that make combat much more deadly for characters and creatures in your campaign setting.

187942.name: Grim-n-Gritty Hit Point and Combat Rules
187942.description:
For Use with Dark Fantasy or Horror-based Settings

From the introduction:

In a typical d20 game, a character can suffer tremendous physical damage without batting an eye. Arrows poking from his body like a porcupine, flesh still flaming from a recent fireball attack, and a toothy beast gnawing on his leg, the character strides about with aplomb, no more inconvenienced than if he had chipped a fingernail.

These rules, however, are not for that type of campaign. They are provided as alternative rules for a setting where the fights are quick and brutal, where the monsters are unstoppable and terrifying, and where the players must be very careful or end up very dead. They are designed for a setting where a man can die painfully from a single sword stroke and the claws of the beast can rend even the most skilled warrior from crotch to throat.

187943.name: Wi and Var
187943.description:
Creatures of the Sleeping Imperium

User summary:

This manual presents two creatures for use in the Sleeping Imperium game. Each create has a description and a "stat block". The manual is atypical in the amount of description it offers for each entry: Chirga and Untvar. Considered are personality, culture, philosophy, diet, reproduction and life cycle, relationships with other species, home lands, and language.

187944.name: Items and Equipment of the Sleeping Imperium
187944.description:
User summary:

This manual includes extensive information on the peculiar monetary systems used in the game as well as typical weapon and equipment lists for adventurers.

187945.name: Bushfighter
187945.description:
From the introduction:

The Bushfighter is a non-magical variant of the Ranger class.

User summary:

Custom class detailed with complete tables, statistics, and so forth. Although this class was designed for The Sleeping Imperium setting it could be utilized in any D20 setting.

187946.name: No Hit Points Combat Rules
187946.description:
Variant Rules for Use with the Grim-n-Gritty Hit Point and Combat Rules.

From the introduction:

This document is a rather long set of variant rules that can be applied to the Grim-n-Gritty Hit Point and Combat Rules to provide Hit Point free combat mechanics. Characters do not have Hit Points. Instead of causing points of damage, weapons inflict wound conditions. These wound conditions hinder a character or creature’s performance, eventually resulting in death.

187947.name: Firearm Mechanics
187947.description:
Variant Rules for Use with the Grim-n-Gritty Hit Point and Combat Rules.

User summary:

This document has lengthy rules for implementing firearms in The Sleeping Imperium campaign. However, the same rules could be used in nearly any D20 campaign. Firearms in this system are deadly. The supplement is unusual for providing a large amount of technically correct details about firearms, and their design, construction, and use. The document does not provide long lists of various firearms as character equipment, however--only a few samples are provided.

187948.name: The Complete Psychic
187948.description:
User summary:

This document provides rules for implementing a psychic "system" in The Sleeping Imperium campaign setting. However, the rules use fairly generic D20 processes and could easily be adapted to any D20 campaign. Included are a Psychic Class, the basic Psychic System, Psychic Skills and Feats, Psychic Prestige Classes, and Psychic Monsters.

187949.name: The Martial Artist
187949.description:
From the introduction:

Between the brute force of the fighter and the spiritual devotions of the monk stands the martial artist. The martial artist is an individual committed to the development of exotic and highly effective combat techniques associated with a specific group of weapons. A martial artist could be a master wrestler, a bare knuckles boxer, a fencer, an adept knife-pit fighter, or spear-master. Unlike the fighter, he does not rely on heavy armor and powerful weapons to accomplish his ends, but rather his own technique. Unlike the monk, he pursues not spiritual power and enlightenment is most likely not a goal of his martial devotions; instead, he seeks mastery of his weapons and himself.

User summary:

Presents The Martial Artist Class (well defined) for use in The Sleeping Imperium campaign setting. However, the product is generic enough to be utilized in any D20 setting. Special maneuvers are allowed, in essence a combination of spell and feat type abilities.

187950.name: The Feats-Based Martial Arts System
187950.description:
From the introduction:

The Feats-Based Martial Arts System is a conservative implementation of a D20 Skills-and-Feats Martial Arts System. In this system, a character expends feats to acquire martial arts Techniques. Each time the character acquires the Martial Arts feat, he learns one new Technique.

User summary:

This product presents a well-defined system for using martial arts in The Sleeping Imperium campaign setting. However, the product is generic enough to be utilized in any D20 setting.

187952.name: Old Masters Memory Game
187952.description:
This game is a variation of the classic Memory.

With the stroke of their paintbrush, the old masters changed the art of painting around the sixteenth and seventeenth century. But also in the centuries preceding and following that, they pioneered with their characteristic painting styles and emotional depictions on canvas. The power of paint, colors, brushes and spatulas, combined with the genius of the painters created a new world, illusive in between reality and abstraction.

Old Master Memory Game challenges you to expand your knowledge and refresh your memory regarding the old masters. In the Old Masters Memory Game you seek and match two different portrait paintings from the same painter. One set of two cards always offers a clear relationship or clues. These vary from painting style to visible attributes such as colors, flowers and head dresses, or color and facial expression.

boardgamecompilation: Clinic Expansion: ICU free bonus tile
187953.description:
Clinic Expansion: Medical Dossier 3, the third expansion for the CliniC base game, contains:


5 Virus + new orange and red cubes
Public works tiles
Pregnant women
Satellite dish tiles


The ICU PnP tiles and rules are included in this last dossier as well as an official solo variant.
187953.name: Clinic Expansion: Medical Dossier 3

187954.name: State of Decay - Breakdown
187954.description:
"You've survived State of Decay. Now it's time to move forward and tell your own story. Take on an endless campaign with twists and turns based entirely on your own choices. Build up your score in the face of an ever-escalating zombie threat, and compete with survivors around the world. Complete challenges to unlock new heroes with unique weapons and skills. The deeper you go, the tougher it gets, and every choice is yours."

Breakdown is State of Decay's first DLC, which was released on both Steam and XBLA, on 29th November 2013. It adds a new game mode, Breakdown, featuring new melee weapons, firearms, playable characters, and being an infinite sandbox mode, in which one could play the game (in theory) forever.

http://stateofdecay.wikia.com/wiki/Breakdown

187955.name: State of Decay - Lifeline
187955.description:
Lifeline is the second DLC for State of Decay. It is set in the city of Danforth and focuses on a group of US Military soldiers.

The player controls Greyhound One — a small surviving unit sent to the fallen city of Danforth to rescue scientists, researchers and civilians who are deemed critical to investigating and fighting the outbreak.

Features:


A new story and missions revolving around the military involvement in the outbreak.
A new map; considerably more urban than Trumbull Valley.
New 40 Firearms, many of which are of military-grade.
New traits and character information.
New vehicle, the Military Pickup.
New Lifeline: Siege feature.
Danger Zones
New Radio Options
Multiple Possible Endings


http://stateofdecay.wikia.com/wiki/Lifeline

187956.name: SOL Lite
187956.description:
From the introduction:

Over the years, there have been a number of RPGs that have been labeled as Generic, Universal, Multi-Genre, or Customizable. The goals of these systems are to allow players to adventure in any number of worlds and still make use of the same core of rules. However, the often fall short of the ultimate goal - to be playable in any setting without having to make changes in the rules.

An Omniversal Roleplaying system would allow you to play anything from gods to viruses. Bug-eyed aliens would be able to play alongside fantasy wizards and use exactly the same rules.

SOL Lite is a cut-down version of the complete SOL rules. Everything is here that will allow you to play in modern or even historical settings. We have even included templates from our Outsider Chronicles series. It is free for your own personal use and to share with your friends.

We hope you enjoy the ride.

187957.name: SORD Fantasy Setting
187957.description:
From the introduction:

This setting was built for my own personal universe, and I urge you, the gamer, to alter this fantasy setting to your own liking. As with every setting made to the base SORD system, the GM will develop 'house-rules' to cover the many aspects a particular universe contains. Often, these 'house-rules' can be taken from other gaming supplements and adapted to SORD, or the GM can simply create them using his/her experience with Role-Playing Games and raw imaginative power. It is up to you to decide what is the best way to go.

187958.name: SORD Character Sheets
187958.description:
User summary:

The SORD system is fairly formula heavy and numerous game statistics are derived. Most of these can be developed at character creation time. The SORD Character Sheets help speed the process and ensure that characters are created in accordance with the basic game rules. The sheets are atypical of game accessories in length and also complexity. Like the entire SORD suite of products, the SORD Character Sheets are presented in ASCII.

187959.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Monkey is ambitious, malicious and likes to play games. He wants to challenge the Wiseman to gain the keys of the temple. The Wiseman, trusting in his skills and wanting some peace, proposes a challenge to the monkey to take place in the sacred court. The first to reach the opposite side is the winner and will become the master of the temple — the senseï.

The rules of Senseï are simple, yet the depth of the game is infinite. On your turn, you can move two stones and send your character across the game board. Your goal is to block your opponent and at the same time to find a path to victory. There are two ways of playing: the Arashi variant is played without limits of movements and the Shizukana is played with a more Zen-like challenge.

Senseï is a new edition of Diaballik, and you can use either the original rules for that game or the new rules that allow players to move pieces as many squares as they want, which changes gameplay greatly.
187959.name: Senseï

187960.name: Arthurian Avalon: Chivalry Reincarnated
187960.description:
From the introduction:

Arthurian legends persist and never go away. In our current view of the world, they are still represented through various phrases and words. If one is a 'Galahad', he is pure at heart and innocent. 'A Knight in shining armor' is an honest and honorable hero with a flare for romance. We constantly see movies and programs such as Excalibur and First Knight that reflect this noble era. Like the ballads of Robin Hood, the legends never die. With the System Of Role Development (SORD), the chivalrous time of Arthurian mythology will once again come to life, but in a very different and innovative way. Player Characters can choose to be descendants of legendary characters in Arthurian history.

187961.name: The Continental Realm of Ethaerios: Sections 1 – 4
187961.description:
From the introduction:

This fantasy supplement was designed to provide the Game Master with the basic cultures, professions, skills, and materials that constitute the main Continental-Realm called Ethaerios. A Continental-Realm is defined as a specific area of land and water which occupies a given area on the surface of Grand-Talanios--a massively large planet the size of Jupiter but with hundreds of continents and a vast amounts of water.

User summary:

The complete setting was published as a series of three documents: Section 1-4, Section 5, and Section 6. This document includes:


Section 1 - Introduction
Section 2 - Cultures
Section 3 - Professions
Section 4 - Society

187962.name: The Continental Realm of Ethaerios: Section 5
187962.description:
From the introduction:

Skills are usually taught through professional assistance, such as a savant, master, trainer, experienced individual, or even Sagelord as in the case of the Immortalist. However, with the proper techniques and resources, anyone can be self-taught at an exponentially slow rate. The student can never exceed the teacher's Skill Level because of the obvious fact that the teacher cannot provide training beyond his or her capabilities. Therefore, many students often seek out specialized and rare individuals to achieve Skill Levels beyond the 10th Skill Level.

User summary:

The complete setting was published as a series of three documents: Section 1-4, Section 5, and Section 6. This document includes:


Section 5 - Skills

187963.name: The Continental Realm of Ethaerios: Section 6
187963.description:
From the introduction:

In most gaming systems, the mystical, magical, supernatural, or strange force of energy exists as part of the universal make-up. In SORD, the Focus attribute gives the character the means to use such powers, even though it is not required in every setting. Each specific focus skill (a spell, a unique force, supernatural power, etc.) will be termed a 'Power' or 'Power-skill' in this appendix for simplification.

User summary:

The complete setting was published as a series of three documents: Section 1-4, Section 5, and Section 6. This document includes:


Section 6 - Magic of Ethaerios (Spells & Magical Items)

187964.name: Sorol
187964.description:
From the introduction:

Sorol is an earth-like planet in a far distant galaxy.

User summary:

Sorol is presented as a Wiki (the Sorolpedia) and accepted user input. The world is a generic fantasy setting that is notable for being extensively geographically developed. The Wiki features numerous maps of various types (geographical, political, populations, etc.) which often are interactive and/or feature zooming. Additionally, a Google Earth implementation was provided via KML file overlays.

The planet has fourteen major regions, numerous peoples, and a timeline. Some Wiki pages included functionality to be downloaded as PDF files.

187965.name: Steampulp
187965.description:
From the introduction:

Steampulp details a constructed world that draws on sources ranging from Regency-Era England to the Atomic-Scare 1950s, with an emphasis on Steampunk and Pulp Adventure. The world can be divided into about 17 distinct regions, each with its own character.

User summary:

Steampulp is presented as an online Wiki. It accepts input from registered users and undergoes routine updates. The Wiki presents locations, history, inhabitants, and organizations. The world is notable for the number of high-quality, very high-resolution maps available.

187967.name: For Queen and Planet
187967.description:
The sweep of the red Sudanese desert, scattered with thorny trees and pierced by black basalt outcrops is the setting for this cinematic rule set. The whirling dervish, the fanatical Ansar and the lonely British foot soldier far from home are the combatants.

With these rules, you can take the role of the British commander tasked by the Queen with maintaining crown rule in distant, inhospitable lands or the local emir, committed to exercising his own free will over the natives who will fight with all their blood, sweat and tears.

For Queen and Planet is designed to balance the mass and ferocity of the local peoples against the technology and training of the Colonial powers and to provide a fair and reasonable struggle for both imperial General and local Emir.

For Queen and Planet - Making Colonial Wargaming fun!
This rule set includes:

All rules necessary to play either a colonial or VSF version of the game.
An alternative timeline for VSF genre play.
Unit lists detailing British, British-colonial, Ansar, Beja and Cephalopod forces.
A nine-scenario campaign that will allow you to play your way through the Mahdi’s initial rebellion against Egyptian garrison forces all the way through to the siege of Khartoum.
A quick reference sheet for most common information.
A one-page how to do things to help you get comfortable with the rules.
A blank unit command sheet.

CAMPAIGN SCENARIOS

Each of the scenarios in this rulebook is written to be fought as a pure colonial battle, but it is very easy to add a VSF flare to any scenario or battle you fight with this rule system. I have included an addendum (in italics) to each ‘colonial’ battle to allow you to make it a VSF battle. Play balance will not be affected by converting colonial battles to VSF battles.

The Rise of the Mahdi Scenarios:

1) First Battle of El Obeid - Dec 1881 Egyptian vs. Ansar
2) Second Battle of El Obeid (or Hick's Folly) - Nov 1883 - British lead Egyptians vs. Ansar
3) First Battle of El Teb (or Baker's Teb) - Feb 4, 1884 - British lead Egyptians vs. Beja
4) Second Battle of El Teb - Feb 29, 1884 - British vs. Beja
5) Battle of Tamai - March 13, 1884 - British vs. Beja
6) Siege of Khartoum - ~May 1884 - Ansar sieging British lead Egyptians
7) The Battle of Abu Klea - Jan 17, 1885 - British vs. Ansar
8) The Battle of Kirbekan - Feb 10, 1885 - British vs. Ansar
9) The Battle of Tofrek - March 22, 1885 - British vs. Beja/Ansar

187968.name: Sometimes:  Success Requires Sacrifice
187968.description:
User Summary

You start off in a darkened room and make progress every time you die, since that death illuminates a section of the map. You are seeking the portal to the next level, trying to do so with as few deaths as possible.

187969.name: Battle Sails
187969.description:
User Summary

Choose one of the leading European nations in the Caribbean - England, France, Holland or Spain. Develop technologies such as damage bonus, shipbuilding or espionage to name but a few. Build forts to better defend your territories, build merchant ships to increase your income and, of course build plenty of warships. Hunt for treasure, engage in diplomacy or, simply, wage war. Your goal is to control all 20 regions of the Caribbean.

187970.name: Black-ops, Aliens & Monsters
187970.description:
User summary:

In Black-ops, Aliens & Monsters, character abilities are defined by Skills, and every Skill has a numeric rating called a Skill#. New characters typically have a numeric rating of 15 in each Skill#, though they can buy up the score by using Background Points, which allow several types of character customization during generation. Characters have eight Broad Skills and seven Combat Skills. Characters also have Body Points and ERG, both of which start at 15.

The eight Broad Skills include Athletics, Intellect, Interpersonal, Naturalist, Overall Competence (the "catch all" skill), Shifty, Technical, and Trades. The seven Combat Skills include four Melee Skills and two Ranged Skills. The Melee Skills are: Melee Attack, Sinews (extra damage), Multiple Attacks, and Two Weapons. The Ranged Skills are Marksmanship and Shooting with the Off-Hand. Finally, characters have one Defensive Skill: Defense.

Characters do not have "classes" but the rules do provide character templates which allow for rapid character builds along a concept. The included scenario finds the characters investigating around a newly active volcano.

187971.name: A Tangled Web
187971.description:
From the introduction:

Anobleman’s only son and heir has been kidnapped, held by an unscrupulous group of bandits whose ransom demands include a family relic long since buried in the family crypt. Unfortunately, something terrible has taken residence in the crypt, and the nobleman needs the item before it is too late to save his son. Perhaps he can enlist the aid of a group of adventurers, who have become rather famous in the area, to help save his son.

User summary:

Standalone PDF publication of adventure originally appearing in Campaign Magazine (Issue 4 - Jul/Aug 2002).

187972.name: Monkey Beach
187972.description: Join the quest and help the monkey pirates find their long-lost buried treasure. Feel for the hidden treasure shapes within the cloth island and guide them out through beach, waterfall or jungle openings. Quickly collect your treasures before the volcano erupts!

187973.name: Train Line: Chicago
187973.description: Train Line: Chicago Edition is a multi- player card base strategy board game that will test your wits, competitive spirit, board navigation, and card management skills. You utilize 3 elements on two boards on you quest to get the required amount of pawns in seated spaces before your opponents. You use the boarding dye to determine entry to train or lost of turn, number cards to move along board spaces or action cards; cards with specialized abilities to increase your chances of being victorious.

187975.name: Spiritual Warfare: The Summoned
187975.description:
From the introduction:

A group known as the Order of the Noctra are collecting elements to summon a very powerful demon god that they worship called RA'A. Once the demon is summoned, it will spell certain disaster for the nearby town of Iconium Forge. The Realm Knights must inquire as to where the Noctra are summoning the demon and prevent them from doing so.

187976.name: Covil: The Dark Overlords
187976.description:
You are the dark Overlord
­— The ritual is complete. At your command, the Covil rises. A living and breathing fortress now profaned by the greed crystals. Inside its dungeons lies the gate to the dark lands where countless hordes of chaotic beings were enslaved for so long. This time you will have your revenge.

-
In Covil: The Dark Overlords you will struggle for the supremacy of the regions surrounding an isolated town. Each player controls a Dark Overlord with unique powers and countless troops of minions to “defend the world from enemy hordes”, bring “peace and security to the territories” — at a cost, of course!

The game consist of 4 days, each of them is divided in 3 phases:
Phase 1: Morning (Summoning troops)
Phase 2: Afternoon (Performing Actions)
Phase 3: Night (Dominance and Clean-up)

At the end of the 4th night phase, the game ends. The player with most Victory Points wins.

187977.name: Spiritual Warfare: Blaze of Glory
187977.description:
From the introduction:

The Late 1800's is what some people have branded the "Wild West". Frontier towns and cities, Cowboys, Indians, and Gold Mines. But mixed within this untamed time lurks something wicked. Demonic being burst through a maelstrom and are causing mayhem in the dusty streets of the American Wild West.

Demon hordes destroy farms and stalk the unsuspecting. The accuser of the brethren is hot on the trail of destruction and you may be the only thing that can stand in his way. With the Bible in your hand and a six-shooter on your side, you may by the grace of God, help to gun down these demonic terrors in a blaze of glory. The day of evil is here, will you be able to stand?

187979.name: Kerekítő kukucska
187979.description:
This is a very simple, child memory game, which is based on Hungarian nursery rhymes. There are different figures of nursery rhymes on the game tokens.

Contents:

36 tokens
5 big tokens
1 die

In the setup you get 5 tokens and place them on the game field, and then you cover them with 5 big tokens.

If it's your turn you need to roll the die. Then you need to guess which token is under the big token that has the same color as your roll. If you can guess it, you get the token, if you make a mistake you don't get anything.

The game ends when all tokens are given out.

The player with the most tokens is the winner of the game.

187982.name: Teblo
187982.description:
Teblo is an abstract strategy game. It is played on a square board (12x12). Each player has a pawn and 25 square pieces.

The board shows 4 colored starting squares. Players start their pawn on their own starting square, diagonally opposite to each other. Their goal is to reach to starting square of the opponent.

On his turn a player can either move his pawn horizontally or vertically or place one of his square pieces on the board.
These pieces can only be placed on the white squares. Pawn can enter the colored squares too.

The square pieces block the opponents route to the goal square, but not your own (you can place your pawn on top of it and pass your own piece in the next turn).

A player may never block the goal square completely.

You win as soon as you reach the goal square with your pawn.

187983.name: Sir! I'd Like To Report A Bug!
187983.description:
User Summary

You are a playtester for video games travelling between work and home. Each day your world becomes more surreal as odd things happen to you, the sun spitting fireballs or people sticking to you. Your aim is to jump over your barriers and avoid your problems using the cityscape as a way to change levels on buildings.

187984.name: Adijuh
187984.description:
Adijuh (Адиюх) is a rather new game, which combines the rules of Russian checkers, stacking and a unique way to win. The game was created by Viktor Pankovich in 2007. It has become quite popular in Russia, where a lot of discussion is going on at several game forums. There are postal tournaments and numerous problems have been composed recently that show the beauty of this game.

The game has basically the same rules as Russian Checkers. However, captured pieces are placed beneath the capturing piece and so columns are formed (similar to Bashni). A king can only move if it captures. After the capture the king becomes a normal piece again unless it ends its turn on the opponent's back row. The game stops if a player cannot make a move. The winner is the player who has got more pieces of either color in the opponent's half of the board. The sum of all points is always 24.

Adijuh is played with a standard Chess board and Checkers pieces.

187987.name: Bid, Bluff & Buy
187987.description:
To play Bid, Bluff & Buy, you don't have to "know the facts" to win. . . you just need to be able to bluff, cajole and have fun. The game consists of 20 different auctions in five different genres: Music, Movies, Television, Sports and History. Players begin each auction with $30,000 and try to accumulate the most wealth by buying items in the auctions with the highest value. The items in this game were actually sold in a real auction and the Estimate, Opening Bid and Sold Price were the prices recorded at the auction on the date identified on the card and in the catalog.
Whoever has the most wealth at the end of the auction wins the game. However, if the Auction House has the most wealth, then the House wins!

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
187988.description:
Pyramid Arcade is a compilation of 22 games that can be played with "Looney Pyramids" and assorted other components. Looney Pyramids are colored pyramids in three sizes that can nest together.

The plan for Pyramid Arcade is to focus on games that can be played with three or fewer trees of each color, and include ten colors of pyramids (ninety in all). Pyramid Arcade will also include numerous boards, nine dice, and a rulebook explaining all the games.

The individual games are:

Black Ice
Color Wheel
Give or Take
Hijinks
Homeworlds
IceDice
IceTowers
Launchpad 23
Looney Ludo
Lunar Invaders
Martian Chess
Petal Battle
Petri Dish
Powerhouse
Pharaoh
Pyramid Shambo
Treehouse
Twin Win
Verticality
Volcano (v3.0, aka Fiesta Caldera)
World War 5
Zark City
187988.name: Pyramid Arcade
boardgamepodcastepisode: TGT 013: Pyramid Arcade

187989.name: FLAG Force
rpgseries: Cartoon Action Hour Season 3 Series Book
187989.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this Cartoon Action Hour: Season 3 series book by Rob Wieland, we follow an international team of heroes that fights against the Starmada, an alien race that has taken over the world and continues to oppress the human race. Even armed with their wits, skills and bravery, the protagonists find themselves in an uphill battle when faced with superior technology and numbers. Can they overcome the odds to rid Earth of its conquerors from outer space?

This 15-page PDF contains:

Information about the series, including details about both seasons of the show
3 episode seeds to get your group into the action
Guidelines for creating your own Player Characters
A quick system for creating Starmada Officers
6 ready-to-use Player Characters, plus a variant version of two characters (reflecting how said characters were depicted in the second season of the show)
1 ally
3 villains
3 types of villainous Goons
5 vehicles (plus rules for customizing Starmada vehicles)
1 Playset

187990.name: Fortunes Wheel Roleplaying Game Quickstart
187990.description:
From the Introduction:

While you could construct a narrative and thus tell a story that is planned out very carefully in advance, you could also use random elements, visual cues or clues and construct one through the participation of several people. Fortunes Wheel is a framework for doing that. It exists first and foremost as an aid for playing role playing games (or "RPGs") that are both fully improvised and made up as you go along, or which use various re-created settings. It can also be used to just tell stories or as a way of kick starting creativity and ideas or for resolving actions.

Most RPGs tend to fall back on giving you a set of rules, often fairly complex ones. In Fortunes Wheel the idea is instead to give you a basic system or tool set tied to some core concepts. In it there are suggestions of some methods, but these are not intended to be hard and fast rules, just possible ways of doing something to push the narrative along.

There are a few simple ideas that have some far reaching consequences at the heart of Fortunes Wheel. If you keep these in mind when playing they will help enhance both your enjoyment and understanding of it. Everything is flexible rather than hard and fixed, so if a method to do something feels right, use it, but if not, use something else (the 'rule' of common sense). This is not a rule book, it is an approach with some examples you can use. Before Dungeons and Dragons (the forerunner of most of these RPGs and story games) saw print instead of all the complex dice rolls one method used to resolve conflicts was playing rock, paper, scissors, stone. Sometimes complexity and rules can really help, but they can also get in the way and limit you.

187991.name: Gan Astral Knight
187991.description:
From publisher blurb:

For the Forge!

For thousands of years the noble Astral Knights stood guard against the Manes, a race of starfaring shapeshifters bent on conquest of the galaxy. Eventually the Manes created the Dreadnaught, a living construct of magic and technology that destroyed the Astral Knights and their homeworld of Tolemac. But a single knight, Gan, called upon his people's Astral Forge for the power to stop the Manes. He was transformed into a living suit of armor, the Astral Forge granting him the power he needed only so long as he used it solely for good and to serve the free peoples of the galaxy. Gan defeated and destroyed the Dreadnaught, but thousands of Manes escaped the vessel and fled Gan's justice. Now, armed with his translator, Astral Gate, and Dimensional Nullifier, Gan seeks to hunt down and defeat the remaining Manes, and protect freedom throughout the galaxy!

187992.name: Mercury and Violet
187992.description:
From publisher blurb:

He's Swift. She's Lucky.

Before they were Mercury and Violet, the Niemczyk twins were just Pavel and Wioletta, Polish orphans living a harsh life of foster homes and abuse. When their Meta powers flourished, they were taken in by Polarity, the powerful master of the Meta nation group, who claimed he just wanted safety and peace for their kind. But when he was revealed to be a warmonger, Mercury and Violet used their superhuman speed and probability manipulation to assist in defeating Polarity, and have since gained a pardon in return for joining the hero group the Sentinels.

Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

187993.name: Stranded in Time
187993.description:
User Summary

You play a woman who together with her uncle and a writer friend explore a mystery. There are puzzles to solve and objects to find in order to progress through the game and the plot.

187994.name: Abstraction Golems Expanded
187994.description:
From publisher blurb:

In conjunction with d20PFSRD and Rogue Genius Games, the Four Horsemen have developed some out-of-the-box golems perfect for creating interesting scenarios for even the most experienced players! Run, don't walk, to pick up this volume which offers abstraction golem templates such as Fate, Hatred, and War!

187995.name: A Sundered Fragment: Races & Classes
187995.description:
From publisher blurb:

For those not interested in the setting for A Sundered World, whether you prefer a more "normal" setting or don't run games, this product just gives you the player options:

10 races, complete with advanced moves. Think of them like compendium classes that you automatically qualify for.
6 classes
New weapons, armor, materials and spirits for weapons and armor, and dungeon gear.
A behind the scenes look at the races and moves.




This product comes with character sheets for each class, plus a completely blank one (good if you are taking lots of race moves).

187996.name: Admin Toolkit: Agency Uniforms
187996.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the White Lies RPG, players can armor their agents with three grades of protective gear. While this is functional in game mechanics terms, it's not very interesting to imagine. Admins should encourage their players to describe their armor in ways such as "leather jacket" or "bulletproof vest" or even "tactical military armor." But being descriptive isn't the only way one can customize the protection their agent wears.

Spies like gadgets. In the equipment chapter of the core rulebook there are specific upgrades available to weapons and vehicles to add spy features to them, making them unique while expanding the capability of the agent. Armor should be no different. In this light supplement, agents can be provided or can purchase a new classification of protective gear: the Agency Uniform.

What makes the uniform unique isn't just that it can look like anything the player wishes (bespoke suits, tactical security gear, even disguises). What makes the uniform unique is that it can be equipped with any number of standardized agency upgrades, such as gecko pads, faraday weaves, defensive bracers, concealed parachutes, and white noise emitters. Gadget up your agent with the Agency Uniform.

187997.name: The Initiate's Path
187997.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Initiates Path details an exciting introduction for new members of the elite Guild of Shadows. The skill and ingenuity of new guildsmen is tested in this open-ended adventure, which is suitable for a party of any combination of rogues.

187998.name: Planetbase
187998.description:
User Summary

Guide a group of space settlers trying to establish an outpost on a remote planet. Grow food, collect energy, mine resources, manufacture bots, and build a fully self-sufficient colony.

187999.name: Advanced Skinwalkers
187999.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heroes That Go Bump In The Night

Among the shapechangers, skinwalkers stand alone as defenders of humanity against the evil beings that hunt by the moon’s pale light. Shunned by the very people they fight to protect, skinwalkers prowl the night as creatures divided: part human and part beast. This unique state of being is both their blessing and their curse. With these new options, you can play a skinwalker character: a beast of nature using your powers for good!
Book of Heroic Races: Advanced Skinwalkers gives you everything you need to play a skinwalker character. This 22-page supplement features:

Standard Racial Traits for playing a skinwalker, an alternate racial trait, and 3 new character traits to customize your character for this unique play experience
17 New Character Class Options including 4 new archetypes like the beastwalker druid and the kinetic assailant soulknife, 4 new barbarian/skald rage powers, 4 new hunter animal foci, and the lunar shaman spirit
7 New Feats expanding on shapeshifting abilities
6 New Shapeshifter-Themed Spells
4 New Magic Items
3 New Deities, each with a unique perspective on defending the wilderness
Details on skinwalker adventurers as well as suggestions on how to incorporate this race into your own campaign

188000.description:
We are pressed on all sides and the enemy is closing in. Word has come down from the Commander-in-Chief and our only order is "Attack!"

From designers Mike Selinker and Sean Brown comes the Attack! Deluxe expansion for Glenn Drover's Attack!, which adds to the base game by setting the stage for combat on the Pacific Front. Attack! Deluxe, which replaces the out-of-print Attack! Deluxe Expansion, places you squarely on the frontlines as you vie for world domination. Speak softly or swing your big stick in order to conquer your neighbors and expand your economy.

Attack! Deluxe introduces bold new mechanisms with expanded Naval Combat, player government styles, new technology research, and seasonal combat. As the leader of a world power, you can choose to control trade routes on all seven seas or you can blitz the sovereign shores of your nearest nations by land: build the biggest army and crush your enemies before they crush you, or choke the life out of them by cutting their economic supply. All is fair in love and war after all!

The cards in Attack! Deluxe replace all of the Attack! base game cards to ensure uniformity, with these cards having better quality base card stock and linen finish with playing card varnish. Attack! Deluxe includes a plastic insert tray to hold all of the pieces from both Attack! and Attack! Deluxe. To use Attack! Deluxe, you need these components from Attack!:


Western Theater game board
678 Army Unit miniatures (six sets of 113 pieces in six colors: infantry, artillery, tanks and planes)
8 Red Army battle Dice
2 Blue Order dice
188000.name: Attack! Deluxe
